name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Fresh and lively, with juicy blackberry and pear aromas and flavors wrapped in a crisp, fragile layer of tannins. Needs time to soften. Best from 2010 through 2014. 840 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rosé
review: Refreshing, a tad sweet, with watermelon, strawberry and raspberry fruit. Lively acidity and a spicy cinnamon edge on the finish. New from Isabel and Michael Mondavi. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rosé Deep
review: Ripe and full-bodied, with a dense pink hue, plus chocolate, cherry and spice aromas and jammy, somewhat tannic plum and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 1,450 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Orange blossom, tangerine and honeysuckle notes are smooth and refreshing, leading to a terrific tangy acidity and persistence on the finish. Drink now. 4,225 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Creamy-textured, with a pleasant earthy streak running through the mix of ripe pear, melon and apple. Clean and refreshing, this is ready to enjoy. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rosé
review: A jammy, juicy rosé, with aromas of cherry and spice and ripe, full-bodied flavors that end on a tannic note. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Floral, honeysuckle and fig aromas are elegant and lively on the palate, with a delicate mouthfeel. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Fara
review: Mature aromas of licorice, spice, dried berry and leather are the hallmarks of this savory red, which is balanced, with bright acidity and well-mannered tannins driving the long, spice- and mineral-inflected finish. Drink now through 2020. 667 cases made.

name: Gattinara Riserva
review: Hazelnut torte, coconut and cherry aromas segue to tobacco, leather and spice notes in this savory red. Shows sweetness at the core, with a long, spice- and mineral-tinged finish. Drink now through 2022. 500 cases made.

name: Ghemme
review: Cherry, licorice, menthol and tar aromas and flavors are matched to a firm, beefy structure in this powerful red. The brisk acidity lends drive as the finish winds down, revealing echoes of fruit, tobacco and mineral. Drink now through 2024. 1,250 cases made.

name: Gattinara
review: Mature yet fresh, this red boasts fading cherry, rose, tar and soy flavors, with accents of leather, tobacco and forest floor. The tannins lean toward dryness on the long, ethereal aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 1,667 cases made.

name: Ghemme
review: Deep and savory, this red exhibits dried cherry, floral, tar, mineral and earth aromas and flavors. Fine length. Leans toward the dry side in balance, so enjoy over the near term. Drink now through 2018. 1,250 cases made.

name: Gattinara
review: A linear style, boasting currant, strawberry, spice, tobacco and earth flavors, this veers to the dry side in the balance, with moderate length. Drink now through 2023. 1,666 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Colline Novaresi
review: Round and supple, evoking cherry, licorice, tar and spice flavors. Balanced and approachable, with freshness and a firm grip on the finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 2,000 cases made.

name: Fara
review: A mix of cherry, licorice, leather and tar flavors are allied to a firm structure in this red, which leans toward the dry side, with a moderately long finish. Nebbiolo, Vespolina and Uva Rara. Drink now through 2020. 666 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Sweet berry and black licorice aromas, with hints of toasted oak, lead to a medium body, offering fine tannins and a medium finish. A little chewy, with slightly aggressive acidity. Better with a little bottle age. A wine from a new small producer. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2011. 255 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A pleasant Brunello with nice plum and coffee character, medium body with soft tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 1,470 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Nice complexity here, showing some mineral, truffle, mint, tobacco and floral notes that are enticing. Very approachable and lovely now, but on the light side.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Slightly old style, with its amber color and cedary, smoky, berry character. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a crisp finish. Drink now. Drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Ripe and nicely balanced, sporting some black cherry, currant and plum flavors and medium to light body. Fine tannins on the elegant, crisp finish make this a smooth drink now.

name: Colline Lucchesi
review: Aromatic and flavorful, with the smokiness and spiciness of new oak. Has ripe cherry flavors and firm tannins, and it's slightly bitter on the finish. Obviously a serious wine, but one that needs to develop some grace. Best from 1993 through 1994.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Very light and watery, clean and simple. Not much to it. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Dry and light; not much fruit left in the bottle. Not imported into the U.S.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Already past its time, this shows leather, tobacco and earth character. Dry and slightly acidic. Barely acceptable.

name: Chianti
review: Firm Chianti with solid tannins and straightforward tar and berry character; medium-bodied with a fruity finish. From the owners of Fattoria di Barbi in Montalcino. Drink now.

name: Chianti
review: Very fresh, featuring strawberry, light earth and cherry character, light body and a grapey finish. From Fattoria dei Barbi. Drinkable now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Amazing. Wonderful aromas of licorice, spice and fruit. Full-bodied and chewy, with big yet tight tannins and a long, mouthpuckering finish. Best after 2003. 420 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Gorgeous aromas of ripe berries, spices and cherries follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a delicious finish. Drink now. 710 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: A big, soft and juicy red, with currant, blackberry and chocolate aromas and flavors. Full and delicious, with lots of fruit and a long finish. This is nearly always outstanding. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese. Best after 2010. 1,250 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: Beautiful aromas of licorice, currant and lightly toasted oak follow through to a full body, with silky tannins and a long, bright finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2008. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: Outstanding blackberry and currant character, with a hint of milk chocolate. Full- bodied, with silky tannins and a medium finish. Chewy and concentrated. Needs time. Best after 2007. 5,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: Fascinating aromas of coffee, berry and tobacco. Full-bodied, with soft and silky tannins and a medium, fruity finish. Balanced red. Best after 2003. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi
review: A delicious and rich CC, offering loads of licoricelike black fruit character, with a hint of coffee and toasted oak. Soft, fruity palate and finish. Needs some time. Best after 2002. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi
review: Rich, smoky berry fruit, with hints of fresh meat and vanilla. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Delicious even now. Shame about the price. Best after 2003. 2,070 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Beautiful aromas of ripe Sangiovese with berry, licorice and light spice. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long finish. Refined. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Pretty plum and berry on the nose. Medium-bodied, with lovely, plummy flavors and a soft, silky-textured finish. Very fine. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Merlot Toscana Guiglielmo Riserva
review: Olive, meat and crushed blackberry follow through to a full body, with soft tannins and a medium finish. Attractive red, but not much Merlot character. Only available in magnum. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: Very ripe aromas of light raisin, blackberry and vanilla. Full-bodied, with soft tannins and a medium, fruity and enjoyable finish. Delicious already, but needs time to come together. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2007. 2,100 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: A balanced and silky red, with berry and tobacco character, medium body and a fresh finish. Needs time. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2005. 4,150 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi
review: Aromas and flavors of plum and spicy vanilla that turn to chocolate. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a delicious finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Has a floral nose, with black cherry, mineral and a chocolate note that develops on the palate, coating the fine tannins and driving through the medium finish. Slightly austere, but pretty. Best after 2009. 580 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Blackberry and vanilla character. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins, ripe fruit and an almost jammy character. Best after 2008. 500 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: A soft and succulent red, with milk, berry and grainlike aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a fresh finish. A bit simple, but delicious. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2002. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Futuro
review: Interesting wine. Intense aromas of ripe plums, grape skins and smoke. Full-bodied, with loads of ripe fruit, soft tannins and a fresh finish. Best after 2000. 400 cases made.

name: Toscana Monticello
review: Exhibits rose and berry, with hints of mint. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and fruity light vanilla flavors. Sangiovese, Cabernet and Merlot. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi Riserva
review: Got to like the aromas of ripe fruit and lightly toasted oak. Medium-bodied, with a citric berry and cherry character. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Monticello
review: Straightforward red with dried cherry and a light currant character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. They made this instead of their top wine, Il Futuro, in this difficult vintage. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet. Best after 2005. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi
review: A little lean, with blackberry and cherry character. Medium body, chewy tannins and a medium finish. Drink now. 2,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico I Massi
review: Light and fruity, with berry and a hint of vanilla character. Fresh, with light tannins and a clean finish. Drink now. 3,080 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Senesi Campale
review: Light and fruity, with a slightly diluted finish.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: Medium-bodied, with a fresh profile of spice, earth and black cherry notes. Not big, but enjoyable. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto
review: Bright and tangy, this light-bodied white offers flavors of fresh-cut apple and candied orange zest, with hints of almond and orchard blossom. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Passerina Offida Passito L'Estro del Mastro
review: An elegant, tawny-tinged light sweetie, with lovely cut to the date, toffee and burnt orange peel notes that remain bright and fresh. The savory finish lingers with a pleasant hint of medicinal herbs. Drink now.

name: Rosso Piceno Superiore Marinus
review: Dark and rich, with a core of ripe, spicy black cherry fruit that's framed by layers of spice, cocoa powder and medicinal herbs. Light tannins frame the finish, which lingers with an aftertaste of cherry. Montepulciano and Sangiovese. Drink now.

name: Extra Dry Passerina Vino Spumante Emmanuel Maria
review: Hints of brioche and vanilla are smoothly integrated with Dijon pear, stone and floral notes in this light-bodied sparkler, with a moderate, tangy finish. Drink now.

name: Marche Zipolo
review: A dark, aromatic red, showing black cherry, olive and wild herb notes backed by rustic tannins, with a bitter almond hint that lifts the finish. Montepulciano, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now.

name: Passerina Marche Cavaceppo
review: A light, piney white, with melon, citrus and fresh herb notes that push through to the savory finish. Drink now.

name: Falerio dei Colli Ascolani Aurato
review: Subtle notes of Bosc pear and green apple pick up a hint of chalky mineral on the finish. Trebbiano, Pecorino and Passito. Drink now.

name: Marche Lu Kont
review: Dense, with dark cherry and black currant notes backed by hints of tobacco and green olive on the savory yet trim finish. Montepulciano. Drink now.

name: Pecorino Offida Navicchio
review: A light yet ripe white, with notes of golden raisin backed by citrus and light lanolin hints on the finish. Drink now.

name: Rosso Piceno Conte Rosso
review: A dark, gamy red, with ripe layers of black cherry and black currant notes that turn herbaceous on the slightly grippy finish. Montepulciano and Sangiovese. Drink now.

name: Chianti Colli Fiorentini
review: Light traditional Chianti with nutty, leather and berry aromas and flavors, light body and a light finish. From Castello Guicciardini in Poppiano. Drinkable now.

name: Rosso Classico California
review: A crisp red with a spicy, leathery accent to the lightish-cherry aromas and flavors. A blend of Sangiovese, Syrah and Zinfandel. 7,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Fairly smooth, with tar, licorice, and black currant notes. A clean, spare wine with a moderate finish. 4,300 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County
review: Simple, fruity and appealing for its bright pear flavors and smooth finish. 5,300 cases made.

name: Extra Dry Prosecco
review: A lightly smoky sparkler, with apricot, ripe Honeycrisp apple, wet stone and anise hints. Well-balanced, with a juicy finish. Drink now. 1,097 cases imported.

name: Moscato Vino Spumante
review: A tutti-frutti sparkler, with fruitcake spices of nutmeg and ginger accenting the dried apricot, dried papaya, honeysuckle and candied citrus peel notes. Lightly sweet, offering a hint of cola candy on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore
review: This shows a soft, creamy texture and lightly juicy acidity, with subtle flavors of Gala apple, almond, peach and mandarin orange. Fresh finish. Drink now. 420 cases imported.

name: Extra Dry Prosecco Treviso
review: Spiced plum, Honeycrisp apple and salted almond notes are backed by lively acidity in this modest, creamy Prosecco, with a smoky finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Prosecco
review: A light-bodied, juicy Prosecco, with ripe apple, almond, candied lemon zest and stone notes. Licorice-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Valdobbiadene Prosecco
review: This smoky Prosecco is soft and creamy, yet balanced, with notes of glazed apple, crushed almond, ground clove and singed orange peel. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Prosecco
review: Fresh and creamy, with hints of candied almond, ripe pear and spice. Subtle finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 800 cases imported.

name: Toscana Boccalupo
review: A good amount of crushed raspberry and cherry in this wine. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a medium finish. Slight dilution on the midpalate. Drink now through 2000. 250 cases made.

name: Val di Cornia Falcorosso
review: Sour and undrinkable, with rather strange aromas of fruit and incense. 580 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: Aging well, with undertones of tobacco, leather and roasted game to the polished dark plum and black cherry fruit. Structured, delivering a persistent finish of fruit and spice. Montepulciano. Drink now through 2017. 150 cases imported.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: Clean-cut and balanced, this medium-bodied red offers light, sculpted tannins and flavors of wild cherry, blackberry, herbed black olive and dried fig, revealing hints of smoke and spice on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Margae
review: Dark and dense red with intense aromas of crushed grapes and wet earth. Full-bodied, with a thick, rich palate. Silky texture. Rich and jammy but not overdone. Impressive. Best from 2005 through 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: This elegant, silky red is bright and focused, with flavors of dried raspberry, fragrant leather, spice and tea leaf, set in a medium-bodied frame. Supple tannins firm the finish. Drink now through 2023. 540 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: Shows pleasant aromas of plum compote, black cherry and a hint of licorice. Full-bodied, with fruit- and chocolate-coated tannins and a relaxed finish. Drink now. 2,130 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Margae
review: Balanced and refined, with lots of ripe berry, forest character. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a pretty finish. Drink now.

name: Pecorino Colline Teatine
review: This is light- to medium-bodied and tangy, with a zesty underpinning to the flavors of melon rind, crunchy white peach, tarragon and pink grapefruit. Creamy and balanced, offering a fresh, minerally finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: A balanced red, with subtle flavors of dried black cherry, leather, star anise, dried marjoram and tea rose. Supple and well-knit. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Fonte Venna
review: A well-knit, medium-bodied red, with notes of crushed black raspberry, ground anise, loamy earth and dried thyme framed by lightly grippy tannins. Drink now through 2020. 12,500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: Very grapey with licorice and spice character. Full-bodied, with lovely silky tannins and a long, delicious finish. A beauty. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Pecorino Colline Teatine
review: Offers attractive aromas of lemon pie, piecrust and dried fruits. Full-bodied, with a rich, fruity palate and a flavorful finish. Slightly thick and oily. Drink now. 1,920 cases made.

name: Colline Teatine Yare
review: Fresh and minerally, with plenty of lemon and green apple character, medium body and a clean finish.  Drink now. 950 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: Shows damson plum and slightly tangy oak character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a medium finish of spice and mineral. A clean, tight package. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: Balanced and silky, with berry, meaty character, medium body and a firm, fresh finish. Slightly hollow center palate. Drink now.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ursonia
review: Showing some age, with notes of game and leather accenting the spicy plum, wild herb and olive notes that hang on through the finish. Drink now.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Fonte Venna
review: Earth and leather notes lead the way in this subtle red, mixing with hints of dried cherry and grilled herb on the lightly juicy palate. Balanced, showing more herb and smoke nuances on the modest finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes.

name: Colline Teatine
review: Very fresh lemon and crisp mineral character. Medium-bodied, with a tangy, slightly tart finish. Drink now.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Margae
review: A little funky, yet this shows fresh berry and Brazil nut flavors, with a light spicy note. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a medium finish. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Fonte Venna
review: Raspberry and spice notes are accented by hints of mesquite smoke and grilled herb in this light, tangy red. Chewy. Drink now.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: Clean and fruity with a raisin and dried fruit character. Medium-bodied, with a light finish. Drink now. 1,650 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo
review: Smells like hung partridge, with very ripe fruit. Full-bodied and thick, with loads of fruit, but the decadent, cheesy character is hard to get around. Some may like it. Drink now.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Fonte Venna
review: A straightforward red, with plum and fresh herb character. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 4,160 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rich wine with lots of blackberry, chocolate and light vanilla character. Full-bodied, with peppery character and a thick, powerful palate. Needs lots of time. Slightly overdone but impressive. Best after 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: There's a good amount of strawberry aromas, with light vanilla and flowers. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Balanced. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2009.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Shows lots of blackberry and cherry character on the nose. Medium-bodied, with bright acidity, but a slightly tart finish. Needs food. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Vigna Macerata Riserva
review: Simple Sangiovese, with dried berry and leather aromas and flavors. Medium body. Light, tart finish. Drying out a bit. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Barbera Amador County
review: Juicy and easy to sip, offering cherry and smoky spice aromas that lead to crisp cranberry and herb notes. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Triumphe Amador County
review: Offers appealingly smoky cherry aromas, which lead to zesty, though modest, spicy plum flavors. Sangiovese, Cabernet Franc and Aglianico. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County Block 2 Vineyard
review: Big, ripe and jammy, with soft notes of baked cherry, spice and sage. Drink now through 2013. 206 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Pian de' Guardi
review: Cherry, chocolate and berry aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate with fine tannins and a medium finish. Elegant and balanced. Best after 2007. 1,400 cases made.

name: Vin Santo del Chianti Rufina
review: Dark amber, with a red tinge. Aromas and flavors of fresh, minty herbs and crème brûlée follow through to a full, silky body. Dense, medium sweet and interesting. Nutty, like sugar-coated almonds. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Pian de' Guardi
review: Simple and fruity, with bright cherry aromas and flavors. Crisp acidity. Fruity finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Riserva
review: Dried cherry and tobacco-tinged vanilla notes on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with a fresh, spicy palate, but this is a little monotonous. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina
review: Simple red with earthy, plummy character, light body and simple finish. Drink now. 3,300 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina
review: A bit subdued, with some plummy fruit character. Simple, medium body. Drink now. 4,100 cases made.

name: Premium
review: Delivers a good amount of blackberry and black currant bush aromas and flavors. It's medium-bodied, with medium tannins and finish. Better in 1998.
Some berry and cherry flavors come through but it's slightly austere and dry. Medium-bodied, with light tannis and light finish. Drink now.

name: Toscana Terrato
review: Wonderful aromas of fruit and tea, with hints of spices and incense. Full-bodied, with very round and silky tannins and lots of ripe berry character, with vanilla and coffee on the finish. Extremely well done. A producer to watch. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Rotone Riserva
review: This is a Chianti Classico with lots of plum, berry and smoky aromas. Its full-bodied, with lovely velvety tannins and a long succulent finish. Very pretty. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Rotone Riserva
review: Intense crushed cherries and berries come from the glass. Full-bodied, with medium round tannins and a long, long, fruity finish. Delicious. Best after 2004. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Rich and well-crafted, with smoky, meaty plum and black cherry aromas that follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with super, silky tannins and a well-balanced, dark chocolate finish. Delicious. Drink now through 2004. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Rotone Riserva
review: A solid Chianti Classico, with plum, cherry and lightly toasted oak character. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and good fruit concentration. Well-done. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Rotone Riserva
review: Impressive aromas of plums, with hints of grilled meat and leather. Medium- to full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a succulent, fine finish. Very refined CC. Drink now through 2006. 650 cases made.

name: Toscana Terrato
review: Exceptionally ripe, with currants, raisins and spices. Full-bodied, with milk chocolate, toasted oak and berry character. Needs some time to come together. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Delicious, with subtle aromas of plum, porcini mushroom and cherry. Medium-bodied, with compacted fruit and tannins. The flavorful finish has a caressing texture. Drink now through 2001. 325 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Fruity, delicious red. Interesting aromas of fresh porcini, dried cherry and berry. Full body. Medium velvety tannins. Grapey aftertaste. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Toscana Terrato
review: Aromas of plum, with hints of dried herb. Full-bodied, with soft tannins and a long vanilla, basil and fruit aftertaste. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Rosehip, berry and mineral aromas follow through to a rather light palate, with fine, tightly packed tannins and a medium finish. Very tight now. Best after 2004. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Appealing aromas of cherries and plums. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a medium finish. Needs a bit more fruit in the center palate but delicious. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A smooth, easy drinker, with black currant and vanilla character. Medium- to light-bodied, with very fine tannins and a light, fresh finish. Good value. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A good Chianti Classico, with subtle berry and plum character. Medium to light body. Fresh finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Rustic and light, with cooked fruit character. 3,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Bright and pure, offering cherry, raspberry, spice and underbrush flavors. Features ample tannins, ripe and mouthcoating, but the beam of acidity drives the fruit, mineral and spice flavors to a lingering conclusion. Combines power and finesse. Best from 2018 through 2035. 0100 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Cherry, dried raspberry and ripe strawberry aromas follow through to a full body, with chewy tannins that are polished and pretty. Long and fruity finish. Reserved now, but shows excellent potential. Best after 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This offers a mix of strawberry and cherry fruit that is very pure, married to an elegant frame. Beautifully balanced, with refined tannins and a mineral-, tobacco- and spice-tinged aftertaste. Best from 2020 through 2032. 916 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of wild and medicinal herbs lead off, with cherry, spice and tobacco flavors. Fleshy and focused, with a long, flavorful aftertaste of fruit, spice and tar. Best from 2019 through 2036. 300 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Very pure and elegant, offering pretty cherry, blackberry, violet and tobacco flavors. Firmly structured and balanced, with a long, tobacco-tinged aftertaste. Best from 2020 through 2033. 400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This red shows fine clarity to the cherry, strawberry and rose aromas and flavors, with hints of tobacco and earth. Displays a firm backbone and an elegant profile overall. Fine length. Best from 2016 through 2033. 300 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This has good acidity, offsetting sweet, ripe cherry, raspberry and tobacco flavors. Fresh and concentrated, with fine balance and a finish of cherry, spice and earth. Best from 2016 through 2033. 500 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Has freshly cut wood, with black cherries and berries on the nose. Full-bodied, with chewy, polished tannins, but also lots of berry and cedar flavors. Needs time. Best from 2011 through 2016. 1,400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Exhibits fine purity and definition, with cherry, raspberry and floral flavors. Tightens up on the finish, revealing plenty of sweet fruit and a metallic element on the long aftertaste. Best from 2016 through 2035. 100 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Cherry and raspberry flavors play off the tobacco, spice and earth notes in this taut, athletic red. Nicely balanced, with a long finish echoing the fruit and tobacco details. Best from 2018 through 2029. 400 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Ignaccio
review: A rich, muscular style, this Rosso delivers ripe, maturing flavors of cherry, leather, tobacco and underbrush. Offers bright acidity and dense, dusty tannins, with a long finish. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A grip of stern tannins puts a hold on the cherry, raspberry and earth flavors in this chunky red. Shy on the finish, though this should soften with time. Best from 2018 through 2028. 900 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Cherry, strawberry and floral aromas and flavors highlight this elegant, firmly structured red. Balanced and long. Improves with air, so cellar short-term or decant now. Best from 2016 through 2026. 1,666 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: There's a beam of cherry in this tightly constructed red that quickly gets lost in the dusty, even astringent tannins. Fresh and elegant, just on the dry side, finishing long with mineral and tobacco. Best from 2014 through 2022. 500 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Beautiful aromas of blackberries, cherries and vanilla follow through to a full-bodied palate, with good tannins and a lightly jammy finish. A year or two of bottle age will really bring it together. This producer is always improving in quality. Best after 2005. 1,460 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This is the best Brunello I have ever had from here. Very aromatic, with light raisin and spice, with hints of chocolate. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, delicious finish. Succulent and fine. Best from 2004 through 2010. 1,415 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Loads of ripe fruit and black pepper. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Big and juicy wine. Best after 2009. 420 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Blackberry, mineral and fresh herbs on the nose. Full-bodied, with lovely silky tannins, a pretty texture and a long finish. Best after 2011.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Cherry candy and strawberry aromas and flavors lead off, with tobacco and black tea notes following. Leans toward the dry, tannic side in the balance, exhibiting moderate length. Best from 2016 through 2024. 791 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Ignaccio
review: Cinnamon and cardamom notes accent the core of cherry in this elegant, succulent red. Has good grip, but shows solid equilibrium and fine length overall. Drink now through 2018. 350 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Balanced and pretty, with berry, cedar and light floral aromas. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a caressing finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A friendly Brunello, with cut flowers and berries on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, featuring fine tannins and fresh acidity. This is a little lean and dry now, but should mellow with bottle age. Best after 2010. 855 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Blackberry and light cherry aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a light finish. Best after 2006. 1,100 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of strawberry and cream, with hints of mahogany. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a ripe fruit character. Slightly alcoholic, but impressive. Best after 2005. 1,300 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: A 2005 Brunello, with very good intensity of fruit as well as coffee and vanilla bean character. This is full and chewy, offering lots of wood tannins. This should mellow with bottle age. A bit aggressive. Best after 2011. 345 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A bit austere and traditional, but some good plum and cedar character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a silky finish. Drink now. 1,110 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Madonna delle Grazie
review: Attractive plum and berry aromas follow through to a medium body, with light tannins and a fruity finish. Simple. Best after 2008. 590 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Ignaccio
review: A traditional-style Rosso, with plum, red fruit and a light leathery note. Medium-bodied, with tightly packed tannins and a long mineral finish. A bit chewy, but nice even now. Best after 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Ignaccio
review: Straightforward red, with bright cherry and light tobacco character. Lovely length. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A bit lean, but good flavors. Aromas of bark and plum with hints of fresh mushrooms. Medium-bodied, with dried-herb and berry flavors and firm tannins. Fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Simple and fruity Brunello in a traditional style. Stewed and earthy aromas and flavors, light tannins and finish. Drink now.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Has some berry and cherry character, but turns short and diluted. 1,365 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very mature. Light ruby, with an amber hue. Light-bodied, with delicate berry and vanilla aromas and flavors and a light finish. 805 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Riserva
review: Rich, concentrated and packed with cherry and plum fruit, this red is just hitting its stride, with licorice, spice and tobacco notes and dense tannins enmeshed in the texture. The long finish is firm and expressive, imparting a savory, mineral aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Black cherry, plum, leather, earth and mineral flavors mark this powerful red. Rich and balanced, with spice and mineral notes echoing on the long finish. Drink now through 2028. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Alluring perfume of truffle, leather, dried cherry and tobacco translates to sweet fruit and spice flavors on the palate. There are still tannins to be resolved, yet this is harmonious and complex, with an expansive finish. Drink now through 2024. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Selezione Il Margone Riserva
review: The combination of intense balsamic and sweet cherry flavors and new oak mesh well in this maturing red. Shows an extra layer of tannins, but this remains harmonious overall, with a broad-shouldered profile. Excellent finish. Drink now through 2025. 750 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Beginning to exhibit some mature aromas of mushroom, underbrush, incense and decaying cherry and berry fruit, this is balanced and vibrant, with some tar and eucalyptus elements on the finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2023. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Deep aromas of licorice, cherry, rosemary, juniper and fresh earth give way to sweet fruit, tobacco and spices in this dense, complex red, which is persistent and stays focused on the long, mineral-tinged finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2022. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Gran Selezione
review: The aromatics are terrific in this muscular red, with flavors of toast, spice and pipe tobacco surrounding macerated cherry. Needs time to resolve the oak. Best from 2019 through 2032. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: This offers ripe, sweet cherry fruit, with fresh mushroom, tobacco, cedar, spice and mineral aromas and flavors. Still firm and fresh, ending with a lingering finish of loam and mineral. Drink now through 2020. 2,900 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Sweet spice, cherry, licorice, tea and mineral aromas and flavors combine in this firm, well-built red. Though lean and muscular, this is also long and complex. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Gran Selezione
review: Dense and chunky, with black cherry, blackberry and pomegranate notes, accented by spice and tobacco. Stays monolithic through the long, dark fruit finish, yet maintains equilibrium throughout. Best from 2017 through 2024. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Cherry and black currant fruit is shaded by floral, tobacco and iron accents in this elegant red. Firm and juicy, with a lingering, chalky finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: This is refined, with flavors of pure cherry, raspberry, mineral and tobacco. Firm and succulent, with a long, fruit- and spice-tinged aftertaste. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Though generous with black cherry and plum flavors, there's also a layer of tannins that ultimately leaves a firm impression. Fruity and balanced overall, with lingering spice accents. Needs air. 5,833 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Violet, black currant, black cherry, cedar and black tea flavors hold court in this sleek, supple red, with a lingering spicy aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 5,833 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: This is fresh, with elegance and a firm tannic structure. Cherry and raspberry notes are pure and this shows harmony and fine length on the spicy aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 6,666 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Gran Selezione
review: A mix of spicy oak, mineral, tobacco and wild herbs accents the core of pure cherry flavors in this vibrant, austere red. The tannins are muscular, and the finish lingers. Best from 2016 through 2024. 2,083 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Starting to show some mature notes of leather, autumn woods, spice and dried fruit, this red is traditional in nature. Firm and chewy, with fine acidity and dusty tannins. The savory aftertaste lingers. Drink now through 2020. 2,916 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Maturing notes of leather, underbrush and dried cherry signal this firm, well-toned red. Shows good balance, with tannins that stay in line. Good with grilled steak or pasta and ragù. Drink now through 2020. 2,916 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Selezione Il Margone Riserva
review: A maturing nose of black currant, cherry, cedar and incense highlights this elegant red. Firmly structured and beautifully balanced overall. Features fine grip on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 583 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Smoky vanilla notes lead off, followed by cherry, leather and char flavors. Elegantly displayed, with a lingering, spicy finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2024. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Loads of blackberries, violets and lightly toasted oak. Full-bodied, with silky, long tannins. A beauty. Very refined. This is the best wine ever from here. Sangiovese. Best after 2006. 900 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: Showing depth to the cherry, raspberry, licorice and spice flavors, this red is balanced and well-structured, with a lingering finish of fruit and spice. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A fluid, balanced red, with a vibrant structure driving the cherry, currant, tobacco and earth flavors. Dusty tannins line the finish. Drink now through 2019. 5,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Plenty of good black cherry and vanilla character. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a fresh finish. Very good for this producer. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Bright and succulent, featuring cherry, strawberry, earth and graphite flavors. Finishes on the compact side, with a pleasant astringency. Drink now through 2020. 5,800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Gran Selezione
review: A modern style, with a core of cherry flavor cloaked in oak spice notes. A firm edge of tannins is yet to be resolved, and this lingers with a resinous note. Best from 2017 through 2023. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Showing development, this red offers black cherry, plum, cedar smoke and autumn leaf aromas and flavors. Dusty tannins grace the finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2019. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: A really beautiful nose of black cherry and berry follows through to a full body, with chewy tannins and a fruity finish. A little chewy. Needs some time. Sangiovese. Best after 2010. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Aromas of blackberry and flowers follow through to a full-bodied palate, with lots of cherry and chocolate character and a long finish. Silky texture. Sangiovese. Best after 2007. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A tough, dense version, showing a fluid feel and displaying plum, cherry, earth and tobacco notes. Drink now through 2020. 5,800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A fruity wine, with plum and berry character and a medium finish. Clean and delicious. Drink now. 4,165 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Fresh and well-balanced, with plum, black cherry and mineral flavors on a medium-bodied palate. Silky tannins and a medium finish, with a hint of licorice. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Riserva
review: A good red, with berry, plum and toasty oak character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a delicate finish. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Shows rich cherry and berry, with hints of orange marmalade and light toasty oak. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a clean mineral finish. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Gratius
review: Fresh and fruity, with plum and berry. Medium-bodied, with delicate tannins and a medium finish. Sangiovese. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: Flavors of cherry, strawberry and underbrush meet a vibrant, tannic structure. Fruity and fresh, with a dry finish. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best from 2015 through 2020. 5,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: A plummy, rich red, featuring jam, light cedar and dried flowers on the nose and palate. Full and juicy. Best after 2010. 3,665 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Starts very earthy, but blows off to reveal some pleasant damson, floral and mineral character. Medium-bodied, with light, fruit-coated tannins and a fresh finish. Best after 2004. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Riserva
review: Very elegant with plum and light vanilla character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins. Slightly dry. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Riserva
review: Fresh floral, red berry and cedar on the nose. Medium-bodied, with good fruit on the palate, turning slightly austere. Too much wood? Best after 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Aromas of coffee and spice, with hints of ripe fruit. Full-bodied, with an undertone of stewed fruit. Soft tannins. Give it a bit of time. Best after 2007. 1,750 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: An interesting nose, with ripe plum and rich mineral aromas, with a lavender note. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a slightly austere finish. Best after 2005. 1,700 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: Cherry, bitter almond and earth flavors mingle in this open, enjoyable red. Light-weight and elegant, with moderate length. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: Attractive aromas of mint and berry follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Sangiovese, Merlot and Montepulciano. Best after 2008. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Very ripe fruit, but slightly earthy. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: There's some cooked fruit on the nose, with plum. Full-bodied, with a tangy, fruity aftertaste. A bit dull. Drink now. 5,800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Easy-drinking, with a good bead of blackberry fruit. Simple fruity palate. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: A simple red, with plum and pepper character. Medium-bodied, with a light finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Il Margone Riserva
review: Earthy, with ripe fruit. Medium- to full-bodied, with soft tannins and a light finish. Simple. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: This is a rustic red with slightly stewed fruit. Good but nothing special. Drink now. 2,600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Rustic and tart. 5,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Volano
review: Weedy and funky. Sangiovese and others. 2,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: This is a polished and beautiful wine, delivering blueberry, light toasty oak and currant character that turns lightly smoky and spicy. Full and very silky, with a long, long finish. This is the new wine from Sting's Tuscan estate on the edge of Chianti Classico near the town of Figline Valdarno. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: Balsamic, underbrush and tobacco aromas and flavors are allied to cherry fruit and a dense, compact frame. In the end, this is balanced, with persistent sweet fruit and fine length. Merlot, Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2015 through 2025. 175 cases imported.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: The black cherry and blackberry fruit is shaded by sweet spices in this polished red, which is beautifully balanced with assertive tannins on the lingering finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet and Merlot. Best from 2014 through 2023. 350 cases imported.

name: Chianti When We Dance
review: A hint of smoke and earth initially blows off, revealing ripe cherry, kirsch, strawberry and floral flavors. Elegant and juicy, with a long, fruit-filled aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases imported.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: Violet, black currant and boysenberry flavors highlight this fruity, supple red, showing abundant support from well-integrated tannins and lively acidity. Fine length. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2022. 200 cases imported.

name: Toscana Casino Delle Vie
review: Aromatic notes of cedar and sandalwood accent the cherry, currant and tobacco flavors in this firm, meaty red, which is vibrant and intense, with a long, spice- and leather-tinged finish. Mostly Sangiovese, with Caraiolo and Colorino. Best from 2014 through 2022. 200 cases imported.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: Burnished by a veneer of resinous oak, this red fields a core of jammy blueberry, black currant, boysenberry and spice flavors. Though rich, this tightens up on the finish. Mouthwatering and tannic. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases imported.

name: Toscana Message in a Bottle
review: Offers intense aromas of violet, bilberry and black currant, with flavors reminiscent of candied black currant. Vibrant, exerting grip on the moderately long finish. Sangiovese, Syrah and Merlot. Drink now through 2019. 3,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Message in a Bottle
review: This is supple, combining richness and elegance. Cherry and strawberry are the core flavors, accented by spice and bitter almond notes. Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Toscana Sister Moon
review: Flavors of juniper, rosemary and earth mingle with cherry notes in this red. The balance tips toward dry tannins in the end. Sangiovese, Merlot and Syrah. 200 cases imported.

name: Chianti When We Dance
review: Ripe and extracted, with black cherry, leather and tar flavors wrapped around a core of lively acidity, showing a touch of gritty tannins. Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Colorino. Best from 2015 through 2021. 100 cases imported.

name: Chianti When We Dance
review: A rich, fruity style, exuding cherry, raspberry, licorice and spice flavors. Finishes with a solid grip of tannins. Drink now through 2015.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Plenty of life in this riserva, full of blackberry and licorice character and silky tannins. Medium-bodied, medium tannins and a lively finish. Delicious now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Delicious, intense aromas of dried cherries and licorice, wonderful ripe fruit flavors; medium-bodied and very soft. Drinkable now.

name: Chianti When We Dance
review: This is sleek, boasting cherry, violet and candied berry flavors. Open and lively, with a slightly tart finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Toscana Casino Delle Vie
review: A wild ride, offering intense balsamic flavors that combine with cherry and raspberry notes. Stiff tannins and an astringent finish complete the experience. Best from 2015 through 2021. 100 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Wonderfully fruity with its raspberry and cherry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh, crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A medium-bodied wine that shows a pretty berry and dried herb character, light tannins and a silky finish.

name: Toscana Casino delle Vie
review: Starting out lush and sweet before the tannins kick in, this is ultimately overripe, with raisin and leather flavors and a quick finish. Sangiovese, Canaiolo and Colorino. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Mouth-puckering wine. Very fresh and lively with delicious dried cherry and citric flavors. Medium-bodied and a zingy finish with fine tannins. Drinkable now, but can cellar.

name: Chardonnay
review: A medium-bodied wine, with aromas of apples and ash, light acidity and a chalky finish. A bit dull. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Decent fruit but rather stemmy, grassy aftertaste. Light in body. Drinkable now.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Fantastic aromas of cinnamon and Indian incense with plenty of ripe fruit. Full-bodied, silky and very long. A beauty through and through. Why wait? Tiny producer making great things. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 475 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Sweet cherry and strawberry fruit is an even match for the briar and tobacco notes and granular tannins in this sleek, intense red. Picks up a mineral element and finishes with a vibrant, long aftertaste. Best from 2018 through 2033. 350 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Though fleshy and dense, this features plum, black cherry, licorice and leather flavors, focused by acidity. Picks up a long tobacco note on the finish, showing fine balance overall. A touch of wild herbs graces the aftertaste. Best from 2018 through 2032. 1,175 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Refined aromas of crushed berry, mineral and clove, with hints of rose. Full-bodied, with wonderfully velvety tannins and a long, sweet fruit and berry aftertaste. A joy to taste. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2009. 430 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of Indian spices, berry and cherry follow through to a full-bodied palate with ultrarefined tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2006. 450 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Shows fantastic aromas of crushed blackberry, with beautiful undertones of cream and vanilla. Full-bodied, with loads of new oak. Perhaps a little too much. But has outstanding fruit, with polished tannins. Best after 2009. 295 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Intense aromas of cedar and ripe fruit, with raspberry and toasty oak. Full-bodied, with sweet, silky tannins and a long, rich, wonderful finish. Pretty and refined, with loads of plum. Best after 2005. 505 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Marked by juicy cherry, strawberry and spice flavors, this red is lively and elegant. Features light, dusty tannins, with the vivid acidity keeping this focused and fresh. Best from 2019 through 2030. 670 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This fluid, supple red evokes cherry, berry, underbrush and spice flavors. On the slim side, with good intensity and a dusty, tobacco-tinged finish. Best from 2014 through 2024. 400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Aromas of roses, blackberries and plums. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and milk chocolate and berry flavors. Long and caressing. Best from 2010 through 2015. 720 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This really has aromas of crushed ripe fruit and flowers. Full-bodied, with very silky tannins and a pretty, refined finish. Beauty. Tiny, serious producer. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2005. 380 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Blackberry and sliced lemon on the nose. Medium- to full-bodied, with medium chewy tannins and a fresh finish. Turns clean and very pretty. Focused and refined. Best after 2011. 325 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Supple and round, with an underlying earthiness, offering cherry and spice flavors. This is bright, with dusty tannins closing in on the finish. Balanced overall, in an elegant style. Best from 2013 through 2023. 692 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Extremely attractive aromas of plum and coffee follow through to a full-bodied palate, with velvety tannins and a medium finish. Delicious already. Very close to the 1999 in quality. Always outstanding. Best from 2006 through 2009. 750 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Balanced and silky, with cherry, raspberry and berry character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a long finish. New on the block and very good indeed. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2003. 435 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A broad, fruit-driven version, whose lively acidity and woolly tannins elevate the cherry, strawberry and baking spice flavors. Balanced and expressive. Best from 2016 through 2027. 775 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A core of sweet cherry highlights this red, whose rich texture is wedded to dense tannins. Spice and tobacco notes add interest, although this leans toward the alcohol in the balance. Burly finish. Best from 2016 through 2026. 362 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Smooth and elegant, showing well-defined flavors of blackberry, black cherry and flowers. Supple tannins make for nice drinking now but it should improve. Better in 1998.

name: Toscana Lorenzo & Isabella
review: Cherry, wild herb, earth and tobacco flavors are the themes in this beefy red. Still firm and grippy on the finish, showing moderate length. Sangiovese, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best from 2019 through 2024. 520 cases imported.

name: Toscana Lorenzo & Isabella
review: Full and soft, with berry, raspberry and milk chocolate aromas and flavors. Layered and delicious already. Cabernet Franc, Sangiovese and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2013. 540 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Strawberry and floral aromas lead to a medium body, with chewy tannins and a medium finish. Lacks a center palate. Slightly diluted. A little disappointing. Drink now. 960 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Offers loads of tight, spicy oak character, with a hint of dried fruit. Medium-bodied, with good ripe fruit and a fresh finish. Best after 2008. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A pretty wine with aromas a nd flavors of berry, cedar and leather. Medium in body, with soft tannins and a fresh finish.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Shows good dark color along with a mouthful of dried cherry, plum and violet flavors. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins. Drink or hold.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Medium- to light-bodied, with some clean berry and firm oak. Stays clean, but this is a bit short and austere. Drink now. 690 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very good indeed. Wonderful aromas of roses, berries and cherries follow through to a full-bodied palate, with a compacted, silky tannin structure and a long, caressing finish. This is the first time I have tasted a Brunello from this producer. Best from 2005 through 2009. 500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Attractive aromas of plum and toasted barley. Medium-bodied, with light tannins, fresh acidity and a medium fruity finish. Drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Soft and plummy, showing delicious flavors, medium body and light tannins. Crisp, lemony finish. Drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: This caresses your palate with round tannins and shows plenty of attractive tobacco and berry flavors.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A bit tired and weedy now. Has some fruit, but hard to get excited about.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Has some fruit, but too light and tired, with cedar and weedy flavors.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: No paradise here. Smelling a bit funky and tasting a bit odd. Hard to recommend. Lean and earthy.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A spicy style, with hints of vanilla, toast, sandalwood and cinnamon accenting the black cherry and plum fruit. Ripe and chewy in texture, this stays fresh and lingers on the finish. Drink now through 2024. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Iron and mineral notes grace this cherry- and strawberry-flavored red, rich and round for the vintage, with a velvety texture, soft tannins and a spicy aftertaste. Best from 2015 through 2027.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rich and round, this red offers a healthy dose of plum, cherry, tobacco and earth flavors. Tight and burly, with grainy tannins on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2028. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This is a delicious and balanced red with plum, cherry and lightly toasted oak. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, long finish. Best after 2008. 400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Fresh and firm, displaying black cherry, tobacco and spice flavors. Elegant, well-proportioned and taut, just showing slightly drying tannins on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2026. 1,133 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Gorgeous plum, cherry and lightly toasty oak character. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Slightly tart midpalate. Very nice indeed. Drink now. 340 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Fresh and fruity, with blackberry, mineral and light spice character. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a medium finish. A little austere.  Best after 2009. 835 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Gea
review: A lean, firm style, showing cherry, cedar and tobacco aromas and flavors. Tight and compact, with moderate length. Best from 2015 through 2020. 500 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Gea
review: Fresh and fruity with hints of plums and tobacco. Medium-bodied, with ripe fruit and a refined finish. Best after 2005. 1,250 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Gea
review: Plummy, with cherry and cedar aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with light, firm tannins. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Toscana Do
review: Extremely ripe, with cedar and leather aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, with soft tannins and a light finish. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2004. 400 cases made.

name: Maremma Toscana Do
review: Shows plummy, jammy character, a medium body and a soft, fruity finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Toscana Do
review: Slightly rustic but some good berry and cherry aromas and flavors. Medium body. Meaty, fruity aftertaste. Blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet, Petit Verdot, Syrah, Alicante and Cesanese. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A lightly firm red, offering berries and a hint of tobacco. Fresh and simple. Austere. Drink now. 510 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Gea
review: Some plum and strawberry character but rather light and diluted.  Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Showing some development, this red evokes sweet cherry and currant flavors, along with porcino, underbrush, leather and spice notes. Supple and harmonious, with lingering iron and mineral elements. Enjoyable now, but no need to rush. Drink now through 2024. 500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Elegant and savory, with mushroom, dried cherry, tobacco and mineral aromas and flavors, matched to an elegant frame. The silky texture is offset by dense, refined tannins. Finishes with an umami theme. Best from 2015 through 2028. 100 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: This is ripe, with plum, black cherry, fig and mineral aromas and flavors shaded by smoke and tobacco accents. Vibrant and expressive, finishing with firm tannins and a long aftertaste of sweet fruit, mineral and spice. Best from 2017 through 2027. 100 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Exotic aromas of boysenberry and loganberry give way to tobacco, earth and spice flavors in this muscular red. Exhibits a hard edge, but pasta or a steak should soften this up. Drink now through 2019. 200 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Balsamic and earth notes lead off, followed by ample cherry and herb flavors. Reveals firm tannins, but stays juicy and persistent on the finish. Drink now through 2016.

name: Barbera California Ragazzo Legnoso Riserva
review: Barbera doesn't get much better in California. Brilliantly fruity, velvety in texture and exuberant with blackberry, currant and a floral touch on the finish. Appealing. Drink now through 1998. 325 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Santa Maria Valley Bricco Buon Natale
review: Loaded with aromas of black cherry, flowers, earth, tobacco and creosote. Expect to wrestle with brawny tannins and pumped-up acidity, but the concentration and length suggest that patience (and spit-roasted wild boar) will yield intriguing results. Best after 2004. 300 cases made.

name: Tocai Friulano Central Coast
review: Rich and creamy, with distinct hazelnut and pear flavors. Judicious use of oak lightly frames the whole. Finishes with a delicate lemon zest. Better than many of its Italian brethren. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Borgo Buon Natale Primogénito Riserva Santa Maria Valley
review: Rich almond and honeyed toast notes mingle with lemon custard flavors. Lingering finish. Tocai Friulano, Pinot Grigio and Pinot Bianco. Drink now through 2003. 400 cases made.

name: Barbera Santa Barbara County Ragazzo Legnoso Riserva
review: Generous and supple, distinctive for its earthy undertones to the ripe cherry and plum flavors. Finishes softly, with a light layer of fine tannin. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Fiano Central Coast
review: Peach and melon aromas give way to a lemon-lime flavored wine. Zippy acids leave a fresh, lively imprint on the tongue. An old Italian grape with a California twist. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Tocai Friulano Central Coast
review: Smooth and silky, full of toasted nut, spicy pear, fresh herb, earth and citrus flavors, with a touch of bitterness. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Arneis Central Coast
review: Offers a spicy anise accent to the core of peach and apple flavors but ultimately, it's simple. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Tocai Friulano Central Coast
review: A juicy core of ripe and spicy peach and nectarine flavors. Turns simple on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Barbera California
review: A light wine that's a bit chewy, with modest flavors of berry and citrus.

name: Barbera-Nebbiolo California Ragazzo Legnoso Riserva
review: This blend doesn't optimize the qualities of either grape. Shows tart plum and berry flavors. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino I Due Cipressi
review: Very focused, concentrated and spicy, with all sorts of exotic accents to the basic raspberry and plum flavors. Hints of anise, nutmeg, tar and vanilla make this a lively, elegant wine that has the balance and firm tannins to keep developing well past 1995. 1,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Slightly bitter aromas and flavors give way to a rich core of anise, plum and tar aromas and flavors, all wrapped in a tough package that needs cellaring to approach drinkability. Best from 1995 through 1997.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A medium-weight wine, with a satisfying combination of cherry, raspberry, chocolate and spice flavors. Moderate tannins and good balance make it fine to drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino I Due Cipressi
review: Big in structure, it needs time for the boisterousness of youth to quiet down. Has plenty of tart cherry and berry flavors, but an earthy aroma is difficult to get past at this young age.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Ripe and gorgeous aromas of blackberry and mineral. Full-bodied, with silky tannins, a lovely texture and a delicate herb and berry aftertaste. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Lovely berry, plum and light spice aromas. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, caressing finish. Serious. I have always been fond of wines from this estate. Best after 2004. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Bright and fruity, with berry, mineral and floral character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a delicate finish. Racy. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Balze
review: Rich and round, with velvety tannins and a long finish. Slightly rustic, but meaty and savory. Sangiovese. Late harvest. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Very balanced and refined, with dried cherry and mineral character, a lovely medium body, refined tannins and a minerally, fruity finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Well-crafted. Very good intensity of blackberry and fresh black truffles. Medium-bodied, with a solid core of fruit. Medium tannins. Medium finish. Drink now through 2004. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Impressively concentrated for a regular Chianti Classico. Good cherry and earthy mushroom aromas. Full-bodied, chewy, with lots of ripe fruit flavors and a long, smoky, earthy, meaty aftertaste. Best after 1999.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Fine example of a traditional-style Chianti. Has subtle flavors of cedar, cranberry and spice that linger on the finish. Fine balance and firm tannins, too. Drink now through 2000. 850 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: A delicious, youthful riserva. Intense aromas of strawberry and violet. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a crisp and lively finish. Will improve, but why wait? Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Wonderful for its smooth texture, harmonious and rich fruit flavors and lingering finish. Not tannic. Drink now through 1999. 400 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Balze
review: A fruity and enjoyable red, with pretty aromas of raspberry, plum and violet. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a crisp finish. From Sangiovese. Drink now. 222 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Balze
review: Pungent style of wine. Plenty of plum, berry and smoke character. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a rich, earthy finish. Drink now. 222 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Medium-bodied, with focused violet and blackberry character and fresh, lively acidity. Delicious with food. Drink now. 944 cases made.

name: Toscana Le Balze
review: Aromas of raisins, spices and cedar. Medium-bodied, with chewy tannins and a slightly rustic finish. Late-harvest Sangiovese. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Interesting spicy plum, berry and violet aromas that turn slightly earthy. Medium-bodied, silky and smooth, with a medium, fresh finish. Drink now through 2002. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Aromas of prunes follow through to full-bodied red, with velvety tannins and a jammy finish. A bit overdone for me, but impressive concentration. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Aromas of crushed cherries, with hints of mineral. Medium-bodied, with soft tannins and a spicy, almost peppery aftertaste. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Pretty raspberry and cherry aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 555 cases made.

name: Colli dell'Italia Centrale Rosato
review: Delivers strawberry character, hints of almonds and cream. Medium-bodied, with crisp acidity and a fruity aftertaste. Like a good Tavel. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: The lovely aromas of violets, roses, truffles and fruit are impressive, but it's rather simple and almost too crisp on the palate. Medium-bodied, with lots of violet flavors, but it's rather high in acidity. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Tight and medium-bodied, with slightly earthy, dried cherry aromas and flavors. Firm, with tangy fruit and oak on the palate. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Concentrated flavors and aromas makes this a lively wine. Tight, tannic and nicely spiced, with ripe cherry and cranberry flavors that turn a bit astringent on the finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Very pretty, with raspberry, chocolate and vanilla aromas and flavors and silky tannins. Drink now.

name: Toscana Rosato
review: Simple rosé, with some red fruit and fresh herb character. Lemony and attractive. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A Chianti with some berry and cherry aromas and flavors, but a lack of body and structure. (Not a riserva)

name: Le Balze
review: A hard, tight, tannic red wine whose aromas are opening up slightly to mellow, spicy notes, but it's still hard and tart in texture and tough on the finish -- which doesn't bode well considering the age it has already. 600 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Strong earthy, peppery aromas, with cooked fruit. Slightly unclean. 1,200 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rich, with excellent density, ripe cherry and plum fruit, and a well-integrated structure. Licorice, earth and tobacco notes add depth while this cruises to a long, tobacco- and mineral-tinged finish. Shows balance and grip. Best from 2018 through 2033. 18,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Flowers, dried berries, citrus fruit and cigar box aromas follow through to a full body, with supersoft, silky tannins and very opulent fruit. Layered and extremely flamboyant, yet reserved and caressing. Lovely now.—'99 Brunello blind retrospective (2009). Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Loads of blackberry, licorice and toasty oak on the nose. Full-bodied, round and rich, with wonderful fruit, light vanilla character and a long finish. Excellent, with lots of everything. Best after 2007. 2,220 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
review: A dense, powerful version, packed with cherry, plum, herb, earth and underbrush flavors. Vibrant, showing solid grip, this ends with echoes of fruit, earth and tobacco. Best from 2019 through 2032. 3,330 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A fresh, elegant style, featuring cherry, blackberry and spice aromas and flavors, with a vibrant structure and well-integrated tannins. Hangs together beautifully through the long finish, which echoes fruit and tobacco. Best from 2013 through 2025. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Medium ruby-garnet, with plum, orange peel and flowers on the nose. Full-bodied, with a wonderfully silky palate. Long and caressing. Very beautiful. All in the right proportion.--1997 Italian blind retrospective. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Shades of leather, spice, tea and iron surround the strawberry and cherry notes in this sleek, energetic red. Firm and tense, with a solid band of tannins lending grip to the finish. Best from 2021 through 2034. 11,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rich and round, with plum, cherry, leather and licorice aromas and flavors. Broad and savory, with both bright acidity and dense tannins gracing the finish. Best from 2014 through 2028. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
review: Rich and medium-weight, with cherry, berry, leather and spice notes converging on the long, juicy finish. Balanced in a sleek, compact manner, ending with fresh touches of mineral. Best from 2016 through 2032. 5,667 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
review: An intense red, but well-mannered, offering perfumed cherry, currant and balsamic flavors, all supported by firm tannins, with a lingering finish. Everything is in the right proportion. Best from 2014 through 2027. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
review: Offers ripe blueberry notes, with hints of violet, lilac and sandalwood. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins and a long, fresh finish. Not a big wine, but balanced and pretty. Best after 2011. 3,335 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Vigna Paganelli Riserva
review: Rich, decadent aromas of blackberry and dried rose, with hints of prune. Full-bodied, with delicious fruit, round tannins and a long finish. Layered and beautiful. Best after 2010. 2,700 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A beefy style, evoking plum, leather, tobacco and earth flavors, backed by dense, dusty tannins. Starts out juicy before the gruff finish takes over. Fresh and long. Best from 2018 through 2027. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: The bright cherry and strawberry notes are enhanced by iron and earth accents in this intense, tightly wound and linear red, boasting a firm structure and a lingering aftertaste of fruit and mineral. Best from 2017 through 2033. 9,667 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Has blackberry and coffee bean, with a hint of cream on the nose. Full-bodied and tight, with slightly austere and chewy tannins, but there is pretty, ripe fruit underneath it all. Best after 2010. 16,665 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very balanced. Aromas of crushed plums and light asphalt open to a very fruity palate. Full-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a medium finish. This should develop nicely. Best after 2005. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Subtle Brunello, with leather, spice, cedar and berry aromas. Full-bodied yet refined and silky, with a lovely caressing texture and a long, reserved, fruity finish. Drink now through 2010. 9,860 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Racy red with fine tannins and a minty, berry, cherry character. Medium- to full-bodied with medium firm tannins and a fresh finish. Better after 1999 but drinkable now. 1,366 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Bright, delicate and vibrant, with berry and floral flavors. Accents of earth, tobacco and spice add interest as they linger on the finish. Well-rounded and long. Drink now through 2023. 16,666 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Vin Santo
review: Lean and sinewy, with plenty of smoke, molasses, roasted walnut and saline flavors. Though lighter in body than Vin Santo, this delivers a lingering pungency on the finish. Drink now. 167 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This has a lovely nose of dried dark fruits, with flowers and sandalwood. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a serious amount of subdued fruit. Long and stylish. Chewy. Needs a little time in the bottle to come together. Best after 2012. 11,665 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Complex and seductive, with blackberry and cherry character with just a hint of cedar. Full-bodied and chewy, with loads of fruit. Extracted and tannic, but should come around. Best after 2010. 16,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Very clean for 2000, with plum, flowers, berry and hints of cedar. Medium- to full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Very well done. Best after 2005. 11,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Plenty of dried flowers, berry, perfumes and cherries on this nose. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A joy to taste. Well-crafted. Best after 2003. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A gorgeous, creamy Brunello. Il Poggione is back in form. Full-bodied and very soft, with aromas of ripe fruit, berry and meat, caressing, fine tannins and a fruity, multilayered finish. Drink now through 2005. 8,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Lovely finesse, showing perfumed, cherry aromas and flavors with a long silky finish and crisp acidity. Delicious plum and chocolate notes persist at the end. Drinkable now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A fine Rosso, with cherry, floral, tobacco and spice flavors imparting harmony and grace. The lively acidity and refined tannins frame the flavors. Lingering finish. Drink now through 2020. 12,500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A mix of cherry, plum, leather, tobacco and earth flavors courses through this firm, chewy red. Traditional in style, with the tannins leaving an astringent feel. Gains harmony with air. Decant. Best from 2015 through 2022. 12,500 cases made.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: Very pretty floral and berry aromas follow through to a full-bodied palate, with fine, firm tannins and a long, silky finish. Racy and classy. Big improvement. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2007. 600 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
