review: Shows lovely fresh, ripe fruit aromas on the nose, with dried cherry and dark chocolate. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh, balanced finish. Best after 2010. 18,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Juicy, with dried cherry and tea character. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a cherry, berry aftertaste. Will improve with a little more bottle age. Drink now through 2006. 1,665 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Eucalyptus and balsamic flavors mingle with cherry and strawberry notes in this traditional-style Brunello. A bit lean and open, showing dusty tannins on the finish. Best from 2016 through 2024. 16,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Rich, ripe and velvety, with lots of ripe cherry and plum aromas and flavors, a hint of anise on the finish, supple, concentrated, long and elegant.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: A fresh and clean wine with plum and cherry character and hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, with crisp acidity. Long finish. Brunello normale is slightly better. Drink now. 1,650 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: An elegant, lacy style, boasting strawberry, cherry, leather, wild herb and earth flavors. Juicy and long, with a firm, taut finish. Drink now through 2020. 34,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A pretty red, boasting sappy cherry and berry flavors, shaded by tobacco and licorice notes. Firms up nicely on the long, earth- and tobacco-accented aftertaste. Drink now through 2018. 13,830 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A rich, cherry-flavored red, this is straightforward yet shows enough intensity to draw out the finish. Open and ready. Drink now. 4,500 cases imported.

name: Sant'Antimo Vin Santo
review: A combination of oxidized and acetone aromasnot uncommon in these winesintroduces this light, moderately sweet white. The flavors evoke roasted walnut, burnt caramel and candied apple. Drink now. 566 cases made.

name: Toscana Brancato Rosato
review: Perfumed, sporting strawberry, raspberry and floral aromas that add spice and watermelon flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: A bright and fruity red, with plum and blackberry character. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Bit tart. Needs time to mellow the acidity. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: Nicely balanced spicy fruit aromas follow through to a medium- to full-bodied and silky palate, with well-integrated, fruit-coated tannins and a long finish. Well-done. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Never big and brutish, Il Poggione's top wines are always velvety and caressing, like this 1993 Brunello. Berry, tobacco and leather aromas and flavors prevail. Medium-bodied, with caressing tannins. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Beautiful, very ripe plum and berry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied and soft, adding medium velvety tannins and a delicious finish. Drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A subtle, complex Rosso with berry, earthy and fungi aromas and flavors. Medium body. Fine tannins. Drink or hold. 10,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Vanilla, leather and sweet fruit mingle on the nose, followed by concentrated cherry flavors and a moderate finish. Has depth and richness, combining balance and style. 5,830 cases made.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: Balanced and yummy young Sangiovese, with dried cherry and plum aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a crisp, fruity finish. Best from 1998 through 2003. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Dried cherry, floral and tobacco character. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a medium finish. Typical Brunello. Drink now. 7,900 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A subtle red with aromas of blackberries and earth. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a caressing finish of fruit and earth. Drink now. 7,555 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: A wine in modest proportions but with vibrant fruit. It shows berry and smoke aromas and flavors. Medium body and tannins and a sweet, fruity finish. Drinkable now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Delicious, medium-bodied red, with chocolate-tinged blackberry and cherry character that stays fresh from start to finish. Nicely done. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: This has got some structure for a '94 Rosso. It's medium- to full-bodied, with firm tannins and a long, fruity finish. Drink now or try holding until late 1997. 9,225 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Leopoldo Franceschi
review: A modern style, sporting spice and resin accents to the cherry fruit. Ends up dry on the finish. Drink now through . 2,400 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Good balanced for the vintage. Has lovely, fruity aromas of cherries and mushrooms, a medium body, fine tannins and a fresh finish. 4,250 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Shows slightly strange orange peel and chocolate aromas and flavors, but this is fruity and attractive on the palate. A fun red. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Despite rough tannins, this a focused, flavorful wine with concentrated cherry, plum and spice flavors; ripe and meaty. Give a year or two to resolve the tannins.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: Straightforward, with berry and pepper character. Medium body, light tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 670 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A rich, chewy style, in a rustic sense, sporting plum, licorice and tobacco notes. Turns dry on the finish. Best from 2012 through 2015. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Straightforward, with berry and cedar character. Medium body with tangy flavors. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Brancato Rosato
review: Candied berry flavors and a hint of sweetness lend roundness to this rosé. Features good cut and finishes dry. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Brancato Rosato
review: A crisp, fruity rosé, boasting watermelon, berry and spice flavors. Sangiovese. Drink now through . 6,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Straightforward, with plum and berry aromas and flavors. Medium- to light-bodied, with delicate tannins and a fresh finish. Good with pizza. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Medium to light body, firm tannins and a dried cherry, cedary aftertaste. A lean Rosso. Drink now. 15,500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Medium-bodied, with pretty plum, berry and green tobacco character and a light finish. Drink now.

name: Toscana San Leopoldo
review: A pleasant, fruity red with medium to light body, fresh acidity and a light tannin structure. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Fresh and elegant, with lovely fresh tea and cherry aromas and flavors, light body and light tannins.

name: Sant'Antimo Vin Santo
review: Dried fruit and bitter almond character. Medium-bodied, with a slightly harsh and rancid mineral finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Sant'Antimo Vin Santo
review: A light Vin Santo, with pretty floral and spicy mineral character. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with a fresh palate and spicy finish. More like Sherry. Almost dry. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Rather simple and mature '97 rosso with berry, tobacco and grapefruit character. Medium- to light-bodied, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 11,130 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Typical, light '96 Rosso, with berry, tobacco aromas and flavors, medium to light body and a light finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: At its peak, with berry and cherry aromas and flavors and slightly drying tannins. Disappointing for this producer. Drink soon. 9,243 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
review: Already tired. Ruby-garnet in color, with berry, cedar, earth and meat aromas, hints of chestnut. Medium-bodied, with hard tannins and a short, dry finish. 1,365 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A bit lean, with some hard mineral. Not completely clean. 16,000 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: A bit disappointing for this producer. Uncomplicated, quite light and even somewhat diluted, showing modest cherry, dried herb and cedar flavors. Slightly drying aftertaste.

name: Marche
review: Baked black currant and spice box notes are layered with chewy tannins in this fragrant, creamy red. Medium- to full-bodied, with hints of graphite, tarry mineral and leather showing on the savory finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2025. 16,666 cases made.

name: Marche Cosmino
review: Hints of graphite and garrigue accent the rich flavors of crushed black currant, dried marjoram and star anise in this finely meshed, medium- to full-bodied red, with creamy tannins. Fresh, offering a lingering finish. Cabernet Sauvignon with Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2025. 16,666 cases made.

name: Marche
review: This aromatic red is medium- to full-bodied, with tobacco and ground pepper notes wafting through flavors of black currant, licorice snap, dried fig and smoky mineral. Dense and chewy on the persistent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now through 2020. 16,666 cases made.

name: Marche Porpora
review: Orange peel and spice notes accent the ripe mulberry and wild herb notes in this sleek, medium- to full-bodied red. Lightly mouthwatering, with a lightly chewy, mineral-tinged finish. Montepulciano and Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 12,500 cases made.

name: Marche Cosmino
review: A medium- to full-bodied red, with grippy tannins, a subtle, tarry undertow and flavors of red and black currant, grilled herb and anise. Give this some air. Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2018 through 2023. 16,666 cases made.

name: Marche Porpora
review: A balanced, creamy red, with a light herbal overtone and spice accents to the sun-dried black currant and licorice flavors. Supple tannins firm the finish. Montepulciano and Merlot. Drink now through 2019. 12,500 cases made.

name: Colli Maceratesi Angera
review: This fresh, floral, light-bodied white offers crisp acidity and a lively mix of apricot, lemon zest and melon notes. Ribona. Drink now. 16,666 cases made.

name: Colli Maceratesi Angera
review: A juicy white, with perfumed hints of orchard blossom and cardamom accenting the ripe apricot, grated ginger and pink peppercorn notes. Round and creamy, with a snappy finish. Ribona. Drink now through 2018. 16,666 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Lovely integration and balance to this dark chocolate tinged Amarone, along with notes of date, sun-dried cherry, aromatic ground spices and leather, and a sweet, smoky minerality. Supple tannins and texture are like fine suede on the palate. Drink now through 2030. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso
review: This red offers a pretty blend of aromatic violet, spice box and dried rose petal notes, as well as flavors of dried currant and cherry. Medium-weight tannins find fine balance, and a hint of pekoe tea lingers on the finish. Corvina, Sangiovese and Rondinella. Drink now through 2016.

name: Toscana White L'Eremita
review: Lots of ripe fruit, with cooked apple and vanilla character. Full-bodied, dense and little oily. Simple. Trebbiano, Chardonnay and Traminer. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Vigneto Monte Masua
review: Earthy dried fruit and spicy oak character to this. Full-bodied, with very firm tannins. Lacks a bit of finesse, but should be fine with hearty food. Leave it awhile. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Il Sestante Vigneto Monte Masua
review: Starts off decadent and earthy but evolves to ripe fruit and flowers on the nose. Full-bodied, with ripe raisin character and silky tannins. Slightly short finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Vigneto Monte Masua
review: Starts off decadent and earthy but evolves to ripe fruit and flowers on the nose. Full-bodied, with ripe raisin character and silky tannins. Slightly short finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Vigneto I Pianeti
review: A slightly lean wine, but has some good ripe fruit and wet soil character. Medium body. Light finish.  Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Campo di Marzo
review: This polished red displays bright cherry, raspberry and oak spice aromas and flavors, matched to an elegant frame. A vibrant wine, cruising to a long finish. Best from 2013 through 2024. 540 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino Campo di Marzo
review: This is muscular and tannic, featuring a core of cherry and black currant flavors. Though compact now, grilled lamb or steak should bring out the fruit. Best from 2012 through 2014. 710 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino Campo di Marzo
review: Displays citrus fruit and black cherry on the nose. Medium-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a fruity finish. Not the most complex wine, but very enjoyable now. Drink now through 2012.

name: Toscana Il Merlotto
review: A tight, solid wine. Black in color, with violet, berry, mint and mineral aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, with very polished tannins and a blackberry and mineral aftertaste. Best after 2004.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola Riserva
review: Wonderfully aromatic, with berry, cherry and chocolate aromas. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. A yummy red. Drink now through 2005. 205 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola
review: A clean and delicious Chianti, with lots of berry and dried cherry character. Medium-bodied, with light, fine tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now. 660 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola
review: Delicious and vibrant Chianti Classico. Bright, fruity aromas and flavors of cherry, strawberry and plum skin. Medium-bodied, with delicate tannins and crisp and lively fruit finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola Riserva
review: A ripe and rich red, with chunky fruit structure, medium tannins and a fresh finish. Slightly one-dimensional and slightly woody. Best after 2002. 215 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Merlotto
review: A clean and fruity red, with mineral, berry and cherry character. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a crisp finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet. Drink now through 2006. 470 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Merlotto
review: Bright aromas of currants and minerals follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with firm tannins and tart acidity. Needs some age to pull together. Sangiovese and Cabernet. Best after 2003. 450 cases made.

name: Toscana Il Merlotto
review: A subtle red, with lovely blackberry, cherry and tobacco aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with light, silky tannins and a delicate, fruity, crisp finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2001. 450 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola
review: Delicious Chianti Classico. Aromas of ripe fruit and smoke. Medium-bodied, with raisin and spice character. Medium finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Il Merlotto
review: Elegant and well-balanced, offering berry and cherry aromas and flavors. Medium in body, with fine tannins and a crisp finish. Drink or hold.

name: Toscana Il Merlotto
review: A straightforward red with attractive berry and dried cherry character. Medium-bodied. Light tannins and a light, fruity finish.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola
review: A decent red, with dried cherry character. Short, slightly austere finish. Needs food. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Il Merlotto
review: Fresh and simple, offering berry, cherry and mineral aromas and flavors. Medium- to light-bodied, with fine tannins and a crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Chianti Classico Vigna Piccola
review: Plum and green tobacco aromas follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with tart acidity and a light finish. 660 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico
review: Pleasant and plummy, with firm tannins and pronounced acidity; the structure and alcohol on the finish dominate the modest fruit. Drink now through 2000 . 500 cases made.

name: Gavi
review: An attempt at a serious style, with loads of ripe pear and butter flavors. Turns a bit coarse on the finish, but still quite enjoyable. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: A medium-bodied Soave with subtle almond and mineral aromas, rich texture and a hint of citrus peel on the finish. Balanced and attractive. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Gambellara Vigneti Monte Faldeo
review: Shows some apple flavors, but more earth and straw notes combined with a leaner, racier structure. 4,200 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore
review: Offers light cherry and leather aromas and flavors, yet is basically austere and tannic. 900 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti
review: Demonstrates the potential of the '97 vintage. Beautiful, pure, refined, it tastes uncompromisingly natural, with oak-influenced spice granting center stage to a harmonious symphony of mineral, wild berry, currant and spice flavors. Drink now through 2003. 330 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti
review: Juicy, sporting cherry, raspberry and herb flavors. This is intense, with driving acidity and an almond accent on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2016. 600 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti
review: Dark, with plumskin, violet and berry character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit, polished and light tannins and a clean finish. Drink now.

name: Barbera d'Asti Barrique
review: Loads of minty plum character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit, light tannins and a fresh finish. Drink now.

name: Freisa d'Asti
review: Lovely and fresh, with floral and berry character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a light finish. Drink now.

name: Dolcetto d'Acqui
review: Smooth style of Dolcetto, with chocolate, mocha and milk flavors adding complexity to the red berry character. Smooth tannins. Drink now. 330 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Acqui
review: Light, with strawberry and cherry character. Light-bodied and clean, with a fresh finish.

name: Ruchè di Castagnole Monferrato
review: A strange mix of cut grass and raspberry. Medium-bodied, with polished tannins but a slightly aggressive finish. Rather cloying.

name: Grignolino d'Asti
review: Very light, with an ashlike character. Hard to get excited about.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Deftly balanced, framing mineral-accented blackberry and dark chocolate flavors with refined tannins and just enough acidity to keep the flavors singing on the wide-open finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Sleek, silky and charming, with a lilt to the raspberry and espresso flavors, picking up floral and spicy overtones as the finish lingers expressively. Light but very flavorful. Drink now through 2019. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Light and fragrant, the silky texture carries lovely cherry, bergamot and tea flavors through a long, expressive finish. Tight tannins should soften with cellaring. Best from 2012 through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Reserve
review: Velvety, refined and focused, with delicate, cinnamon-accented red berry flavors playing against mildly grainy tannins. The finish echoes gently. Drink now through 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Bright and vibrant, juicy with pear, tropical fruit and citrus flavors, lingering with some intensity. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and spicy, with a cinnamon note ringing in the ears of the raspberry and cherry fruit, all of it dancing lightly through the long, delicate finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Polished, focused and distinctive for the rose petal and chamomile tea accents to the plump core of currant, cherry and spice flavors. The finish holds together easily. Drink now through 2014. 475 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Willamette Valley
review: Soft and expressive, with lovely pear, melon, almond and floral aromatics combining on a light frame. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Light and spicy, with pretty raspberry and cinnamon flavors, lingering against refined tannins. Drink now through 2012. 1,300 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Willamette Valley
review: Bright and jazzy, polished, with a sappy edge to the apple and green olive flavors. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Bright and tangy, with a vegetal edge to the cranberry and spice flavors. This unusual style has personality, but won't appeal to all tastes. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley
review: Very light in color and light in flavor, with modest cherry and orange peel notes. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Reserve
review: Firm in texture and packed with ripe flavor, centering around black cherry, currant and dark plum notes, which echo nicely on the slightly chewy finish. Has the goods to age. Best from 2002 through 2007. 550 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Pieluni Riserva
review: A big, blowsy red, with loads of currant, raisin, mineral, coffee and spicy meat character on the nose. Full-bodied and juicy, with well-integrated tannins and a long, fruit and mineral finish. Delicious now, but still in its infancy. Like an Amarone. Massive. Best after 2007. 610 cases made.

name: Controguerra Nicò
review: Loads of character to this full-blown red. Forest fruits, minerals and a hint of black licorice on the nose lead to a full-bodied, rich and velvety palate, with well-poised, fruit-coated tannins and a long fruit and mineral finish. Hard not to resist now. From passito Montepulciano grapes. Best after 2005. 500 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: Harmonious and medium- to full-bodied, with sculpted tannins and flavors of baked blackberry, fig cake, loamy earth and licorice. Offers a lingering finish of aromatic dried herb and spice. Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2025. 1,500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Pieluni Riserva
review: This red is deceptively harmonious and elegant at first, which belies the dense and finely knit range of black currant, forest floor, olive tapenade and licorice drop flavors, and the supple frame of fine-grained tannins. The lasting finish is chewy, and echoes spice and mineral accents. Drink now through 2025. 833 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Zanna Riserva
review: Hints of grilled herb, game and tar accent flavors of plumped cherry and baked raspberry fruit in this firm, medium- to full-bodied red. Balanced, but more savory than sweet, with good length on the well-spiced finish. Drink now through 2027. 5,833 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: Rich with loads of ripe plum, black fruit and mineral, with a coating of dark chocolate. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a mineral finish. Needs some time to mellow. Best after 2007. 1,050 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Pieluni Riserva
review: A full-bodied red, with a good balance of ripe black fruit, sultana, violet, mineral and spicy oak. Shows lots of flavor, with a velvety texture and a long finish. All in balance, but needs a little time. Round and very pretty. Best after 2009. 650 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Pieluni Riserva
review: Dark, almost black color, with exotic aromas of crushed blackberries and cloves. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long, long finish. Another big and juicy New World-style Abruzzo. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Zanna Riserva
review: Elegant and well-spiced, with a finely meshed range of black raspberry, licorice string, grilled herb and black olive flavors structured by velvety tannins. Medium- to full-bodied, with a sweet, lasting hint of fig bread on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 5,833 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Zanna Riserva
review: A subtle, balanced red, with fine tannins and lightly tangy acidity, layered with cassis, black olive and grilled herb flavors and smoky graphite and mineral accents. Not a powerhouse, but well-sculpted. Drink now through 2021. 5,800 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ilico Riserva
review: A vibrant, finely knit red, with a minerally underpinning and rippling notes of crushed raspberry and black cherry fruit. This is medium-bodied, with sleek tannins and a lasting finish that echoes the aromatic herb and spice accents. Drink now through 2023. 11,667 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: Tar and grilled herb notes underscore flavors of plum sauce, black olive and licorice drop in this sleek, medium-bodied red, framed by chewy tannins. Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2020. 1,500 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: Dark notes of salted licorice, spice, mesquite and tar frame a core of crushed black plum and blackberry flavors, which fight through the very toasty finish. Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ilico Riserva
review: A balanced red, with hints of fresh earth and wild herb underscoring crushed mulberry, black olive and orange peel notes. Medium- to full-bodied and firmed by sculpted tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 11,666 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Pieluni Riserva
review: Dark and extracted, with firm layers of kirsch, cassis and plum pudding backed by hints of dried flowers and tobacco that linger on the long, smoky finish. Drink now. 580 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Zanna Riserva
review: Still fresh, with lively damson plum skin and dark cherry notes backed by good acidity and firm tannins that carry a walnut note on the finish. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Spiano
review: A pure beam of ripe black cherry is accented by leather and spice notes in this creamy and well-balanced red. Light tannins show on the aromatic finish. Drink now through 2019. 12,500 cases made.

name: Trebbiano d'Abruzzo Costalupo
review: A juicy, light-bodied white, with a lively mix of apricot, saline, blanched almond and lemon curd flavors. Drink now through 2019. 8,333 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: Shows lots of new oak, with a slightly jammy forest fruit note. Medium-bodied, with lots of firm, oaky tannins and a slightly angular finish of vanilla. Needs time, but should be worth the wait. Montepulciano and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2008. 1,100 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: A fresh, well-balanced red, with lots of blackberry and red berry character and clean minerals. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a fresh finish. Superclean, but slightly short. Drink now. 1,080 cases made.

name: Controguerra Lumen Riserva
review: I like the aromas of blackberries, prunes and light tar. Medium- to full-bodied, with soft and polished tannins and a long fruity, vanilla aftertaste. Montepulciano d'Abruzzo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Controguerra White Daniele
review: Lemon peel and hints of mineral follow through to a full body, with cantaloupe and apple character. Long and delicious. Trebbiano. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riparosso
review: Ripe plum and dried fig flavors are layered with hints of smoke, black licorice and dried herb in this light- to medium-bodied red, with light tannins. Balanced. Drink now through 2019. 50,000 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riparosso
review: Herb and spice notes are a zesty entry to this balanced, medium-bodied red, which offers sun-dried black cherry, baked plum and smoke details. Drink now through 2018. 50,000 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riparosso
review: Harmonious and well-knit, this accessible red offers juicy black cherry and herbed olive flavors laced with hints of smoke, stone and ground spice, and delivers crisp tannins on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 50,000 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Riparosso
review: Rich and jammy with hints of raisin. Medium- to full-bodied, with light tannins and a dried fruit aftertaste. Very good quality for the money. Best after 2004. 58,330 cases made.

name: Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo Campirosa
review: A fresh, light-bodied rosé, with a creamy mix of raspberry puree, orange zest and spice notes. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Controguerra White Ciafrè
review: Ripe peach and mango aromas follow through to a full body, with an ash and citrus fruit character. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Controguerra White Daniele
review: Decadent rustic lilt to this, with waxy, overripe apple, flowers and a hint of allspice. It's full-bodied, with a fresh palate and lots of flavor. Finishes cleanly. A touch old-style, but appealing. Barrel-fermented Trebbiano. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Colline Teramane Zanna Riserva
review: A bit closed, but nicely balanced, with blackberry, earth and a hint of espresso. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a medium finish. Give this another year to mellow. Best after 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford
review: Deliciously intense, juicy pineapple, mango, guava, sweet pea and melon flavors are focused, with a wonderful, juicy acidity and flavors that continue to push on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: Veers toward tropical notes of pineapple and guava, yet still features intense lemony flavors. The vibrant acidity is refreshing and makes all the fruit flavors bright and juicy. Drink now. 1,125 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: A very crisp, lean style, with green apple, lime and melon notes. Appealing for its juiciness and intensity. Drink now. 3,150 cases made.

name: Howell Mountain
review: Firm and focused, displaying plum, coffee and tobacco aromas, with black cherry and smoke flavors that linger on the slightly rustic finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 1,008 cases made.

name: Howell Mountain
review: Rustic style, with barnyard, earth and leather flavors, along with blackberry, plum and metallic notes that carry through the solid tannin of the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Howell Mountain
review: Dense and minty, with earthy currant, leather and blackberry flavors that are tainted by dry, gritty, leathery tannins. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. 950 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Weitenberg
review: A combination of power and finesse, with plenty of concentrated peach, citrus and tobacco notes supported by a firm, bracing structure. It all comes together on the long finish, ending in a leafy green, peppery aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 200 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Hinter Der Burg
review: Very creamy and rich, this has a deep well of mineral, white berry and peach flavors, flanked by creamy and leesy notes, with a spicy finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2009. 100 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Hinter Der Burg
review: A complex range of flavors from grapefruit and spice to fennel and lentil mark this sleek Grüner Veltliner. It has flesh and peach note midpalate, ending with a mouthwatering tang. Drink now through 2014. 85 cases made.

name: Riesling Federspiel Trocken Wachau Dürnstein Ried Traben
review: Delicate and firm, offering a minerally caste to the green peach, pippin apple and grapefruit flavors, with notes of lime on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012. 175 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Achleiten
review: Creamy and minerally, with a lively and pure-tasting mix of citrus and baked apple flavors. Vanilla and plenty of fresh spicy notes fill the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Achleiten
review: Exhibits fine density, along with apple, pear and mineral notes on a full-bodied, square-shouldered frame. Picks up a licorice note on the long finish. Drink now through 2007. 150 cases imported.

name: Grüner Veltliner Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Weitenberg
review: This is delicious up front, offering floral, talcum powder, passion fruit and grapefruit flavors allied to a rich texture and moderately firm structure. The beginning is better than the finish. Drink now through 2007.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Achleiten
review: A mineral-laden white, lean and sinewy, with citrus notes mixing with mineral. It's well-balanced, with a moderately long finish. Drink now through 2012. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Smaragd Trocken Wachau Weissenkirchen Ried Achleiten
review: Very appley, this straightforward Riesling shows a solid structure and modest finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
review: Deftly balanced, intense, focused and complex, with full-bodied dried currant, herb, sage and mineral notes. Ends with finesse, elegance and grace, with refined tannins. There's a hint of heat. Drink now through 2014. 318 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
review: Leather, espresso bean, blackberry and currant flavors have good concentration, with herb, toasty oak and solid tannin character on the finish. Drink now through 2007. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Stags Leap District
review: Distinctive, with a savory soy sauce note mingling with simple herb and dried fruit flavors. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape IDS
review: This has solid ripeness, with a mix of cherry and plum fruit laid over silky, tender tannins. Hints of spice and sweet tobacco fill in on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 6,200 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape La Ferme de Suzon Côtes Noires
review: Shows the ripe, friendly profile of the vintage, with juicy fig and blackberry fruit backed by coffee and spice cake notes. Solid finish. Drink now through 2017. 6,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône La Ferme de Suzon Côtes Brunes
review: Very fresh, almost primal, with a juicy, medium-weight core of cherry and red currant fruit backed by hints of spice and mesquite on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Château Suzeau
review: Soft, with modest cherry, herb and lavender notes. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles
review: The ripe plum, blackberry and huckleberry flavors are densely tannic, with pepper, licorice and dried sage details. Very appealing, with minerally accents on the finish. Drink now through 2025. 890 cases made.

name: Pallas Sonoma Valley
review: Combines ripe, supple, black cherry, currant and plum flavors, with firm, ripe tannins. Well balanced, with hints of anise, sage, mineral and hazelnut. Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Best from 2009 through 2015. 450 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles Artist Collection
review: A curious yet tasty mix of flavors, at times brawny and waxy, with intense, concentration to blueberry pie, black pepper, balsamic and vanilla flavors. Serious tannins and cedary notes carry through a lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 467 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles Artist Collection
review: Packed with flavors, including game, earth, eucalyptus, blueberry and blackberry that keep unfolding, along with roasted herb tones and a swath of chewy tannins. Drink now through 2008. 698 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Ash Creek Vineyard
review: Tight and concentrated, with firm tannin framing flavors of blackberry, stewed plum, generous toasty oak and fresh herbs. Needs cellaring to uncoil. Best from 2004 through 2009. 1,075 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley Ash Creek Vineyard Vineyard Collection
review: Intense, with flavors of dried herbs, olives and berries. Leather undertones, cedary oak and firm tannins extend through the finish. Drink now through 2009. 525 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Sunny Slope Vineyard
review: Firm, with ripe, vibrant blackberry, plum and earthy flavors. Chalky tannins weave through the finish, along with toasty oak character. Drink now through 2008. 1,076 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Sunny Slope Vineyard Vineyard Collection
review: Intense and a bit earthy, with a touch of leather and anise. Concentrated, with a mix of herb, sage and dried currant. Finishes with drying, earthy tannins, which will likely appeal to some more than others. Defintely needs decanting. Best from 2006 through 2012. 564 cases made.

name: Malbec Alexander Valley Artist Collection
review: Thick and ripe, with blackberry, spice, vanilla and cedar notes. Drink now through 2006. 780 cases made.

name: Petit Verdot Sonoma Valley Artist Collection
review: Elegant, with pretty blackberry and spice flavors, finishing with spicy oak notes. Drink now through 2008. 150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Sonoma Valley Wow Oui
review: Defined by a very juicy acidity, showing soft lemon, lime, pear and peach flavors. A light body adds to the refreshing quality, with aromatic floral details. Drink now. 874 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County Taylor Vineyard & Bruschera Vineyard
review: Ripe but focused, with berry cobbler aromas and boysenberry and cracked pepper flavors. Finishes with slightly rustic tannins. Drink now through 2012. 290 cases made.

name: Barbera Sonoma Valley Artist Collection
review: A tad gamy, with ripe blackberry, fresh cracked black pepper and cassis notes, and a healthy dose of oak. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros Ricci Vineyard
review: Round, with ripe pear, apricot, fig and peach flavors wrapped within a generous swathe of toasty oak tones. Drink now. 989 cases made.

name: Merlot Sonoma Valley Sunny Slope Vineyard
review: Firm, with tart black currant, plum and cranberry flavors, picking up herbal tones, cedar, toasty oak and solid tannins through the finish. Drink now through 2006. 448 cases made.

name: Viognier Alexander Valley Artist Collection
review: Toasted coconut notes dominate, with a tropical kick of pineapple, ripe peaches and toasty oak thrown in for good measure. Drink now. 577 cases made.

name: Viognier Sonoma County Artist Collection
review: Ripe, with intense peach, floral and green apple flavors. Tart citrus and apricot flavors accent the finish. Drink now. 732 cases made.

name: White Burgundy Artist Collection Napa Valley Los Carneros
review: Round, with very good depth to the caramelized pear, spice and yellow apple flavors. Creamy oak tones linger with citrusy acidity on the finish. Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Meunier. Drink now. 905 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley
review: Rustic, with mineral, pebble, iron and herb edges on the chunky currant and cedary oak flavors. Rough going for now. Drink now through 2013. 300 cases made.

name: Dragonsleaf Red Artist Collection Sonoma Mountain
review: Dried herb, pipe tobacco, leather, pepper and dried berry give this a distinctive flavor profile. Ends with leathery tannins. Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault. Drink now through 2013. 830 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Sonoma County Artist Collection
review: Tangy and pleasant, with red currant, plum, roasted herb and earth flavors framed by cedar and lively structure. Drink now through 2006. 581 cases made.

name: Tempranillo High Valley
review: Rustic and earthy, seemingly overly woody, this shows a dry, leathery edge to the dried currant and berry flavors. Ends with a dried, dill edge. Drink now through 2017. 706 cases made.

name: Barbera Sonoma Valley Artist Collection
review: Good intensity, with spicy earth, raspberry and minerally flavors, though it loses its intensity on the finish. Drink now. 497 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Sonoma Valley Artist Collection
review: Mouthful of roasted vegetable flavors on a light frame, with a hint of spicy cherry notes. Drink now. 637 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles Artist Collection
review: Firm tannins give this wine structure, but a leathery, spicy streak tends to overwhelm the black fruit flavors inside. Drink now through 2014. 920 cases made.

name: Wow Oui White Bordeaux Artist Collection Sonoma County
review: Tart, with hay, white raisin and dried peach tones. Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat Canelli. 494 cases made.

name: White Burgundy Artist Collection California
review: Slightly off aromas of onion and vinegar, with highly toasted oak and one-dimensional flavors. Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Meunier. 840 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Finger Lakes Peace
review: Light but pure and persistent, with a nice sleek texture carrying the green almond, lemon and floral notes. Solid length. Nicely done. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Finger Lakes Peace
review: Subtle, with a hint of bitter almond framing the slightly plump lemon verbena and white peach notes. A hint of salted butter adds persistence to the finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Wisdom Reserve Finger Lakes
review: Direct, featuring mulled currant and black cherry flavors woven with singed cedar and tobacco notes. A touch chewy in feel, but offers solid fruit. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now. 55 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Finger Lakes Peace
review: A soft, friendly style, with a banana hint leading the way for easygoing melon and peach notes. The finish is round and clean. Drink now. 130 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: A simple, off-dry style, with candied apple and watermelon notes. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Light, with an off-dry feel to the slightly candied lime and pear notes. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Finger Lakes Bliss
review: Very light, with modest lime flavors and a brisk finish. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Gratitude White Finger Lakes
review: Light, with slightly candied lime and banana aromas and flavors. Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Joy
review: A touch candied, with lime and watermelon notes that lack depth on the finish. 200 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Modest candied lime and green apple notes with a light finish. Clean but diffuse. 1,300 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley
review: Dense and ripe, with muscular blackberry, licorice and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2018. 100 cases made.

name: Bob's Special Delivery Black Rhino Western Cape
review: Modest dried cherry and plum skin notes are framed with dusty tannins and light vanilla and cedar accents on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Western Cape Bob's Overnight Express Giraffe
review: A light herb note weaves through the core of dried plum and mint flavors, ending with a cedar hint that holds sway on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Releaf Iswithi
review: An off-dry style, with friendly cherry pie and raspberry jam notes and just enough firmness on the finish to keep it honest. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Bob's Urchell's Zebra
review: Offers friendly pineapple and yellow apple chutney notes, with an easy finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape Makulu Iswithi
review: This light, bouncy red shows an off-dry hint to the cherry and red licorice notes, with a clean, easy finish. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot-Shiraz Western Cape Releaf
review: Slightly raisined plum and cherry fruit is framed with a hint of firm toast. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Shiraz. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape Releaf
review: Soft and forward, with modest pear and ginger notes and a slightly loose finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Wellington Amaboko
review: Light, with modest lime and pippin apple notes. Short finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: White Blend California
review: Features floral aromatics on a light, soft body, with direct apple and citrus notes. Pinot Gris, Chardonnay, Colombard and Gewürztraminer. Drink now. 2,763 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Batterieberg
review: Racy and fresh, featuring concentrated green apple, peach and kiwifruit flavors that are lusciously spiced. The firm finish has hints of anise, with notes of lemon meringue that linger on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 166 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Ellergrub
review: A lively minerally streak runs through this white, which is a touch off-dry. Notes of almond and spice show midpalate, lingering on the fresh finish with accents of dried mint. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Enkircher Batterieberg
review: Tightly structured, may still need time in the bottle. Has intense aromas of very ripe apricots and fruit and spicy mineral and grapefruit flavors. Medium-bodied, lightly sweet and powerful. Try now.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Zeppwingert
review: A crunchy white, with plenty of mineral and saline notes to the concentrated green apple and lemon-lime flavors. The taut finish is loaded with ginger and spice details. Drink now through 2021. 83 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Very densely textured, boasting concentrated flavors of slate, spice and citrus, all beautifully proportioned. Long, lingering finish with a stony, lime aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Steffensberg
review: This white delivers a fruity aroma, with flavors of fresh-cut apple and baked pear. Notes of gingerbread lead to a taut finish that offers pastry and white chocolate accents.  Drink now through 2020. 166 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Zollturm
review: There are lots of dried green herb and spice notes in this creamy white, which offers focused ripe melon, green apple and kiwifruit flavors in abundance. Hints of dried sage and tarragon on the finish.  Drink now through 2020. 108 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Enkircher Batterieberg
review: An unconventional, powerful, dry style that needs food; try it with fish in cream sauces. Has creamy tropical fruit aromas. Medium- to full-bodied and off-dry, with white pepper and spice flavors and a dry finish. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel C.A.I.
review: Taut and fresh-tasting, with notes of dried tarragon to the blood orange and green peach flavors. Hints of mint linger on the crackling finish.  Drink now. 3,333 cases made.

name: Riesling Qualitätswein Mosel Escheburg
review: Well-focused, with ripe flavors of baked apple and pear tart that feature citrusy notes. Accents of green herb and spice on the fresh finish.  Drink now through 2020. 416 cases made.

name: Riesling Spätlese Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Enkircher Batterieberg
review: A big, oily, off-dry wine to go with food. A wine for Mosel halbtrocken aficionados. Exceedingly balanced, with mineral and lemon rind aromas and rich mineral and spice flavors. Medium-bodied and off-dry. Rather fat for a Mosel wine. Drinkable now.

name: Riesling Spätlese Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Enkircher Batterieberg
review: Delicious, exotic fruit here. Mango, passion fruit and apricot mingle with the rich texture and bright structure. It's round, yet delicate, with a lingering finish. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases made.

name: Riesling Auslese Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer Enkircher Batterieberg
review: A delicious wine, showing plenty of refined fruit, with perfumed aromas of melons and strawberries and similar flavors. Light-bodied and off-dry, with a flavorful finish and plenty of fresh acidity. Try now.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Delicious. Bright and virtually crackling on the palate with its live-wire acidity, which focuses the peach, grapefruit and slate flavors on the delicate structure. It ends in a long, lingering finish. Drink now through 2008. 150 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Forthcoming aromas of lime and spice are followed by a peach note on a firm, succulent structure. Tangy finish. Drink now through 2004. 500 cases made.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: On the earthy side of the flavor spectrum, with some peach and lime peeking through. Nicely balanced, with an underlying firmness. Drink now through 2005.

name: Riesling QbA Trocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Mixture of ripe peach and earth notes, this dry Riesling is round, with crisp acidity coming through on the finish. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Kabinett Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Moderately concentrated peach and apricot flavors mark this round, straightforward kabinett. Drink now through 2004.

name: Riesling QbA Halbtrocken Mosel-Saar-Ruwer
review: Off-dry, this juicy white offers peach, citrus and hints of mineral. It's rich, and a touch coarse on the finish, lacking the purity of the best '00 Rieslings. Drink now through 2005. 300 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: A lively wine with a nice gamy edge to it, along with good herbal and dark cherry flavors. Drink now.

name: Proprietary Red McLaren Vale
review: Dark and chewy, with a green olive note prominent in the mix. Offers intensity and presence, letting the ripe blackberry flavors come through on the long finish. Shiraz and Petite Sirah. Best after 2014. 900 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale
review: Light in color, vibrant in flavor, with lovely clarity to the cardamom-accented raspberry and strawberry flavors, lingering enticingly and persistently. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and supple, a juicy mouthful of blackberry and floral flavors, persisting nicely on the mildly grippy finish. Shiraz and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2014. 800 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Fleshy and medium-weight, with good raspberry, mocha and coffee notes. Toasty notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2009. 291 cases made.

name: Carmenère Mendoza
review: Soft and fleshy, with nice concentration to the plum, currant, vanilla and tobacco notes. Touch of grilled herb frames the smooth, lengthy finish. Drink now through 2009. 237 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Offers rich aromas of ripe grape, potpourri, honeyed oak and hay. Full-bodied, with a caressing, silky texture and a long, flavorful finish that leaves an aftertaste of cinnamon toast. A big-hearted, thick and compact Sauvignon. But remains fresh throughout. A dry late-harvest style. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Veneto Oratorio di San Lorenzo
review: This shows loads of tarry currant fruit, with rosemary, sage, mineral and a twist of orange peel against a fresh, oaky background. Full- to medium-bodied, with fine, integrated tannins and a superclean finish of licorice. Needs a bit of time. An amazing Carmenère. Best after 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: A very rich and extravagant white in a late-harvest yet dry style. Very full, with thick and oily character and a long, spicy, almond and pineapple finish. This is full-blown. I like it very much. Great for rich foods. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Veneto Oracolo
review: This pure Cabernet is bursting with spicy licorice and thick berry character, with game and floral notes. Full and rich, offering big, velvety, fruit-coated tannins that push through the firm, long finish, with lots of lingering fruit and oak. There's a good balance of ripe fruit and acidity, but this is too firm to enjoy to the full just now. Best after 2010. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Rich and smoky, with fine-tuned acidity and creamy layers of dried apricot, apple tart, hazelnut cream, lemon meringue, fennel seed, vanilla bean and beeswax. This makes for a panoply of flavors, yet they're all set in a graceful, well-integrated form, with a lasting finish. Drink now through 2019. 3,300 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneti di Foscarino
review: This is an exaggerated, late-harvest style that works. Hard to believe it's Soave. Full-bodied and powerful, with spice, pineapple and burnt almond character, good acidity and a long finish. Like a top Pinot Gris from Alsace. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: Golden color, with a complex nose, offering citrus peel, orange blossom and hints of fresh, lightly spiced sandalwood. Full-bodied, with an intense, well-balanced palate, opening out into a long, spicy, cedary finish. Flamboyant white. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Selezione
review: A creamy Cabernet, with a floral thread winding through flavors of dried strawberry, crème de cassis, pekoe tea, spice box and candied blackberry. There's a syrupy juiciness to the acidity, yet this is fresh and balanced at the same time, with lightly chewy tannins surfacing on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Carmenère Colli Berici Oratorio di San Lorenzo Riserva
review: Herbes de Provence, game and smoke notes are layered with plumped black cherry and mocha flavors in this medium- to full-bodied red, punctuated by sculpted tannins. Drink now through 2021. 6,600 cases made.

name: Carmenère Colli Berici Oratorio di San Lorenzo Riserva
review: A dense, aromatic red, with notes of iron and beef tartare underscoring the black currant, tobacco and black olive flavors and sculpted tannins that hold sway on the spiced finish. Best from 2017 through 2027. 420 cases made.

name: Carmenère Veneto Più
review: Shows good integration of the fine-grained tannins and notes of cured tobacco, spice box, black currant and dried cherry. Supple and lightly juicy, with a hint of smoky mineral toward the finish. Drink now through 2019. 3,333 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Campo dei Tovi
review: Plenty going on in the glass with this Chardonnay. Aromas of melon, toasted oak and earth follow through to a medium- to full-bodied palate with apple and dough flavors. Long aftertaste. Subtle and very interesting. Drink now through 2002. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Ripe melon, dried papaya and candied citrus zest flavors mix with accents of grated coconut, smoke and fresh straw in this creamy, well-meshed white. Bright acidity and zesty ground spice lead to the lasting finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: This rich, creamy white shows a smoky base note, vibrant acidity and layered flavors of lemon meringue, hazelnut, dried apricot and pastry cream. Fine length and texture, with a lasting finish. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Golden color with intensely ripe and powerful aromas of apricots and honeycomb. Full-bodied, with loads of fruit and an oily, flavorful finish. Over-the-top style, but I love it. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: Beautiful aromas of mineral, apple and light honey with just hints of lemon rind. Full-bodied, with lively fruit and a long, long finish. A beauty. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Rich and enticing nose of apple, dried pineapple and a hint of cedar. Full-bodied, with intense flavors. Well-balanced, with a long finish. Good from start to finish. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Complex aromas of minerals, honeydew melon and light spices. Almost like Riesling. Full-bodied, with a thick texture and a long, rich aftertaste. Dry late-harvest style. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneto du Lot
review: Wonderful aromas and flavors of apples, honey and cream follow through to a full-bodied palate, with just the right amount of acidity and fruit. Long finish. Best white from Inama in years. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneto du Lot
review: Mind-blowing Soave! A very ripe wine, with lots of orange peel, pineapple and piecrust aromas. Full-bodied, round and rich. Goes on and on on the palate. Superb. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Bright and fruit-forward, with lively accents of candied ginger and ground spice to the flavors of baked peach, white cherry, pink grapefruit zest and salted almond. Medium-bodied and racy, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 2,165 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneti di Foscarino
review: A well-meshed white, displaying subtle acidity layered with hints of salted butter and almond, leading to flavors of lemon meringue, white peach and orange zest. This shows fine balance and good cut. Drink now through 2017. 2,166 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: A rich version in a finely knit frame, with smoke and oak spice lacing the flavors of baked peach, orange compote, verbena and almond skin. Light- to medium-bodied and creamy, with lively acidity for balance. Drink now through 2018. 1,100 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: Aromatic, with ground spice and orchard blossom, this meshes refined acidity with subtle flavors of white peach, chamomile and blanched almond. An underlying note of saline minerality pushes through on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,100 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: Flavors of smoke, salted butter and almond mix with spiced apple compote, persimmon, biscuit and apricot notes in this floral white. Medium-bodied, with lightly juicy acidity, as more smoke and nut notes linger on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 2,100 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: Tight on the nose, but the palate is packed with ripe peach, apricot, almond and lots of spicy cedar character. Full-bodied, with lots of flavor and a long, spicy finish. A full-blown Soave. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: A meaty red, with an aromatic edge of grilled rosemary to the sanguine mix of dried black currant and black olive flavors. Medium-bodied, featuring grippy tannins on the lasting, spiced finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère. Drink now through 2026. 2,200 cases made.

name: Veneto Oracolo
review: An enticing nose, with ripe damson fruit, mineral and oaky aromas that follow through to a full body, with polished tannins and a long fruit and mineral finish. These guys are coming on big-time. Lovely. Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2005. 790 cases made.

name: Veneto Oratorio di San Lorenzo
review: Full of juicy flavors of black cherry, black licorice and macerated plum, this features pencil shavings, smoke, cracked pepper and espresso accents. Expressive without being exuberant. Elegant, with a moderate finish. Carmenère. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Veneto Oratorio di San Lorenzo
review: This subtle red offers hints of tobacco mixing with dried cherry and currant fruit, smoke and spice flavors. This is firm, yet polished, with a long finish of ground anise, clove and pepper. Carmenère. Best from 2013 through 2018. 250 cases made.

name: Veneto Vulcaia Après
review: Pretty and lively wine with candied lemon and hints of caramel. Medium- to full-bodied and medium sweet, with a lively finish. Delicious.  Drink now. 335 cases made.

name: Carmenère Veneto Più
review: Bright and well-balanced, with dark, brambly berry fruit, wild herb and Kalamata olive flavors and lightly chewy tannins. Aromatic hints of graphite, spice and orange zest show on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 7,775 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Vulcaia Fumé
review: A delicious Sauvignon Blanc in a full-throttle style. Gold in color, this has intense aromas of toasted oak and baked bread, with an underlying nutty character. Big and rich, with apple, butterscotch and honey. A bit mature, but great for current drinking. Drink now. 1,665 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Hints of salted butter and smoke are an aromatic lead-in to this medium-bodied white, which features flavors of glazed apricot, kumquat and spice, backed by lively acidity. Creamy finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Well-cut and smoky, this creamy white blends rich notes of baked apple, pastry, lemon curd and spice with apricot, fig and melon fruit. Moderate finish. Drink now through 2016. 2,200 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: A creamy, understated white, with well-knit flavors of dried apricot, lemon peel, smoky mineral and crystallized honey, framed by vibrant acidity. Spiced finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,100 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vin Soave
review: Smoky, with a base of minerality and flavors of grapefruit, melon and blanched almond as well as a persistent thread of ground cardamom and ginger. Features good density and a fresh finish. Drink now through 2015. 18,500 cases imported.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: Firm and dense, with tightly knit, plush-textured tannins framing fragrant dried marjoram and anise accents and cassis, leather and cigar box notes. Subtle finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère. Best from 2018 through 2025. 3,300 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: Elegant, with supple tannins structuring the graphite- and mocha-laced notes of crème de cassis, sous-bois, grilled herb and ground peppercorn. Clean, offering a well-cut finish. Drink now through 2019. 4,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: This is finely knit and tightly wound right now, but shows balance to the fine-grained tannins, juicy acidity and flavors of sun-dried cherry, date and crème de cassis, joined by a hint of bresaola. A smoke note lingers on the firm finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère. Best from 2013 through 2020. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Bradisismo
review: If you like a big, rustic, late-harvest sort of Cab, this one's outstanding. For me, it's a bit too rustic. Dark ruby, with hints of garnet. Intense aromas of tar, raisin and grilled meat. Full-bodied, thick and chewy. Earthy aftertaste. Best after 2002. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Selezione
review: A creamy, licoricelike edge coats flavors of fig paste, kirsch, graphite, anise and clove in this medium-bodied red. Well-balanced, with supple tannins and integrated acidity. Moderate finish. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Carmenère Veneto Più
review: An herbed red, with firm, polished tannins encasing a subtle mix of lingonberry, tobacco, mineral and ground peppercorn flavors. Short-term cellaring should help this open up. Best from 2017 through 2022. 7,500 cases made.

name: Carmenère Veneto Più
review: This open-knit red reveals a core of smoke and ground spice notes, leading to flavors of black currant, grilled plum, cedar and leather. Medium-bodied, with fine-grained tannins. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Carmenère Veneto Più
review: A fleshy red, with tobacco and smoke notes bolstering flavors of cassis and black cherry. Very clean, focused and well-integrated, with a moderate, lightly tannic finish. Drink now through 2016. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: Apple, lemon and mineral character, with a hint of piecrust. Medium-bodied, with a fresh, balanced palate and a clean finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Lovely aromas of creamy light butter, ripe pears and apples, with hints of pie crust. Full-bodied, with lots of flavor, medium acidity and a spicy finish. Yummy Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: A toasty version, with pretty lemon curd and white peach flavors, accented by floral, tarragon and spice notes. Plump and well-balanced by fresh acidity. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,300 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Vanilla and roasted hazelnut notes lace the flavors of baked quince, lemon meringue pie, acacia blossom and warm baking spices in this toasty Sauvignon, balanced by lively, citrusy acidity. Drink now through 2020. 1,665 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: A full-bodied white that offers lots of floral character, with clean apple and cedar on the nose. Smooth-textured, with a long, spicy finish. Lacks a little finesse. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Spicy, rich Sauvignon. Captivating aromas of apple, straw and sliced pineapple. Full body. Lots of fruit, with a crisp finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
review: Wonderful aromas of melon, lavender, honey and light straw. Medium-bodied, with lots of good fruit and a medium green apple aftertaste. Inama always makes good Soave. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
review: Subtle yet captivating, this lovely Soave has wonderful straw, apple, melon and honey aromas. Medium-bodied, with compacted fruit and a long honey, clove and lilac aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Subtle and complex aromas of minerals, apples and light wood. Medium- to full-bodied, with mineral and apple character. Long finish. Slightly more at the finish would move it up to 90, but very good indeed. Drink now. 2,160 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneti di Foscarino
review: Lots of ripe apple, piecrust and honey aromas in this wine. Full body. Flavors of caramel and apple follow through on the palate with a crisp finish. Delicious. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneti di Foscarino
review: A soft and creamy white, with enough citrusy acidity to balance the rich notes of crushed almond, baked pear, chamomile and spice. Drink now through 2019. 5,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vigneto du Lot
review: The lightly honeyed notes of green melon, star fruit, ground ginger and jasmine are fresh and juicy, enhanced by finely tuned acidity. Minerally finish. Drink now through 2016. 1,100 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vin Soave
review: Fine balance to this well-cut white, which offers lightly honeyed flavors of apricot, grapefruit zest, star fruit and stone, with a hint of straw and a moderate finish. Drink now through 2016. 20,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: Hints of leather, balsamic and ground spice accent flavors of spiced plum, black currant and graphite in this lightly chewy red. Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: Tightly packed aromas of ripe currant and chalk, with hints of coffee and chocolate, lead to a full-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a firm, chocolaty finish. There's some underlying toasty oak, with an almost resin character. Stylish. Best after 2008. 1,200 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: Rich aromas of ripe plum and berry fruit, with traces of grilled meat and mushroom. Full- to medium-bodied, with a slightly austere, nutty character. Better up front just now. Should open up nicely. Best after 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Carmenere Più
review: Starts soft and fruity, with fleshy, plummy fruit and light spicy oak. This has a plump medium body, with a good balance of fruit and spice and an easygoing texture. Very drinkable. Carmenère, Merlot and Raboso. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Oratorio di San Lorenzo
review: There's a light dustiness to the tannins in this modest red, framing hints of black cherry compote, black currant candy, vanilla and spice cake. Spiced, juicy finish. Carmenère. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Selezione
review: Tangy, with anise and smoke accents to the flavors of ripe black currant and blackberry, cocoa powder and a hint of kirsch. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Chardonnay
review: A pretty little number. An aromatic and zingy white, with subtle green apple, celery and mineral aromas. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a long aftertaste. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto Campo dei Tovi
review: Lovely aromas of ripe pineapple, toasted oak and hints of butterscotch. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a long, dried apple and vanilla aftertaste. Drink now through 2006. 950 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto Campo dei Tovi
review: Like an apple turnover. Loads of ripe apple and piecrust character. Medium- to full-bodied, with good fruit and a medium finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: The up-front flavors of creamed apple, white peach, ground cardamom and ginger are well-knit and balanced by fresh and zippy acidity, showing a hint of lemon chiffon. Loses some intensity toward the finish. Drink now. 2,150 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Very pretty lemon, pineapple and parsley aromas. Full-bodied, with plenty of fruit and a bright apricot aftertaste. Slightly one-dimensional. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: A very ripe Sauvignon, with gooseberry and lightly buttered piecrust aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with a relaxed palate and medium finish. Thick and spicy. Like a dry Sauternes. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: Shows lavender and lemon character. Medium-bodied, with a crisp mineral finish and an intense lemon rind aftertaste. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneto du Lot
review: Lots of vanilla, milk and honey, with hints of apples. Full-bodied and viscous, almost oily. Medium finish. Could use a bit more fresh acidity to move up a few points, but excellent with rich food. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vin Soave
review: Yellow plum and candied ginger notes are tightly meshed with stony mineral and racy acidity in this light-bodied, lively white. Drink now through 2017. 17,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Vin Soave
review: Juicy, with flavors of honeyed apricot, melon and star fruit, this balanced white is well-cut and lightly floral, revealing a stony base note on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: An interesting spicy, meaty and peppery nose follows through to a medium- to full-bodied palate, with lots of fresh, peppery fruit, fine tannins and a tight finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Carmenère and Merlot. Best after 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Veneto Bradisismo
review: A bit closed now, but showing some good ripe fruit, mineral and light coffee character. Medium- to full-bodied, with a tightly packed palate and a solid vein of fruit. Firm, fruity finish. Shows promise. Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère. Best after 2005. 2,125 cases made.

name: Veneto Carmenere Più
review: Offers spicy ripe currant and mineral, with traces of lavender, menthol and light gamy, leathery notes. Full- to medium-bodied, with a clean core of black fruit, firm tannins and an intense, surprisingly fresh finish of fruit and mineral. A new red from this producer. Carmenère, Merlot and Raboso. Best after 2009. 3,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Bradisismo
review: Aromas of butter, cream and berries. Full-bodied, with a very ripe, almost raisin character. Lots of toasted oak and a medium finish. Slightly overdone and contrived but very good. Best after 2002. 1,665 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: Lively and expressive, with tangy, citrusy acidity and notes of melon, orange blossom and tangerine and hints of mango and spice. Modest finish. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: This soft, silky Chardonnay offers clean apple pie and mineral character. Has a full, almost oily mouthfeel, with enough acidity to keep this fresh. There's a pleasant piecrust aftertaste. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: Subtle aromas of cream, apple and white peaches. Medium-bodied, with a lovely fruit and fresh acid structure. Clean, crisp finish. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Zippy acidity frames flavors of kumquat, smoke, melon rind, stone, white peach and orange zest in this lively white. Modest finish. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Lemon and lime, with hints of fresh herbs and celery. Medium-bodied, fresh and crisp. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Ripe apple and peach, with a lot of bitter almond and an almost resiny character that comes to the fore on the palate. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and dried lemon aftertaste. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Stylish white showing very ripe Sauvignon character, with dried pineapple and blanched almonds. Medium body. Almondy finish. A bit more acidity would make it even better. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia Fumé
review: Very ripe style, with pineapple skin, baked apple and wood spice character. Full-bodied, with lots of flavor and an oily, thick finish. A bit overdone, but interesting. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: A fresh, tasty white, with lots of crisp lemon, white peach and dry mineral character. Medium-bodied, with a delicate palate and a clean, medium finish. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: Shows mineral and sliced white peach character. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a bright, fresh finish. Drink now. 12,700 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
review: A stylish, minerally Soave. Attractive aromas of straw, honey and melons. Medium body, with good fruit and a medium finish. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
review: Delicious. Subtle aromas of peaches, minerals and honey. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a fruity orange peel aftertaste. Drink now. 6,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Veneto Bradisismo
review: Slightly earthy, but lots of currant and fresh herb character. Medium-bodied, with medium tannins and a chewy finish. Rather rustic. Best after 2005. 2,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: Pleasant Chardonnay. Very clean aromas of apples and pears. Medium body. Fresh fruit. Clean finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Vulcaia
review: A stylish white, with aromas of apple, leaf and mineral. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a clean apple, earth and herb finish. Drink now. 584 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore
review: Intense aromas of minerals, lime and green apple. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a simple, fruity, medium finish. Drink now. 6,700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Veneto Vulcaia
review: Some clean, fresh character, with lime and celery nuances. Medium-bodied, with good acidity and a light finish. Slightly diluted. I have had better from here. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneto du Lot
review: Very ripe white, with beeswax, white pepper and honeycomb aromas. Full-bodied and thick. Late-harvest style, but very dry. Slightly hot. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Veneto
review: A bit dull around the edges, with a subtle mesh of sliced almond, dried apple and apricot, smoke and ground spice. Modest finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico
review: A clean, everyday Soave, with citrus and bitter almond notes. Light and fresh. A bit short. Disappointing. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Vigneto du Lot
review: Overripe pineapple and butter character turns to butterscotch, vanilla and cream. Full-bodied, with a round texture and a buttery finish. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Vulcaia Apres
review: Aromas of nut, fruit, herb and toasted oak. Medium-bodied and medium sweet, with a dusty, musty finish. A late-harvest wine made with unnoble rot as well as the noble stuff. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: A textbook crowd-pleaser, this white offers pear and creamed green apple notes, gilded with a light piecrust thread. Ends with a round, easy finish. Drink now. 18,556 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Bright and engaging, with quince, creamed yellow apple and verbena notes gilded by the lightest of fresh butter notes. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 35,292 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Fresh-cut green apple and white peach notes are laced with a makrut lime thread and backed by a bright honeysuckle accent on the finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: The plump apple, melon and pear flavors are lightly lined with judicious toast, leading to a creamy, friendly finish. Drink now. 43,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Lively yellow apple and white ginger notes stream along, carried by a hint of green almond through the bright finish. Drink now. 9,756 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: A rounded, easy style, with green plum and pear fruit at the core, laced with a hint of makrut lime that keeps this honest through the finish. Drink now. 9,755 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: A soft, charming style, with plum and dark cherry fruit gilded with tobacco and singed cedar notes. Drink now. 6,200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Very fresh, with verbena, kaffir lime and fennel notes, showing nice zip through the finish. Contains 4 percent Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 12,931 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Plump and lightly buttered, with a creamy edge around the pear, pineapple and quince notes. Drink now. 35,290 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Forward, with good pear and fig notes backed by a subtle touch of toast. Drink now. 5,836 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Clean and tangy, with green apple and fig notes, and fresh acidity on the finish. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Offers plump lemon shortbread, apple and heather notes, with a friendly, open finish. Drink now. 11,700 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Juicy and direct, offering pear and green melon fruit that culminates in a bright finish. Drink now. 9,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
