review: Displays a friendly mix of green plum and citrus notes, with an almond- and heather-tinged finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Light-bodied, with freshly cut white peach, green almond and fig notes, followed by a juicy finish. Drink now. 4,400 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Soft and forward, with a hint of maturity, showing tangerine, spice and melon notes, followed by a hint of almond. Drink now. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Fresh cherry and plum notes are laced with a light anise hint and a dash of sweet toast. Drink now. 8,033 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: The gentle dark plum and black cherry flavors are laced with a savory hint and backed by an echo of singed cedar. Drink now. 9,222 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Fresh and juicy, with ripe blackberry and plum fruit and notes of mocha and toast. Soft, easy finish. Fine value. Drink now. 17,000 cases made.

name: Mosaic Western Cape
review: Bouncy cherry and dark plum notes are laced with a licorice snap detail. Features a shot of toasted vanilla on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now. 7,294 cases imported.

name: Mosaic Western Cape
review: Direct and fresh, offering plum and cherry fruit lined with notes of toasty vanilla and anise. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Brisk, with lime zest and lemon pith notes that stay nervy through the mouthwatering finish. Drink now. 26,889 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Light lime and mâche notes are fresh and friendly, with enough zip on the finish to stay lively. Drink now. 20,880 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: The brisk lemon zest, white asparagus and floral notes stay zippy through the straw-tinged finish. Drink now. 33,600 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Good lemon zest and straw notes, with a crisp, refreshing texture. Nice weight and length too. Very tasty. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Fresh and forward, with lively black cherry and white pepper notes followed by an easygoing finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: A plump, forward style, with lightly buttered apple, piecrust and melon notes, followed by a round, easy finish. Drink now. 26,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: A light-hearted, open-knit style, with yellow apple and melon flavors followed by a kiss of butter on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Soft, but fresh, with good pear and apple notes followed by a buttery finish. Drink now. 9,415 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Fresh and open, offering tasty white peach and green plum notes backed by a juicy, defined finish. Drink now. 11,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Round and clean, with slightly off-dry almond and melon notes followed by a soft, easy finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Soft, with modest plum fruit, lined with light vanilla and herb hints. Drink now. 9,220 cases imported.

name: Mosaic Western Cape
review: Direct, with plum skin, currant and raisin notes, lined with a hint of toasty vanilla. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now. 6,800 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Medium-weight, with ripe plum flavor, toast notes and a lively finish that picks up a touch of briar. Drink now through 2003. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Offers pea and straw notes, with a flash of peach on the finish. Drink now. 22,362 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Fresh-cut lime and herb notes lead to a brisk, racy finish. Drink now. 30,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Fresh, with light lime and herb notes and a crisp finish. Drink now. 9,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Lean but lengthy, with chiseled lime, chalk and floral notes on a bright frame. Drink now. 15,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Good lime and sweet pea flavors, with a nice hint of straw too. Clean and fresh. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Fleshy and forward, with good plum, cherry, tobacco and toast notes. Drink now. 11,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Tasty plum, black cherry and sweet toast notes in an uncomplicated, fresh package. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Nice, ripe berry and plum flavors, with some sweet toast and mocha notes as well. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Light and fresh, with good apple and peach notes and a clean, unadorned finish. Drink now. 36,374 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Light, with lime and floral notes and a crisp, flinty finish. Pleasant, unadorned style. Drink now. 12,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Forward and soft, with modest peach and melon notes. Buttery finish. Drink now. 3,740 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Soft and forward, with good dark plum, toast and grilled herb notes. Drink now. 7,900 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: A straightforward version with tasty red berry and blackberry fruit, and a healthy layer of toast as well. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Mosaic Western Cape
review: Direct, with a light toasted vanilla frame around a mix of cherry compote and red licorice flavors. A flash of grilled herb runs through the finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Mosaic Western Cape
review: Direct, with red and black cherry fruit, stitched with a light vanilla hint. Offers an open, easy finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 7,295 cases imported.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Soft and forward, with dark plum, cocoa and tobacco notes. Easygoing finish. Drink now. 5,618 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Quick, with lemon pith and peach notes backed by an herbal twinge. Drink now. 18,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Modest lemon and grapefruit notes, with a floral hint on the finish. Drink now. 14,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Crisp and clean with straightforward lemon and grapefruit flavors. Drink now. 10,384 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: A friendly, soft style, offering dark cherry jam laced with a hint of licorice snap. Open-knit finish. Drink now. 10,650 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Light and forward, with cherry and vanilla flavors that are round and easy on the finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: High-toned red and black cherry fruit is followed by modest toast and spice notes. Turns a bit crisp in the end. Drink now. 7,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Western Cape
review: Jammy and direct, with black cherry and blueberry fruit, and sweet smoke rounding off the fleshy finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Light and clean, with a mix of yellow apple and butter notes, backed by a lightly floral finish. Drink now. 32,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Flintier style, with crisp apple and mineral hints and a crunchy finish. A bit short in the end, but good. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: A fresh, slightly crisp style, with pippin apple and pear skin notes. Light finish. Drink now. 13,446 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: The gentle plum fruit features a light grilled herb hint and a dusting of vanilla. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: The gentle plum fruit features a light grilled herb hint and a dusting of vanilla. Drink now.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Herb, plum and cocoa notes run along in this slightly rustic, medium-weight Merlot. Drink now. 5,378 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Light-bodied, with cherry pie and herb notes, followed by a touch of vanilla on the finish. Drink now. 9,400 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Fresh, medium-weight grape and berry flavors, with a slightly dusty finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pinotage Western Cape
review: Soft plum fruit, with briar and smoke notes in the background. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Crisp grass and lemon notes, with a lively finish. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Basic flint, peach and lime notes give way quickly on the easy finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Modest plum and cherry fruit is laced with a grilled herb note and covered with a veneer of vanilla toast. Drink now. 12,500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Western Cape
review: Rather light, with yellow apple and floral notes. Quick finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Grapey and forward, with a dash of vanilla on the finish. Clean and simple. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Modest berry fruit gives way to herb and toast notes on the light finish. Drink now. 10,205 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Western Cape
review: Plump for a Sauvignon, with fig and apple notes that turn to fruit cocktail on the finish. Clean, but lacks zip and typicity. Drink now. 36,000 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Western Cape
review: Basic peach and apricot notes turn soft and light in the end. Drink now. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Merlot Western Cape
review: Modest plum fruit quickly turns herbal and stewy in the end. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Viognier Snake River Valley
review: Fresh and juicy, with pear, cream and spice flavors set on a medium-weight frame, dancing through the finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Idaho
review: Clean and holding up well, with pear, floral and toast notes, and good length on the finish. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Idaho
review: Light berry fruit, with some pleasant spice notes on the finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Idaho
review: Light and airy, with some red cherry and woodspice notes. Drink now. 740 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Idaho
review: A touch airy, with some red and black cherry flavors, and a slight resinous note on the finish. 180 cases made.

name: Merlot Idaho
review: Maturing already, with a rhubarb edge to the moderate cherry fruit. Soft, tea leaf[NDASH]tinged finish. 220 cases made.

name: White Riesling Idaho
review: Canned lime and peach juice notes, and a slightly sweet finish. 400 cases made.

name: White Pinot Noir Idaho
review: Pale pink color, with dilute watermelon flavor. Candied finish. 1,050 cases made.

name: Syrah Nevada County
review: Brawny, with depth to baked black cherry, cola and loads of toasty oak. Firm, herbal tannins and eucalyptus notes grip the finish. Drink now through 2008. 2,629 cases made.

name: Syrah Nevada County
review: Smooth and generous with its gentle prune, blackberry and spice flavors, nicely modulated for a harmonious wine that's pretty to drink now. 521 cases made.

name: Merlot Sierra Foothills
review: A big, ripe, full-bodied Merlot, with exuberant black cherry and raisin flavors, plenty of crisp acidity and moderate tannins. The black cherry nuances linger nicely on the finish. Distinctive and full of character. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Nevada County
review: Smooth and supple, with a nice range of currant, herb and spicy Merlot flavors. Drinks well now but has the intensity and tannins for short-term cellaring. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Nevada County
review: Supple and fruity, showing a nice core of cherry and berry flavors and light oak shadings. Finishes with a nice touch of fruit and firm tannins. Drinkable now through 1996. 600 cases made.

name: Merlot Nevada County Sierra Foothills
review: Ripe, spicy and not too tannic, with bright, lively black cherry, currant, tar and tobacco flavors. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Nevada County
review: This is somewhat green on the palate but shows a nice, supple texture. 902 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Nevada County
review: Strikes a nice balance between cedary oak and ripe currant flavors. Picks up a hint of coffee on the finish before the tannins kick in. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Nevada County
review: Doughy and spicy, with flat notes of citrus and melons. Drink now. 4,253 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Nevada County
review: A rustic young Cabernet with earthy, tannic currant flavors that turn spicy on the finish, but in the end the tannins hang tough. Drinkable now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Nevada County Sierra Foothills Reserve
review: Crisp and sappy in flavor, with resiny overtones to the basic pear and floral aromas and flavors. Drinkable now. 400 cases made.

name: Sémillon Nevada County
review: Strongly herbal, earthy flavors are too much for the lemony notes. 250 cases made.

name: Brut Chardonnay North Coast
review: Firmly textured, with citrus, starfruit, apple and melon flavors at the fore. Bright and refreshing, with a tangy, mineral finish. New from Gallo.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Here's a quality Cabernet at a decent price. Not a fleshy style, but there's good focus to the flavors of violet, underbrush and blackberry, which firm up on the finish.  Drink now through 2005. 21,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Zesty in style, built around vibrant citrus, tangerine and nectarine flavors, with a touch of earth and vanilla. A terrific value. Drink now. 21,424 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Coast
review: Smooth, rich and creamy, with layers of fig, pear, apple, spice and lemon holding their focus and lingering. Drink now through 2004. 16,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay North Coast
review: A soft white, woven together with focused tangerine, apple and pear flavors that finish with a subtle interplay of fruit and oak. Drink now. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: A refreshing white at a refreshing pirce, this California white is clean and lively, distinctive for its core of crisp and tangy citrus and tart pear flavors. Ready now, with good availability. 60,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Smooth and polished, this light-style Chardonnay shows generous apple, honey and butter flavors that linger on the toasty finish. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir Central Coast
review: Elegantly balanced, with toast, ripe plum, cherry, earth and cola notes that finish with a nice spicy aftertaste. Drink now. 17,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir North Coast
review: A pretty wine with bright raspberry and vanilla flavors and a hint of candy sneaking in on the silky finish. Ready now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs North Coast
review: A light, bright and refreshing blend of lemon, toast and green apple flavors. Not particularly complex, but thoroughly enjoyable. Good price, too. Drink now. 40,000 cases made.

name: Brut Blanc de Blancs North Coast
review: Round, with pleasant flavors of fig and tangerine. Drink now through 2002. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendocino County
review: Here's a tasty Chardonnay from California, light and bright, with straightforward green apple and vanilla flavors. Drink now. 42,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Central Coast
review: Round, with easy-drinking flavors of chocolate and boysenberry that finish with gentle tannins. Drink now through 2002. 7,715 cases made.

name: Merlot San Francisco Bay
review: Grapey and rough cut, with good intensity to the cassis, raspberry and herbal flavors. Firm tannins linger through the finish. Drink now through 2005. 22,200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Mendocino County
review: Bright grapefruit and melon flavors are the hallmarks of this California white. Light in style and body, it finishes with a flinty, mineral-like edge. Refreshing for both palate and pocketbook. 33,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon North Coast
review: Medium-weight, with spicy currant, new shoe leather and earthy notes. Drink now. 39,900 cases made.

name: Merlot San Francisco Bay
review: Fragrant, with chocolate milkshake, black cherry and currant flavors framed by firm tannins, toasty oak and herbal undertones. Drink now. 52,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Simple, though appealing for its leafy ripe pear, apple and melon notes. Drink now. 34,300 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Shows pretty blueberry, currant, cherry and clay flavors. Finishes with soft tannins. Drink now through 2004. 23,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir North Coast
review: Ultimately simple, with pleasant strawberry, tea and clove flavors. Drink now. 43,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel North Coast
review: Black cherry and smoke lead the way. On the palate, it gains some complexity but remains a little light, with a somewhat sharp finish.

name: Pinot Noir Mendocino County
review: A simple red that lacks varietal distinction. Shows a modest range of earthy cherry notes and finishes slightly dry.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Paso Robles
review: Juicy, but shows more tomato, dill and charred oak than Cabernet flavors. Finishes slightly hot.

name: Shiraz Western Australia
review: Smooth and rich, generous with cola-accented blackberry, dark plum and dusky spice flavors, nicely balanced with refined tannins to let the flavors play out gently on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Pemberton Unwooded
review: Lithe, refreshing and smooth, with juicy pear, pineapple and floral aromas and flavors, persisting nicely. Drink now. 4,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz Western Australia
review: Smooth and round, with plum and pepper flavors, veering toward savory herb and meat notes as the finish fades. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elim
review: A lean, bracing style, with crunchy kaffir lime, tarragon, chive and fleur de sel notes. Offers a pure, racy finish. Drink now. 495 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elim
review: Features brisk lime, sea salt and chive notes, with lingering hints of grapefruit pulp on the finish. Light, racy and well-cut. Drink now. 495 cases made.

name: Pinotage Coastal Region
review: Light and grapey, with a twinge of anise holding the finish. Pinotage. Drink now. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Barolo
review: A very good example of Barolo from a great vintage. Clean, spicy aromas and rich, meaty flavors. Moderately tannic, long on the finish. Drinkable now. 4,167 cases made.

name: Chianti
review: This is thin and tart, though it has some good, mature dried cherry flavors. Simple and already over the hill.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A bit medicinal tasting. Already mature and browning, with simple dried cherry flavors. Dull and sugary on the finish.

name: Pinot Grigio Grave del Friuli
review: Fruity but awkward, with simple fruit-cocktail flavors and a slightly sweet finish.

name: Chenin Blanc Texas
review: Rounded and soft, with a light-hearted mix of almond, ginger and peach flavors that move gently through the finish. Drink now. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A truly remarkable, rich, ripe, vibrant and concentrated wine, sharply focused on black cherry and currant flavors that are bright and lively. The finish sails on. Rivals the '41 in quality.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now through 2010.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Remarkable elegance, finesse, depth and grace, with layers of black cherry, currant, anise, cedar, sage and earth notes. A second bottle had less flavor.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now through 2008.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley F-9
review: Wonderful aromatics--rose petal, cherry, mint, currant. Rich and full-bodied, intense, concentrated and complex--about all you could ask for from a wine this age.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now through 2010.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley J-9
review: Amazing. Sweet and spicy, with pretty plum and black cherry fruit that's elegant, polished and graceful. Long, lingering aftertaste.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tea, mint and black cherry. An elegant, sophisticated, polished wine, gaining nuance and depth.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Enormously flavorful. Dark, rich and chocolaty, with earthy currant, anise, plum and sage, finishing with firm tannins.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now through 2010.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley F-6
review: Rich, aromatically complex, dark, with intense currant, anise, cedar and tar. Firmly tannic and concentrated.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley J-3
review: More depth and purity of fruit than the other '54, with rich currant, cedar and spice notes. Wonderful complexity and texture.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley J-46
review: Deliciously ripe, with earthy plum, black cherry and currant. Full and rich, with a long, lingering aftertaste.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Rubicon Napa Valley
review: A classy effort that is rich and layered, restrained and structured, showing fine tension between the dried currant, cedar, cigar box and anise flavors and the firm, fine-grained tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2023. 3,700 cases made.

name: Rubicon Rutherford
review: A classy, well-structured effort, with flavors that build and gain depth around a core of loamy earth, espresso, dark berry, cedary oak and tobacco. Most impressive on the graceful, long and persistent finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Drink now through 2026. 3,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley B-5
review: Coffee, cookie dough and rich cherry and currant flavors. Long, rich and youthful.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Youthful, ripe and richly flavored, with few signs of its true age. Lots of currant, plum and black cherry flavors are elegant and persistent.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Rutherford Edizione Pennino
review: An old-school Zin, with a sense of style and place, this offers bold licorice and black cherry aromas and zesty, layered flavors of plum, soy and cracked black pepper. Drink now through 2020. 2,250 cases made.

name: Blancaneaux Rutherford
review: Crisp and precise, this white offers lemon-lime and green apple flavors that are juicy and vibrant, following through on the long finish. Toasted almond skin and dried honeysuckle flavors add complexity. Viognier, Roussanne and Marsanne. Drink now. 1,260 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Elegant, stylish and well-balanced with well-defined flavors of ripe plum and anise and an attractive, sweet vanilla-oak character. Very well made and balanced. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley A-12
review: Dark and rich, with chocolate, berry and cherry flavors that are firm and intense. Turns chewy.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Rutherford
review: An intense mix of grapefruit, pear and green apple flavors, vivid and bursting with details of lemon thyme and lime zest. Sleek and juicy on the finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rutherford Edizione Pennino
review: A Chianti-lovers Zinfandel, offering lively acidity and good focus, combined with zesty flavors of cherry, dill and smoky spice. Drink now through 2023. 2,800 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Rutherford Edizione Pennino
review: Ripe and traditional, this offers bold aromas of licorice and dried cherry, with ripe, dense, briary pepper, black olive and smoky sage flavors. Best from 2015 through 2020.

name: Blancaneaux Rutherford
review: Crisp and flinty up front, with an intriguing mix of dried pineapple, lemon, grapefruit and nectarine flavors that are delicate and light, yet intense and powerful at the same time. The components really come into focus on the finish, where an appealing yellow raisin accent kicks in. Marsanne, Roussanne and Viognier. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dark, intense and firmly chewy and tannic, with dried plum and cherry flavors that are long and complex.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley A-1
review: An intense and chewy wine, with dried cherry, berry, earth, leather and anise flavors that have length.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Zinfandel Rutherford Edizione Pennino
review: An old-school Zin, with bright cherry and boysenberry fruit, featuring briary, zesty accents of licorice, underbrush and cracked white pepper. The tannins firm up on the finish. Drink now through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Rich and earthy, with a tight, firm, chewy beam of currant, lime and cola.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dry, with complex, earthy currant, mineral and cedar flavors, finishing with a leathery note.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A touch volatile, though it adds to the aromatics and vibrancy. Ripe black cherry, anise, cedar, earth and mushroom flavors.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Chewy, dry and earthy, with metal, charcoal and currant flavors that, while a bit off, are nonetheless complex and appealing.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: A bit nutty and earthy, but followed by an impressive core of rich, earthy currant and dried berry. Cleans up with aeration.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Beautifully preserved, with floral, dried cherry, coffee and exotic spice flavors. None of the nutty, Sherry-like flavors you usually find in wine this old.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 1882
review: This potent, chewy Cabernet offers a rustic mix of crushed rock, loam, cedar, dried herb, tobacco and dark berry flavors. Drink now through 2024. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Cask
review: Both bottles displayed a Bordeaux-like character, presenting seductive dill and cedary oak notes, which add texture and depth to the licorice-laced currant and dried herb flavors. Very complete and a good bet to gain. Drink now through 2024. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Cask
review: A scaled-down version, with complex, savory aromatics of dried currant, herb, licorice and crushed rock, ending with dry, chewy, gritty tannins that should reward short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2022. 6,700 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford
review: Ruggedly tannic and trim, with an austere tension between the firm tannins, snappy fruit notes and tangy acidity, this is really a cellar-made effort that may well reward, as the blackberry and wild berry flavors are about as tightly wound as possible. Drink now through 2030. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Cask
review: Tight, rich and focused on a dense core of spice, dried dark berry, cedar and tobacco leaf, this is firmly tannic, ending with loamy earth, black licorice and crushed rock details. Drink now through 2023. 6,300 cases made.

name: Rubicon Rutherford
review: Very tightly wound but also well-done, in an austere style, putting an emphasis on structure and density at the expense of more opulent, supple-textured flavors, leaving the tannins in control and highlighting more crushed rock and gravel elements than truer, more expressive Cabernet flavors. Time will tell how successful this style is. Best from 2020 through 2030. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Napa Valley
review: This bursts with Meyer lemon, lime and green apple flavors, set on a sleek frame, with mouthwatering acidity and details of lemon thyme on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: In excellent condition, ripe and balanced, with tasty cherry and currant, turning elegant. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Good ripeness, with plum, cedar and cherry fruit, turning dry and leafy. Solid, though lacking the extra dimensions of the best.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Mature, dry, a touch earthy and a bit nutty. Still, there's plenty to admire, with its spicy black cherry and wild berry notes.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Racy and a touch volatile, with leathery currant, anise and sage flavors.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Dusty, cedary earth, roasted coffee, black cherry and sage flavors linger.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now through 2005.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Rich, intense, a touch nutty, but still offering pretty floral and currant flavors that beam through.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Minty, with good intensity to the mature, cedary and leafy berry flavors.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Waxy and drying, with faint cherry and berry notes that are quite appealing. Old yet graceful.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Rubicon Rutherford
review: This is marked by dusty berry, a strong oak presence and earthy tannins. Shows lots of cedary oak throughout, casting a dill edge onto the dried berry flavors. Tires on the finish, where the tannins and oak outlast the fruit. Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now through 2024. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley F-17
review: Intense, a touch musty, as if the cork suffered, but enough pure earthy, cedary Cabernet flavors pour through to admire.--Inglenook vertical. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Rutherford Cask
review: Dry, savory and herbal, with a trim expression of dried currant and lavender, ending on a drying note. Drink now. 7,250 cases made.

name: RC Reserve Rutherford
review: The fruit seems muffled and a touch earthy. The tannins frame modest flavors of blueberry, mineral and smoky herb. Syrah and Petite Sirah. Best from 2017 through 2023. 850 cases made.

name: RC Reserve Rutherford
review: Firm and densely structured, with notes of dried cherry, tobacco and spice. Tannins grip the finish. Syrah and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2021. 1,600 cases made.

name: Rubicon Rutherford
review: Strays into some odd barnyard funk and racy, mulched herb flavors at the expense of a purer fruit presence. The texture is grainy, and this ends clipped and dill-accented. Not likely to improve. Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,500 cases made.

name: Classic Burgundy Premium Select California
review: Soft and straightforward, with pleasant peppery rhubarb and strawberry flavors. Ultimately simple, finishing short, but makes a nice sipper. Drink now.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California Estate Cellars
review: Offers herbal, green-pea notes of good structure. For a soft, sweet style, this is a very pleasant sipper.

name: White Zinfandel California Premium Select Varietal
review: A crisp, refreshing version. Apples and peaches are well balanced, only slightly sweet. The focus is surprising and pleasing. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley A-4
review: Never was a great Inglenook; now the fruit has completely disappeared, leaving a thin tobacco and tea-like edge.--1974 California Cabernet horizontal. 11,864 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Corked.--Inglenook vertical.

name: Reunion Napa Valley
review: A magnificent, massively proportioned Cabernet with rich, concentrated cassis, cedar, plum and cherry flavors that are very lean and tight. It's very tannic on the finish now but give it five to 10 years and it should be a beauty.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Distinctive mint and herbal flavors, elegant and powerful, flavorful and complex; holds together smoothly.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Spicy, generous and complex, with sharply focused currant, plum and nutmeg flavors that zing right through the long finish. A wine with rambunctious flavors that become polished and lively on the finish. Should be at its best after 1996. 6,000 cases made.

name: Gravion Napa Valley
review: Vivid and stylish, with crisp structure and sharply defined aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with delicious oak, vanilla, orange peel and lemon flavors that are well-intergrated and deep; long, spicy finish. Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Reserve
review: Deep in color and fairly tannic with deep berry fruit and oaky aromas. On the palate it's concentrated with rich, elegant, black cherry flavors. Has intensity but it's not overblown.

name: Reunion Napa Valley
review: Tight and a bit tough, with well-focused cherry and plum flavors clamped tightly behind firm tannins and pronounced oak character. Try now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Smooth and polished, with intense cherry, currant, mint and herb aromas and flavors framed by hints of cedar. A bit tannic, but balanced, and almost elegant right through the finish. A youthful wine that can use until 1996 or '97 to buff the edges. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Ripe and exotic, with lots of coffee, cedar and spice overtones to the gentle core of very ripe cherry and raspberry. A stylish wine with plenty of tannin to support it, but the dominant characteristics are fruit and suppleness. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Firm, tight and concentrated, with a rich, focused band of currant, cedar and cherry-scented Cabernet flavors that turns complex on the finish, with hints of tobacco and oak. Firmly tannic, but developing a smooth texture. Drinkable now. Best after 1995.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Elegant and stylish, with pretty floral and fruity aromas, and rich, ripe pear and honey flavors to match. Picks up a rich toasty, smoky oak flavor on the aftertaste. Well balanced, complex and full. Drink now to 1993. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Cedar and menthol characters tend to outshine the fruit at this stage, with lots of tannin and some pretty fair Cabernet fruit and even an underlying silky texture. Big and powerful, very woody and definitely for the cellar.

name: Niebaum Claret Napa Valley
review: Loads of flavor in a lean, elegant style. The cedar, plum, cherry and cassis flavors are finely balanced by crisp acidity and soft yet firm tannins. The flavors keep on unfolding.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Crisp and firm, with ripe citrus, pear and apple flavors that are tart and clean. The finish is most impressive, as the flavors stay alive with zest and vitality. Drinkable now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: A big, rich, well proportioned wine with loads of ripe fruit, crisp acidity and oaky tannins that will need a year or two to settle. The rich pear, spice and pineapple flavors are fresh and lively. Finish gets coarse.

name: Reunion Napa Valley
review: Ripe, concentrated and smooth, with jammy red cherry and raspberry aromas and flavors, slightly toasty and spicy, very long and focused. Firm tannins need five years to resolve.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm, tannic and concentrated, with densely packed currant, plum and cedar flavors that persist into a solid finish. Needs time to loosen up. Try after 1996.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Firm and tough but flavorful, with plum, bell pepper and cherry notes, solid tannins, full body and a rough finish at this age. This hearty, straightforward wine should come around nicely if cellared until at least 1995. 14,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Reserve
review: Big and rich style with deep ruby color and ripe plum, spice, cherry and oak flavors that are dense and concentrated with firm acidity and tannins. It's got a fleshy texture and some length on the finish, but right now the wood stands apart from the fruit. Give it time to come together.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Cask
review: Lean and austere, with a tight, narrow range of currant and berry flavor that turns watery. Hard to say whether this will ever evolve into something more complex and interesting.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Austere style, with lean, thin, hard tannins and ripe plum flavors, but it lacks body and depth. Needs time to develop, but the aftertaste is pretty. Drink in 1993. Good value.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Crisp and firm, with moderately intense pear and pineapple flavors, picking up a citrus note on the finish. 12,800 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Reserve
review: Tight and tough, with lean currant and cherry notes that turn tannic on the finish. Balanced and ready to drink now through 1996.

name: Charbono Napa Valley
review: Purple and dense with grapy, berry aromas and flavors, hard tannins but a soft structure that manages to let the fruit burst through. This wine generally ages well.

name: Niebaum Claret Napa Valley
review: Has spicy aromas with cedar, plum and black cherry flavors that are lean and tight on the palate. Finishes with a touch of oakiness and tannin. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley
review: Lean but sharply focused, with generous spicy aromas and flavors. Needs time to come together.

name: Merlot Napa Valley Reserve
review: Harsh, woody, acidic and tough to like now, but the plum and cherry flavors could come through when the tannins soften. Drink now through 1996.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Spicy, leathery, tart and crisp in an Italianate way, mature and chocolatey rather than youthfully fruity. Needs a plate of aromatic pasta to bring out its best.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: This murky, simple wine has earthy currant and oak flavors that lack focus and offer only fleeting hints of spicy currant, but not much more. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Tight and astringent, showing green, unripe flavors that stray from the good currant and plum notes. Balanced, but could use a little more ripeness and flesh. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Attractive and fruity in a simple style, showing fresh aromas and charming, light apple and peach flavors. Flavorful and well-balanced in a modest way .

name: Gewürztraminer Napa Valley Late Harvest
review: Sweet and concentrated, with lots of honey aromas and flavors, not much to remind you of the varietal, but sweet, luscious and clean.

name: Niebaum Claret Napa Valley
review: Mint and cranberry flavors are shaded by plenty of stiff tannins and oaky accents. Tight, lean and rough—not for everybody. 3,600 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Napa Valley
review: Hard-edged and peppery, with drying oak dominating. The fruit tastes simple, barely ripe and shallow. Of marginal quality. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Virginia
review: Interesting cherry and anise flavors give this red good zip and concentration. Finishes on a charry, almost resinous note. Drink now. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Virginia
review: Quite light and spicy-tasting, almost like a medium-weight Pinot Noir. Tasting a bit mature now, but still decent. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Virginia Reserve
review: Soft texture, with pear and toast. Flavors fade a bit on the finish. Drink now. 525 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Virginia
review: Red plum, cedar and tobacco flavors dominate this straightforward red wine that ends on notes of rhubarb and mincemeat. On the light side. 450 cases made.

name: Viognier Virginia Reserve
review: Has butter and peach flavor, turning a bit dilute and dull on the finish. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Virginia
review: Tastes tired, with modest flavors of spice and dried cherry and a hint of vanilla. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Virginia Chesapeake Claret
review: This is a stewy-tasting and muddled wine, with roasted tomato and herb flavors and a green finish. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Virginia Special Reserve
review: Cloying cough syrup flavors dominate this astringently textured, off-putting wine. Not recommended. 250 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Coombsville
review: Aromas of mint and bay leaf carry over to the palate, giving this a pronounced edge of herbal, savory and charcoal details at the expense of riper fruit flavors. Drink now through 2024. 300 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: A firm red, with sandy tannins framing dark berry and licorice flavors, which persist nicely through the refined finish. Best from 2012 through 2016. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: Vibrant and rich, with a nice mineral note weaving through the ripe blackberry, tar and spice flavors. The fruit lingers on the open-textured finish. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: Distinctive, offering accents of loamy earth and green olive around a gentle core of blackberry. Shows presence and relatively light weight. Drink now through 2017. 9,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: Smooth and lush, with ripe berry and cherry flavors that mingle with notes of star anise, licorice and green tea. Drink now. 2,800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: A fresh red, with juicy currant and plum fruit on a medium-weight frame, shaded with hints of wet earth and coffee foam as the finish lingers against fine tannins. Drink now through 2014. 8,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Central Ranges Mountain Estate
review: This firm, chewy red shows a strong licorice note to the blackberry and coffee flavors. Best after 2013. 10,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet New South Wales Mountain Estate
review: Light and spicy, with a peppery accent to the blackberry and leather flavors, finishing soft. Drink now through 2017. 8,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon New South Wales Mountain Estate
review: Tangy, with earthy, vegetal flavors more prominent than the ripe red fruit, coming together awkwardly on the finish. Best after 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Perfect Day
review: Thick and lush, offering blueberry syrup notes and a core of wild blackberry flavors that are generous and plush, with details of nutmeg, paprika and tobacco, a toasted herb accent lingering. Drink now through 2026. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rosé Endless Crush OGV Estate
review: A lovely pink, with explosively floral strawberry aromas and supple flavors of watermelon and mineral. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rosé Endless Crush OGV Estate
review: Strawberry blossom and watermelon aromas lead to trim mineral and herb flavors. Drink now. 672 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Rosé Endless Crush
review: Appealing, with jammy strawberry and white chocolate flavors. Drink now. 1,350 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Russian River Valley
review: A crisp, clean style, with bright, vivid lemon notes up front and herbal grassy details in the background. Drink now. 191 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Russian River Valley
review: Appealing for its spicy pineapple and citrus aromas and crisp rather straightforward flavors. Drink now. 225 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Intense, focused, rich and spicy, with incredibly fruity flavors. The cherry, currant and oak flavors blend together well and good chocolate notes emerge on the finish. Drinkable now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Lean, firm and finely focused; boldly aromatic, with herbal berry and currant flavors; smooth and flavorful at the end. If the wood protrudes a bit, the fruit seems to pack enough punch to carry through. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Light and oaky, with pretty apple, spice and melon flavors that are lively and lingering, picking up a nice aftertaste that's charming and graceful. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Rich and floral, with full-bodied toast, pear, honey and vanilla flavors that are elegant and concentrated. Tight and firm, with a pretty aftertaste that echoes fruit. Drink now.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Fresh, fruity and lively, with raspberry and cherry flavors, firm tannins and a fruity finish. A hint of leather and earth in the aroma makes it interesting. Drink now.

name: Pinot Noir California
review: Light and pleasant, with slightly herbal, smoky notes to complement the modest cherry flavor. Drinkable now.

name: Pinot Noir California
review: Fruity, elegant and pleasing, with hints of black cherry, nutmeg and spice flavors. The finish lingers and it's not too tannic. Ready to drink now through 1993.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Light but fruity and charming, with apple, melon and butter flavors giving it substance. Has a lively balance between acidity and fruit.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Clean and refreshing. Has a crisp, grapefruity flavor and slightly grassy aromas.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Smoky, complex aromas are pleasing, but the flavors are less so, with tasty pear and stale Chardonnay flavors that flirt with bitterness. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: An earthy, rustic style that may not be for everyone, with ripe, pruny flavors and barnyardy aromas and firm tannins. Slightly bitter on the finish. A coarse but drinkable wine.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: A picture of finesse and delicacy, this dessert white combines apricot, peach, floral and apple aromas and flavors with a lively structure. It's concentrated, yet remains light and fleeting. Terrific texture and harmony. Drink now through 2022. 675 cases imported.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Thick and lush, bursting with apricot, beeswax, tangerine and honey flavors. This is cut with lively acidity, staying brisk and defined on the long finish. The aftertaste evokes fresh, ripe apple. Drink now through 2018. 1,080 cases made.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Racy and intense, this ice wine jolts the palate with its dried apricot, blood orange and mint aromas and flavors. It's very sweet, yet offset with bracing acidity and a tightly wound character that pulses through the long finish. Drink now through 2010.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: A lovely ice wine, combining a sweet element with pure flavors of apricot, peach and citrus, all focused and kept lively by its vivid structure. Terrific balance and harmony. This should age well. Drink now through 2007. 3,300 cases made.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Beeswax, Poire William, honey and spice flavors mingle in this ready-to-drink sweetie. Seamless, leaving a mouthwatering impression on the long aftertaste. Drink now. 1,100 cases imported.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Gold
review: This is a concentrated and intensely sweet version, with bright acidity to match, framing its flavors of apricot, apple cider and lemon candy, which stay persistent on the long finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Gingerbread, cinnamon and apricot aromas and flavors and a hint of truffle signify a complex, maturing dessert wine. Lively acidity and concentration transport the fruit and spice mélange to a satisfying conclusion. Drink now through 2001.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Offers a combination of rich apricot, peach and pear flavors, with intense sweetness, matched by a racy structure. Very pure and grapey, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2020. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Firm and racy, this displays herb and lemon confit notes backed by a vivid structure, which offsets the sweetness and adds gracefulness. It picks up a honey note on the finish. Drink now through 2008.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: The dessert white exudes apricot, apple, celery and light caramel flavors. Bright acidity keeps this balanced and light on the long, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2018. 6,693 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Beeswax, orange peel and dried apricot notes mark this aromatically intense dessert wine. Its sweetness is matched by bracing acidity, leaving a mouthwatering impression. Licorice aftertaste. Drink now through 2020. 1,750 cases imported.

name: Sparkling Vidal Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: A fine mousse adds effervescence to this dessert white. Peach, pear and honey notes abound. Despite the intense sweetness, this remains elegant and lively, with a crisp, clean aftertaste. Drink now. 985 cases imported.

name: Vidal Blanc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Pungent aromas of pear, clove and allspice lead to apricot and mango in this vibrant dessert wine. Balanced, staying focused without becoming cloying. Drink now through 2020. 1,636 cases imported.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Has purity and a supple texture, offering a foil for the apricot, passion fruit and dried citrus elements. Nicely balanced between sweet and tart, this leaves a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2016. 2,400 cases imported.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Rich and thick, with a sweet/tart character, mango, guava and apricot flavors and a vibrant structure. An up-front style that's sure to please. Drink now through 2006.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Sweet and thick, this ice wine sports grapefruit, honey and vegetal notes. Its intense sweetness is matched by vibrant acidity, keeping it all focused and clean on the lingering finish. Drink now through 2006.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Good ice-wine character, with a sweet-sour interplay. Thick and intense, showing mature aromas and flavors of baked apple, spice and dried apricot backed by a vibrant structure. Delicious. Try with apple tartine. Drink now through 2005. 3,475 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Like black currant candy, this is sweet, tangy and tasty. Stays light on its feet, balancing sweetness with bright acidity. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Shows a candied black currant flavor, like wine gum, along with juicy acidity. Light and balanced, with moderate length. Drink now. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Sweet berry jam and cinnamon notes highlight this red dessert style. On the soft side, with a citrus tang on the finish, keeping it clean and long. Drink now through 2015. 250 cases imported.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Supersweet, with candied apricot, citrus and lemon aromas and flavors. This is balanced by lively acidity, and the overall impression is elegant and harmonious. Has fine length. Drink now through 2018. 800 cases imported.

name: Riesling Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Doesn't taste particularly sweet, with smokiness augmenting apricot, honey and orange notes. Supported by bracing acidity, but lacks the overall harmony to be outstanding. Drink now through 2012. 1,400 cases imported.

name: Sparkling Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Sweet and fizzy, this will combine the best of both worlds for some. Aromas and flavors of honey and golden raisins, with an apricot accent, are balanced by a medium-bodied frame and lively acidity. Drink now.

name: Sparkling Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Very clean and focused, this ice wine with bubbles offers apricot, nectarine and passion fruit flavors in a rich, ample profile. The fizz gives it a lightness and cleansing quality. Good length. Well-done. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: A Vidal with finesse, this melds litchi, apricot and caramel flavors with bracing acidity and a smooth texture for a stylish impact. Remains light and fresh on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 2,900 cases made.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Thick, intense and glossy. Here's a butterscotch-tinged, herb and apricot dessert white, with a bright structure and lingering aftertaste. Drink now.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Gold
review: This racy version is sweet but balanced more on the tart side, with baked apple, apricot and honey aromas and flavors. Nice length. Drink now through 2022. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Showing some maturity, this mellow white evokes apricot, cinnamon, nutmeg and beeswax notes, with an underlying citrus accent. Well-balanced and long, it leaves a mouthwatering impression. Drink now through 2012. 1,600 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: This shows the black currant flavor typical of the grape, but also a vegetal note. Moderately sweet, with tangy acidity, it's an appealing if unusual dessert style. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine
review: Atypical but tasty. Shows all the Cab Franc notes of black currant, tobacco and herbs, in a frankly sweet style. Finely structured, with lively acidity and a lingering finish. Drink now. 1,420 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: Smells like Cabernet Franc, yet this is sweet and mouthcoating. An interesting interpretation of ice wine, with berry, black currant and honey flavors on a soft structure. A touch cloying on the finish. Drink now.

name: Sparkling Vidal Niagara Peninsula Icewine
review: Sweet and fizzy. Surprisingly delicate, given the sweetness, with beeswax, apple and honey notes and a background hint of earth. Ends with a chalky texture. Drink now. 1,600 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Klose Vineyard
review: A vivid, powerful, high-tension white. Considerable oak shows through in the buttery flavors, but it's solid with acidity and clean in taste. Intriguing, because each sip reveals nuances of pear, vanilla and nutmeg flavors that linger on the finish. 1,100 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Well done. Like a ripe Chablis, this white delivers honey, melon and the tiniest bit of apricot, interwoven with a lively, densely textured framework. If there's new oak, it's very discreet and takes a backseat to the fruit. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: A firmly textured, international style of Chardonnay, with an evident oak-aged character, and good acidity. The nutmeg, cinnamon and vanilla notes give it interest, and the finish is spicy and lingering. Seems slightly sweet, but not overdone.

name: Vidal Niagara Peninsula Ice Wine Oak Aged
review: Dried apple, with hints of marmalade and caramel flavors mark this ice wine. It's soft midpalate, picking up some tanginess on the finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Klose Vineyard
review: Buttery and somewhat rich, with pear and ripe apple flavors. Tastes of clove and vanilla on the finish. A little obvious, but tasty. Not imported into the U.S. 889 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Niagara Peninsula Klose Vineyard
review: This is an earthy wine, with black currant and herbal flavors. It has good concentration, with a hint of licorice on the finish. Fairly clean and well-made.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Round and generous, offering ripe black cherry flavor with light raisin and spice accents on a soft, ample frame that shows some concentration. 475 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Seeger Vineyard
review: Richly textured and mature in flavor, this Chardonnay nevertheless retains a gaudy array of aromas and flavors that don't blend together well, especially on the finish. Age has given it interest, but not much appeal. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Alliánce
review: A butterball, that overwhelms its fruit flavors of pear and apple. Turns earthy on the finish. Not for everyone. Not imported into the U.S. 250 cases made.

name: Ice Wine Ontario
review: Restrained and well-balanced, this offers apple, light peach and honey flavors, quite sweet. Well-made, though a candied, slightly foxy note detracts.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Peninsula Founder's Show Reserve
review: Minty, earthy aromas segue into spicy cherry flavors in this firm, lean red. Silky in texture, but the fruit is overshadowed by the structure. Finishes lean. Drink now.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Shows some power in the full-bodied texture, ripe apple flavors and firm acidity, but an herbal edge detracts from the varietal character. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Seeger Vineyard
review: An extremely oaky style of Chardonnay, from the butterscotch aromas, to the thick, chewy texture, to the seemingly sweet, vanilla flavors on the finish. Some will find it intriguing, but we think it lacks fruit character and finesse.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula
review: Straightforward, clean and fresh, with simple apple flavors and good acidity.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: A simple and fruity white that is of decent quality, but has little Chardonnay character. Soft and clean, but just bland.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Seeger Vineyard
review: This is a heavy-handed wine with butterscotch aromas and flavors that crowd out the meager fruit flavors underneath. Drinkable, but lacks balance and freshness. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Beamsville Bench
review: A lot of butter and smoke flavor shows through the thin core of fruit in this medium-bodied Chardonnay. It lacks definitive fruit flavor, and turns thin and candied on the finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Niagara Peninsula Reserve
review: Soft spice and brown sugar aromas give way to light cherry and leather flavors. Light and simple; drink up. 856 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Niagara Peninsula Schuele Vineyard
review: Starts out promising but doesn't deliver the goods. Smells fruity and clean, but the taste is merely nutty and vegetal. Getting tired. 6,400 cases made.

name: Ice Wine Brae Burn Estate Ontario
review: Honey and raisin notes are pleasant but marred by a varnish note. Medium-bodied and sweet on the palate, but also quite tart. It's soft and fading now; drink up.

name: Ice Wine Brae Burn Vineyard Niagara Peninsula
review: Aggressively vegetal and swampy aromas are off-putting but the palate is better, with modest honey and apricot flavors, sweet with tart acidity.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley
review: Ripe and fruity, with layers of pear, melon, citrus and apple flavors. Some may find the non-oaky style appealing. Certainly the label will draw your attention. Drinkable now.

name: Ice Wine Okanagan Valley
review: Pure honey and apricot, extremely sweet, moderate acidity, yet not enough to age beyond 1997. A delicious dessert wine for current enjoyment. 355 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Okanagan Valley Reserve
review: Somewhat austere, this features mineral-like flavors, and a hint of crisp apple on the finish. Quite clean and bright. Refreshing. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Meritage Dark Horse Estate Vineyard Okanagan Valley
review: Cedar and dill flavors dominate the cherry today, and there are some drying tannins that upset the overall balance in this medium-bodied red. Drink now through 2006. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Okanagan Valley Inkameep Vineyard
review: Has a strong floral, candied character that trails off into a raw oak note on the finish. Doesn't hang together.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Ripe raspberry and strawberry flavors are plush and velvety, accented with details of roasted cumin, cinnamon and thyme. Shows plenty of focus on the long finish. Drink now through 2022. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Victoria
review: Effusively peppery, with tremendous black and white pepper aromas that lace through the vigorous blackberry, currant and floral flavors, finishing with impressive vibrancy and length. Best from 2009 through 2016. 750 cases imported.

name: Syrah Yarra Valley
review: Fresh, expressive and light-footed, with delicate hints of sandalwood, black tea and mint layered around a lithe core of blackberry and licorice, lingering with refinement and fine tannins. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: Lithe and supple, the juicy blackberry and currant flavors balanced with lively acidity and fine-grained tannins. Appealing for its balance and sense of refinement. Drink now through 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Lithe and spicy, this is delicate in texture, with red cherry and coffee notes mingling attractively on the fine-grained finish. Lingers well. Drink now through 2012. 500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Yarra Valley Mea Culpa
review: Bright and jazzy, with a meaty edge to the raspberry and plum fruit, lingering against refined tannins. Best after 2013. 25 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Plush and elegant, with raspberry, cherry and fresh sage notes that are harmonious, juicy and intense on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 1,900 cases imported.

name: Syrah Yarra Valley
review: Complex earth, herb and forest floor notes complement the dark berry flavors, with hints of kirsch and black walnut. The tannins gain some traction on the finish. Drink now through 2030. 250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Focused and distinctive, featuring a contrast of blueberry and red fruit flavors, with an earthy edge shading the extended finish. Needs time to come together. Best from 2016 through 2020. 3,800 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Australia
review: Smooth and vibrant, brimming with blackberry and black pepper flavors, finishing on a floral note. Drink now through 2009. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Victoria
review: Crisp and peppery, with a floral edge to the berry flavors, all resting on a silky texture, sailing impressively onto a harmonious finish. Drink now through 2010. 1,800 cases imported.

name: Syrah Victoria
review: A focused, peppery style, with refinement and grace to its structure, offering dark berry, black tea and spice flavors that linger on the lean finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Syrah Yarra Valley
review: The tannins show an appealing density and a chewy edge, with licorice, blackberry and black cherry flavors, accented by details of Earl Grey tea. Offers plenty of focus. Drink now through 2026. 500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Bright and zingy, with lemony pear and floral flavors that linger on the lively finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Bright pink, soft and sweet, with a pretty spice and rose petal character to the delicate raspberry fruit. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Delicate and appealing for its subtly perfumed watermelon and rhubarb flavors, finishing lightly sweet. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Yarra Valley
review: Light, crisp and dry, featuring tangerine-accented peach flavors that finish with zip. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: Bright and juicy, with cherry and spice flavors that leap from the glass, lingering on the silky finish. Drink now through 2011. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Crisp, fresh and inviting, with dark berry and orange peel notes weaving through fine-grained tannins, finishing with intensity. Drink now through 2017. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Victoria
review: Silky, vibrant and light on its feet, this plays boysenberry and spice flavors on a deftly balanced frame. Drink now through 2012. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Wild strawberry, watermelon and raspberry coulis flavors are generous and round, with spice and marmalade details on the finish. Drink now. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Firm, with vanilla and cedar notes that lend a spicy edge to fleshy cherry and raspberry flavors, gaining intensity on the finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Strikes the right balance between plump, juicy cherry and cranberry flavors, and toasted herb notes, with cedar and spice accents lingering on the finish, gaining momentum. Drink now through 2026. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The vivid pear, lemongrass and lime zest flavors show an air of elegance, with a supple texture and a lingering, juicy finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Spicy style has lots of cinnamon and nutmeg floating through the apple and grapefruit flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2008. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Victoria
review: Bright and appealing for its juicy, parsley-accented apple and star fruit flavors, hovering quietly on the finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: This light, tangy Pinot features a tart edge to the modest cherry and spice flavors, lingering gently. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Victoria
review: A smooth, lilting red, offering blueberry and spice flavors that dance through a lively finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: A cheerful mix of candied watermelon, strawberry and fresh raspberry notes. Spicy and round on the finish. Drink now. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Honeysuckle, candied violet, strawberry and watermelon notes have an appealing cotton candy overtone and a juicy finish. Drink now. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Peppery spice, earth and dried floral accents to the plum and cola flavors, with robust tannins on the finish. Drink now. 3,800 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: The pear, lime and grapefruit notes are fresh and crisp, with accents of matcha green tea on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Fresh, direct in flavor and appealing for its light melon and apple fruit. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Yarra Valley
review: Light and smooth, with pretty apple, peach and floral flavors, lingering on the slightly bitter finish. Drink now. 750 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: This bright, vibrant wine offers a spicy raspberry flavor bouncing through the lightly sweet, easy-drinking finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Yarra Valley
review: Lively and sappy, with juicy pear, fresh orange peel and resiny flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Victoria
review: Light and crisp, this sings with lively cherry and spice flavors that linger easily. Drink now. 3,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and tangy, this gentle style offers currant and rhubarb flavors that linger pleasantly. Drink now through 2014. 500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Yarra Valley
review: Light and open, with pretty cherry and mint aromas and flavors, lingering on the refined finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese-Merlot Barossa-Yarra Valleys
review: Bright and lively, with raspberry, white pepper and sweet spice flavors mingling nicely on the light, juicy finish. Also contains 5 percent Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Australia
review: Very firm and lean, with lots of spice and decadence to the medium-weight berry flavors. Needs time to soften. Best after 2012. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Syrah Yarra Valley
review: The berry flavors are appealing, showing a slightly candied edge, with spice, cola and nougat accents lingering on the easy-drinking frame. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Victoria
review: Crisp and juicy, with a leafy, floral detail to the juicy lemon and lime flavors. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: A vivid pink color, sweet and tangy, with watermelon and goji berry flavors. Drink now. 7,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Yarra Valley
review: Light and crisp, with green apple and honeydew flavors. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese-Merlot Victoria
review: Light and juicy, with strawberry candy and a touch of peppermint as the flavors linger against smooth texture. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Pinot Gris Yarra Valley
review: Light-footed, with a raw texture to the green melon flavors. Drink now. 225 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Colored a neon pink, this is sweet, bordering on syrupy, with floral notes around a core of watermelon fruit. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Victoria
review: Bright and refreshing, with an herbal edge to the apple flavors. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Viognier Central Victoria
review: Wonderfully aromatic, with violet-scented berry and peach aromas and flavors, but the tannins clamp down unhappily. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Moscato Victoria
review: Lightly effervescent, floral and cloying, with a soapy edge to the watermelon candy flavors. Drink now. 4,200 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough Single Vineyard
review: Tangy and bright, featuring fresh raspberry and cherry flavors up front, with notes of white chocolate, loam and forest floor shining through on the complex finish. Polished tannins. Drink now through 2027. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Single Vineyard
review: Juicy and bright, with a crisp mix of grapefruit and lemon notes on a light body. A touch of almond skin shows on the finish. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Riesling Canandaigua Lake Rice Timothy Moore
review: Fresh-cut green apple, pear skin and jasmine notes mingle here, with pleasant zip on the fennel-tinged finish. Drink now through 2015. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Seneca Lake Doyle Timothy Moore
review: Bright and fresh, with tasty apple, anise and green fig fruit flavors, offset by a light slate hint on the finish. Solid. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Dry Joy
review: This has a good, bracing feel, with tight pippin apple, slate and fennel notes that crackle through the finish. Not much range but bright and defined. Drink now through 2016. 165 cases made.

name: Riesling Keuka Lake Simmons Timothy Moore
review: Has a soft edge, with a plump core of melon and pear fruit backed by a hint of anise on the easy, open-knit finish. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Wisdom Reserve Finger Lakes
review: Solid, with dark plum and black cherry fruit nicely layered with roasted tobacco leaf and cocoa notes. Shows nice, fleshy drive on the finish. Cabernet Franc and Merlot. Drink now. 50 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Finger Lakes Peace
review: Light but persistent, with bitter grapefruit, rose water and watermelon notes supported by a hint of citrus oil. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Grüner Veltliner Finger Lakes Rhythm
review: Light peach, straw and grapefruit notes give way to an easygoing finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Finger Lakes Wisdom
review: Singed tobacco and pepper notes lead the way, backed by modest cherry fruit at the core. A pepper note lingers on the slightly crisp finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Finger Lakes Lust
review: Lightly firm, with woodspice and dried cherry notes. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Off-dry in feel, with lightly candied lime, green apple and kiwifruit notes, giving way to a bubblegum hint on the finish. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Riesling Seneca Lake Doyle Family Vineyards
review: This has more bones than fruit, with taut fennel and lime zest notes and a slightly lean, talc-tinged finish.  Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Tinned apple and pear juice notes with a modest finish. Off-dry; almost cloying. 1,100 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Off-dry, with pineapple and fruit cocktail notes, followed by a soft, round finish. 125 cases made.

name: Riesling Finger Lakes Love
review: Light tinned apple and pear juice flavors, with a cloying finish. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 500 cases made.

name: Red Blend South Eastern Australia
review: A focused mix of fresh herb, juicy cherry and plum flavors, with licorice notes and firm tannins. Shiraz and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 63,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Fresh herb notes give this a distinctive green edge, with rustic tannins and ripe berry and cherry flavors. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Saralee's Vineyard
review: Earthy, dirty, has a funky menthol edge. 130 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Swartland
review: Ripe and flattering in feel, with ginger, orange curd and dried peach notes, backed by a waxy texture and a lingering straw accent on the finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,600 cases made.

name: Syrah Swartland
review: Friendly, featuring a beam of ripe, fresh cherry and plum paste flavors lined with a red licorice note. A dash of sweet toast shows on the finish. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Kolbroek Swartland
review: A pretty, floral, breezy Syrah, with cherry and damson plum fruit laced with violet and white pepper accents. A light shiso leaf detail echoes through the silky finish. Syrah. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Kedungu Swartland
review: Juicy and direct, with a mix of cherry and raspberry fruit spiked with a liberal savory note and backed by sanguine and white pepper hints. Syrah, Cinsaut and Mourvèdre. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Elementis Swartland
review: Dried nectarine and orange pith notes form the core here, draped with a cidery element. A musky accent runs through the finish. A skin-contact style that doesn't quite succeed, lacking energy and direction. Chenin Blanc. Drink now. 75 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Firm in texture, brimming with raspberry, black cherry, violet and herb flavors that come together harmoniously on the finish against refined tannins. Offers presence and persistence. Best from 2018 through 2024. 30,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley
review: Trim and rather taut, with modest blackberry and dusty herb flavors that finish with gritty tannins. Best after 2018. 50,000 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: Supple and focused, this red offers black cherry, smoke, leaf and licorice flavors, with light, well-integrated tannins and juicy acidity. Finishes with refreshing bitterness, in a savory style. Drink now through 2019. 5,600 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: This polished red delivers cherry, roasted plum, tobacco and cedar flavors, with light, firm tannins and a silky, spicy finish. Balanced, in the traditional style. Drink now through 2018. 4,800 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: This supple red offers nicely focused flavors of black cherry, fresh herb and smoke, with a plump texture and just enough tannins for grip. Drink now through 2014. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: Cherry, plum and chocolate flavors mingle in this fresh, chewy red, which has notes of smoke and earth, with good grip and a clean finish. Drink now through 2012. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: Smoky and leafy notes accent plum, dark chocolate and fresh herbal flavors in this round red. Features a smooth texture, with light tannins and gentle acidity. Drink now through 2022. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: Cherry, forest floor and tea flavors mingle in this light red. Light tannins keep this focused, offering just enough acidity to stay lively. Drink now through 2019. 6,500 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey Crianza
review: This supple red is fresh and focused, with snappy cherry and leafy flavors supported by lively acidity. Offers light grip and a clean finish. Drink now through 2018. 5,600 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey
review: This supple red offers cherry, herbal and light spicy flavors, modest in intensity but fresh and balanced, over light tannins. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Tempranillo Rioja Rivarey
review: This fleshy, supple red offers sweet cherry fruit, slightly candied, with notes of chocolate and mint. This has light tannins and gentle acidity. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza Mi Terruño Reserve
review: Slightly high-toned, with cherry pie and plum jam notes, backed by hints of cocoa powder and licorice. There's a nice rounded feel on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Mendoza Mi Terruño Reserve
review: A ripe, forward style, with creamed peach, piecrust and grilled hazelnut notes. Flattering. A crowd-pleaser. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza Mi Terruño Reserve
review: Plump, with slightly jammy plum and cherry fruit that stays rounded through the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto Testa
review: Apple cider and tarte Tatin flavors mix with hints of almond, smoke and spring blossoms in this tangy Pinot Grigio, which is fresh and focused, with a modest, cherry pittinged finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Veneto Testa
review: A straightforward white, with apple, lemon curd and nut notes. Moderate finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Merlot Veneto Testa
review: Easy-drinking, with modest black cherry, green plum and spice notes. Light, creamy finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Veneto Testa
review: Light-bodied and tangy, with subtle berry and pomegranate fruit. Rustic. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Nero d'Avola Sicilia Emperors
review: This solid red offers enough spicy plum, black cherry and wild herb notes to carry the slightly grippy finish. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Graham Norton's Own
