review: Rich and juicy, with honeysuckle, lanolin and savory, saline elements to the plump peach and melon core, finishing with vibrant acidity. Drink now. 60,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Fragrant and complex, with floral overtones of violet and plumeria to the fresh plum, black cherry and cassis notes. Fleshy and crisp-edged, this turns toward mineral details on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Organic
review: Features an appealing white peach note to the core of bright, refreshing citrus flavors, with some orange zest accents and lip-smacking acidity. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A grassy, herbal element adds dimension to the sturdy, tangy orange peel, green pear and apple flavors. Lemon zest aromatics kick in on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Central Otago
review: Fleshy, with dark plum and cherry flavors that mingle with spice and tobacco notes, firming on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough Eight Point Vineyards
review: Light-bodied and mouthwatering, with a fresh lemongrass aroma and plenty of lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors. Fresh herb notes emerge on the finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and refreshing, with lime and pear flavors that glide along on the finish. Drink now. 50,000 cases made.

name: Tempranillo-Cabernet Texas
review: Smoky, with thickly layered plum, prune and cocoa flavors followed by a raisined note on the finish. A bit heavy-handed. 400 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Texas Cornelious
review: Thick and dull, with prune and raisin flavors that lack definition or focus. Heavy-handed finish. 500 cases made.

name: Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon Texas
review: Dull, with thickly textured prune and raisin flavors that are tiring. 1,000 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Dark, rich and concentrated, with beefy plum, mineral, wild berry, currant and spice nuances, aided by cedary oak and spice notes. A wall-to-wall wine with depth and complexity. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. New from Ken Brown of Byron Winery. Best from 2001 through 2008. 1,700 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County Ryan Road Vineyard
review: Dark and richly flavored, with mouthcoating layers of currant, blackberry, black licorice and exotic spices that are deeply concentrated. Tightly focused, too, with a long, dense, persistent finish. Tannins are ripe and smooth. Drink now through 2010. 341 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County Ryan Road Vineyard
review: Enormously complex and concentrated, deep and plush, with layers of currant, plum, mineral, spice and tobacco. Finishes in a long, luxuriant aftertaste. Drink now through 2010. 1,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Upper Bench
review: Serves up a generous core of vivid blackberry, boysenberry and wild berry flavors that are juicy and intense, with a loamy earth edge, and also concentrated and long on the finish. Has excellent acidity and structure. Drink now through 2012. 639 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Captures a wide range of complex flavors, with wild berry, stewed plum, black cherry, herb and peppery beef scents. Maintains a sense of elegance and finesse, supported by firm tannins, gaining richness on the finish. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2010. 2,217 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County Ryan Road
review: Dense, rich and marked by loamy earth, dried currant and berry flavors that have a savory quality, with excellent depth and concentration. Decant. Best from 2009 through 2013. 594 cases made.

name: Grenache Santa Maria Valley Nielson Vineyard
review: Firm and compact, with complex spice, wild berry, fresh mineral and earth flavors that are focused and persistent. Drink now through 2011. 1,000 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Very complex and concentrated, with beefy currant, spice, mineral, sage and floral notes, turning juicy and lively, with ample tannins. Drink now through 2008. 1,700 cases made.

name: Syrah San Luis Obispo County Ryan Road Vineyard
review: Tightly wound, with dense herb, tobacco, blackberry and tarry earth scents, this is a big, rich wine in need of short-term cellaring, given its dense, grainy tannins. Drink now through 2010. 1,272 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: A solid offering, with lots of spicy earthy cherry, raspberry and blackberry fruit that's well-defined. Plenty of acid and tannin to prop up the flavors, though it comes up shy on extra facets. Pricey. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2008. 1,591 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Upper Bench
review: Well-crafted, with earthy plum, raspberry, mineral and candied-berry flavors, it turns smooth and supple, with a hint of toasty oak and mocha. Drink now through 2010. 1,317 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Upper Bench
review: Sleek and well-proportioned, with ripe plum, cherry and raspberry fruit supported by firm tannins. A touch of anise and blackberry on the pretty finish. Drink now through 2008. 1,100 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Racy, with tight, juicy wild berry and blackberry flavors, shaded by earth, mineral, tar and anise notes. A bit clumsy on the finish. Syrah, Mourvèdre, and Grenache. Drink now through 2011. 1,682 cases made.

name: Syrah Santa Maria Valley Upper Bench
review: Austere, with a spicy, peppery band of chicory, dried currant, cedar and anise notes that veer to dryness on the finish, making it most appealing to those who prefer restraint. Drink now through 2009. 121 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Firm, intense and concentrated, with a tight tannic edge to the wild berry, blackberry and beefy, leathery scents. It turns smoky and tannic in the end, giving the finish a clipped feeling. Syrah, Mourvèdre and Grenache. Drink now through 2008. 241 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Pronounced earth and yeasty flavors hold sway in this concentrated Syrah; not in the same class as previous vintages. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. Drink now through 2004. 1,452 cases made.

name: Santa Barbara County
review: Dense, dark and stinky, with an overbearing smell of dirty leather, turning charry and bitter, masking whatever fruit once lurked within. Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre. 2,249 cases made.

name: Xinomavro Amindeon
review: Rustic, medium-bodied red, with dried cherry flavors and plenty of smoky notes on the crisp finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Amindeon Kelinos
review: Stewy aroma leads into tight flavors of dried cherry, berry and iodine. Xinomavro. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays de Florina Blanc de Noir
review: Displays aromas of spinach, with plenty of herbal and oniony notes. Xinomavro. 1,250 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Elgin
review: Stylish, with creamed yellow apple, melon and pear notes that stay fresh, balanced by a floral edge on the finish. Reveals a touch of shortbread in the background but relies on zip overall. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: A crackling lime-, flint- and chive-filled version. The crunchy, energetic finish is refreshing. Drink now. 10,500 cases made.

name: OMB Elgin
review: A plush, toasted style, with a mocha overlay to the plum, fig and boysenberry sauce notes. The fleshy, rounded finish lets the mocha note hold sway. For fans of the style. Shiraz, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Mourvèdre and Viognier. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: A very bracing, racy style, with chalk, sweet pea and fleur de sel notes that ripple through the bony but balanced finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: Bracing, displaying chalk, white asparagus and herb notes, laced with a hint of tangy citrus peel. Drink now. 8,400 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: Strong grass and chive components, with additional notes of grapefruit and white peach. Crisp finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Elgin
review: Rich, with a mix of straw, lemon verbena, chive flower and herb flavors. Turns a bit earthy on the finish though. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Primitivo di Manduria Ater
review: Silky and medium-bodied, this offers flavors of fig cake, smoke and date, with accents of ground anise, dried cranberry and mocha. Juicy. Drink now through 2021. 2,500 cases made.

name: Ghemme
review: Plummy and simple, with hints of dried mushroom. Medium-bodied, with medium tannins and a fruity finish. Good wine. Not easy finding a decent Ghemme, but this is one. Best after 2005. 650 cases made.

name: Vespolina Colline Novaresi
review: Clean and fruity, with hints of berry and tobacco. Medium-bodied, chewy tannins. Best after 2004. 250 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Colline Novaresi
review: Simple berry and cherry character with leather and earthy character. Drink now. 1,030 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Not One Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Polished and persistent, offering expressive red and dark berry notes that show orange zest, stony mineral and spice accents, with refined tannins. 728 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Fresh, expressive and light-footed, with a firm underpinning to the raspberry and white chocolate flavors, finishing with a hint of mineral. Drink now through 2021. 757 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Light and sleek, with orange peel and tea overtones to the pretty pear and berry flavors. Finishes gracefully, with delicacy. Drink now through 2017. 476 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: A lively style, with vibrant raspberry, pomegranate and red beet flavors, hinting at celery seed as the finish lingers brightly. Best from 2015 through 2019. 767 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Light and silky, with raspberry and peppermint flavors that ride easily over the fine tannins, finishing with zestiness. Drink now through 2016. 330 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Lean and trim, with modest cherry and mineral notes and a distinct earthy, savory streak. Best after 2018. 486 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Fresh and vibrant, with an animal edge to the dark berry flavors and an earthy note lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 402 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Eola-Amity Hills Not One Pelos Sandberg Vineyard
review: Taut and focused, with an earthy, minerally edge to the cherry flavors, lingering gently against modest tannins. Drink now through 2019. 280 cases made.

name: Penisola Sorrentina Gragnano
review: Spiced plum and pureed blackberry flavors are lively and fruit-forward in this crisp, lightly sparkling red, with accents of herb, spice and mocha showing on the juicy finish. Piedirosso, Aglianico and Sciascinoso. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Penisola Sorrentina Gragnano
review: Lightly frizzante, this tangy sparkler offers rustic notes of grilled plum, smoke and ground pepper. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Penisola Sorrentina Terra del Gragnano
review: A light and easy-drinking sparkling red, with hints of strawberry, herb and damson plum. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Penisola Sorrentina Lettere
review: Lightly frizzante, this red offers simple flavors of black fruit, earth and smoke. Drink now. 4,166 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Reserve
review: Well-defined, with a meaty note weaving through the dark berry and spice flavors, lingering on the round, generous finish. Drink now through 2013. 504 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light on its feet, showing a nice density to the orange tea-accented red fruit flavors, all while keeping the texture airy and refreshing. Silky finish. Drink now through 2016. 3,318 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Soft and generous, offering peach and melon flavors in a refreshing style. Drink now. 2,205 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Ripe in flavor, this is relatively light on its feet, with dark berry and licorice character on a broad frame, finishing with a toasty note. Drink now through 2012. 3,974 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Light and refreshing, with a peach note weaving through the apple and celery flavors. Drink now. 1,735 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and fragrant, with pretty currant and tar flavors. Drink now. 1,134 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Chalice Estate C Block
review: Broad and generous, ripe with cherry, plum and green peppercorn aromas and flavors on an open-textured frame, lingering easily. Drink now through 2020. 168 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon Chalice Estate
review: Light and sleek, with apple and nutmeg flavors on a lithe frame, finishing with modest intensity and pretty good length. Drink now through 2019. 432 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Light and bright, with a metallic tang to the blackberry flavor, finishing with zip. Drink now. 3,362 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Reserve
review: Smooth and inviting, with a sharp lift to the blackberry, mineral and licorice flavors, finishing with finesse. Drink now through 2014. 200 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley Classic Vintage
review: Seamless from start to finish, both rich and elegantly sleek. Floral Asian pear and creamy almond aromas lead to complex and delicately balanced flavors of lively lemon and raspberry, plus ginger and spice. The finish lingers beautifully. Drink now through 2016. 1,000 cases made.

name: Joy! Green Valley of Russian River Valley
review: This is deliciously mature but not the least bit elderly. Distinctive aromas of fresh ginger and dried apple lead to sleek and opulent flavors of citrus, almond cookie and mineral. The  finish is rich and crisp. Drink now through 2014. 90 cases made.

name: Wedding Cuvée Green Valley of Russian River Valley
review: Fresh and festive, this bubbly is built for a party, offering floral raspberry and spicy vanilla aromas and layered strawberry, lemon and hazelnut flavors that finish on a bright, crisp note. Drink now through 2014. 2,250 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley Classic Vintage
review: A sleek, impeccably focused bubbly that combines rich aromas of yeast roll and apple with layered, vibrant lemon zest, mineral and spiced almond flavors, offering a crisp, laserlike finish. Drink now through 2014. 2,300 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley Classic Vintage
review: Lovely floral aromas lead to a complex yet elegant wine, offering crisp apple and citrus fruit, with notes of pear, fresh almond and yeasty brown spices. Drink now through 2014. 2,225 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley LD
review: Nicely mature, but still young at heart. Aromas of toasty crème brûlée and ginger, with a hint of rubber, open to rich and luscious flavors of baked apple, cinnamon bread and hazelnut. Drink now through 2016. 50 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley LD
review: Beautifully structured and aging gracefully, this sparkler slowly unveils layers of toasty brioche, baked apple, hazelnut and almond. Drink now. 40 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley X
review: Bold aromas of toasted hazelnut and ripe red apple lead to rich flavors that focus on power as much as elegance. Notes of cherry and citrus mix with Asian spice and ginger, ending with a crisp lift of acidity. Drink now through 2016. 500 cases made.

name: Brut Green Valley of Russian River Valley X
review: Graceful and refined, with crisp apple and yeasty lemon aromas that lead to complex flavors of toasted almond, ginger and spicy mineral. Finishes with pinpoint crispness. Drink now through 2015. 500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Sonoma County Green Valley Cuvée Joy
review: Enormously complex with its ripe fig, melon, apple pear and spice flavors and distinctive lime and mineral accents. Turns smooth and silky on the finish while the flavors linger. Best Iron Horse Chardonnay in some time. 99 cases made.

name: Joy! Green Valley of Russian River Valley
review: A deft blend of richness and delicacy, offering mature aromas of spiced apple, almond and cinnamon, with opulent flavors of toasty crème brûlée, laced with notes of mineral and ginger. Great length. Drink now through 2016. 25 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Sonoma County Green Valley
review: A lovely floral and berry bouquet gives way to rich, concentrated raspberry, strawberry and cherry flavors that unfold on the palate. The tannins and acidity give it depth and structure. A sensational wine that has great potential.

name: Wedding Cuvée Green Valley of Russian River Valley
review: Sleek, crisp and vibrant, offering floral strawberry and sweet ginger aromas, with luscious raspberry and lemon fruit, plus accents of spice and mineral, followed by a bone-dry finish. Drink now through 2016. 3,600 cases made.

name: Blanc de Blancs Green Valley of Russian River Valley Ocean Reserve
review: Sleek and expressive, with baked apple, spice and mineral aromas and lovely, precise lime, kiwifruit and almond flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Very pure and intense, featuring raspberry, black currant, cherry and spice aromas and flavors. There's ample oak for support, as well as firm tannins and bright acidity, but this is all about the fruit, silky texture and persistent aftertaste. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2014 through 2025. 2,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Red Label
review: Resinous sawdust aromas mark this elegant, juicy, raspberry-, cherry- and currant-flavored red, which settles down, with excellent persistence and grip on the finish. Harmonious and graceful. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best from 2014 through 2025. 500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: A pure beam of raspberry, violet, cherry, spice and mineral, with a gentle dose of oak for support. Elegant and harmonious, though requires time to unwind. Shows fine intensity and length. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2014 through 2027. 1,700 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Blackberry and floral aromas, with hints of new wood, lead to a full body, with fine, silky tannins and a fruity finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Best after 2011. 2,200 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Offers blackberry character, with cassis bush and cedar. Full-bodied, with currant and berry notes and hints of new oak. Long and silky, with a little too much new wood. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2011. 1,200 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Features a really nice velvety texture, with currant, berries and toasty oak that are all in the right place on the palate. This is full, yet balanced. Long and pretty. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2012. 2,165 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Reticent in aroma, this shows black cherry character tempered by milk chocolate and sweet spice flavors. Herbal accents enter the mix, and this concludes with a stiff chorus of tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2014 through 2022. 300 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Impressive blackberry and black licorice. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins, yet soft, with a long, ripe fruit and vanilla aftertaste. All there. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Very good for a 2002. Best after 2007. 1,080 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Intense aromas of blackberry and grilled meat. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and lots of ripe fruit and vanilla character on the finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2008. 2,250 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Beautiful blackberry and cherry aromas follow through to a full-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a long caressing finish. A beauty. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2005. 850 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Focused aromas of chocolate, currants and berries follow through to a medium-bodied palate with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Not a big wine, but very fine and enjoyable. This gets better every year. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Sangiovese. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2006. 1,100 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: A rich wine with blackberry and meat character and hints of dark chocolate. Full-bodied, round and soft. Loads of lovely fruit. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2006. 2,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: A solid red with black cherry, violet and toasted oak on the nose. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins. Very long and racy. Sangiovese and Cab. Another winner from this producer. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2005. 900 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Merlot Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Very rich and spicy, with lots of blackberry and dark chocolate character. Full, round and chewy. As it should be. Best after 2009. 2,500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Interesting aromas of dried berry, cherry with currant. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Well-crafted. More in balance than the black label. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2004. 1,250 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: There are cherry and strawberry flavors in this red, along with a veneer of vanilla and tobacco. Iron-clad tannins define the moderate finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2017 through 2023. 2,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: This features lots of currant and berries, with citrusy fruit character. Medium-bodied, this is slightly chewy and tough, but should soften with age. Has a little too much new wood. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2011. 1,165 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Blackberry, with currant and vanilla cream undertones. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a woody currant aftertaste. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Very ripe, verging on raisiny and Amarone-like. Full-bodied, with chewy, velvety tannins and plenty of fruit on the finish. A little rustic, but should mellow with a bit more age. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2010. 1,200 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Loads of vanilla and plum character, with ripe currant. Full-bodied, with soft tannins and a long, caressing finish. Subtle yet rich. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2004. 750 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Pretty blackberry, dark chocolate and mineral aromas. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Polished red. Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Bright, with cherry and raspberry flavors, shaded by spicy oak and underbrush notes. The tannins are firm and slightly dry on the finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best from 2016 through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Black cherry and plum notes, accented by charred and smoky oak, greet the senses in this powerful, brooding red, supported by a base of stiff tannins, leaving an astringent feel on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2026. 500 cases made.

name: Toscana Red Label
review: Rich yet firm, featuring cherry, plum and leather flavors, with a touch of resin. The balance leans toward the tannins, which should even out with time. Drink now through 2018. 2,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Green Label
review: Jam and plum aromas, with hints of cherries. Medium-bodied, with bright acidity and a tart finish. Strawberry and lemony flavors. Sangiovese and Mammolo. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Sweet and fruity, with some wood and dried flower undertones. Medium-bodied, fresh and lively. Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Damson, cherry and berry on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a clean, minerally finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Green Label
review: The cherry flavor is singed with graphite, tobacco and earth notes, delivering good varietal character, balance and moderate length. Drink now through 2016. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Lots of raisin, coffee and chocolate character on the nose and palate. Full and round, with soft tannins and a medium finish. A little earthy, but flavorful. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Red Label
review: Fresh and minerally, with a core of cherry and raspberry fruit. The flavors avoid being overtly fleshy, but show staying power. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2018. 2,500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Black Label
review: Vanilla and caramel notes accent candied cherry flavors in this straightforward, even light, red. Drink now through 2018. 850 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale White Label
review: Subtle aromas of minerals and berries. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins. Medium finish. Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Red Label
review: Cherry, chocolate and spice flavors mingle with dusty tannins in this soft, straightforward red. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Green Label
review: A fruity, simple red, with some plum and lightly stewed character. Sangiovese and Mammolo. Drink now. 835 cases made.

name: Sangiovese-Mammolo Colli della Toscana Centrale Green Label
review: Bright and fruity, with cherry and berry character. Medium- to light-bodied, with a simple finish. A new wine from this producer. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Toscana Red Label
review: Smells and tastes earthy, with modest cherry and berry flavors. Balanced on the astringent side, this finishes with dry tannins. Best from 2015 through 2023. 2,000 cases made.

name: Mourvèdre Lime Kiln Valley Enz Vineyard
review: Focused and fairly straightforward, with dried cherry, licorice and smoky spice flavors. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Amador County
review: Rustic, minerally and earthy, with slight black cherry and spice notes and bitter, tannic flavors. 313 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Victoria
review: A stylish wine, bright and jazzy, distinctive for its focused apple and pear and overtones of passion fruit and citrus. Drink now. 450 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Victoria Reserve
review: Dark and dense, with loud and distinctive mint and game aromas and flavors that pervade the solid black cherry that struggles to be heard through the din. Needs cellaring. Best after 2002. 80 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Victoria
review: Light and supple, with pretty blackberry and herbal flavors, finishing with some elegance. Drink now through 2004. 125 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Victoria
review: Light and refreshing, with lime and mineral flavors wafting through the zingy structure. Finishes smooth. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Petite Sirah Lodi
review: There's a whiff of dried lavender and vanilla bean to the pepper, jam and black tea flavors, with tannins that are appealingly chewy. Drink now through 2026. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz California
review: Nicely balanced to show off its pretty plum and anise flavors, with hints of blackberry and spice sneaking in on the silky finish. Nice now. Best after 1999. 3,850 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: A zesty little red, with notes of raspberry, grilled herbs and pepper. Drink now through 2019. 15,000 cases made.

name: Obsession Red California
review: Ripe and zesty, with cherry and tomato leaf aromas and soft, modest red currant and herb flavors. Merlot, Zinfandel and Petite Sirah. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Crown Jewel Library Collection Meritage California
review: A pretty, light-style wine, with cherry, raspberry, cedar, anise and herb flavors. Finishes moderately, leaving a hint of spice and vanilla. Drink now through 2002. 500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lodi
review: Tangy grapefruit, lime and passion fruit flavors are tasty, with fresh-cut grass and citrus notes that glide on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz California
review: Earthy, minty aromas are tinged with cherry, cola and tea notes on the palate in this straightforward presentation of Shiraz that gives its Aussie cousins real competition in the price/score ratio. Drink now through 2003. 10,000 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Lodi
review: The cedar and dried lavender notes are aromatic up front, with a core of cherry and berry flavors. Dusty, drying tannins grace the finish. Drink now through 2025. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc California
review: The mix of cherry, green bean and olive is a bit odd here. On the finish, however, the fruit wins out, leaving a pleasant lasting impression. A light style for drinking now. 11,500 cases made.

name: Merlot California Highlands
review: Fairly focused, with cherry, spice and licorice flavors, yet it's a little astringent on the palate and finishes short. Drink now through 2001. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Lemony, with toasty pineapple flavors on a medium frame. Drink now. 36,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz California
review: Though this is short on varietal character, there's plenty of zesty raspberry and spice flavors to keep it interesting. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Lodi
review: Peach, pineapple and pear flavors have good concentration, with a resinous, piney edge on the finish. Drink now. 22,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Pleasant citrus, mineral and toast flavors on a soft frame. Drink now. 28,000 cases made.

name: Merlot California
review: Refreshing, with racy berry and cedar notes. Drink now. 74,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine Reserve
review: Ripe and rustic, with raisin and cracked pepper aromas and modest spice and herb flavors. Drink now. 2,750 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc California
review: Grassy, herbal green notes take on a vegetal, oniony character that overshadows the crisp citrus flavors. 5,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lodi Old Vine
review: An unappealing combination of ripe and herbal, with notes with wild berry and spice. 8,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Smacks of simple cherry flavors, an herbal twist and a tangy edge. Finishes on the short side. 30,000 cases made.

name: Viognier California
review: Dull, listless aromas and flavors, showing hints of citrus and mineral. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California
review: Muddled, with sour fruit flavors and lots of earthy notes. 13,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon California
review: Vegetal, with funky, earthy notes. 45,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay California
review: Coarse, with dusty green flavors and an off-putting chemical edge. 40,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz South Eastern Australia
review: Bright, fruit-driven style, with berry and guava flavors up front and juicy. Tannins are soft, making this youthful wine approachable, but it will benefit from time in the cellar. Drink now through 2007. 5,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay South Eastern Australia
review: Light and crisp, with pretty citrus and melon flavors on a lively frame. Drink now. 5,000 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon South Eastern Australia
review: Soft and ripe, with mature plum, toast and herbal flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2004. 5,000 cases made.

name: The Baroness Barossa
review: Plays savory notes of bay leaf and eucalyptus against ripe cherry and spice flavors that expand to fill the mouth and linger on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Merlot Eden Valley Grand James Irvine
review: Focused, lively and savory, with a meaty note weaving through the peppery black fruit, finishing with a licorice accent. Has presence and a fleshy texture without excess weight. Drink now through 2019. 900 cases made.

name: Merlot Eden-Barossa Valleys Eden Crest Vineyards
review: Smooth and focused, feeling silky and pure under a veil of slightly scratchy tannins, offering generous currant, plum and vanilla flavors on a supple frame. Drink now through 2004. 200 cases imported.

name: The Baroness Barossa
review: Minty, herbal aromas and flavors predominate in this firm-textured but fine-grained red, picking up cherry notes on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Merlot Eden Valley Estate
review: Firm in texture and lean, with a tarry edge to the herbal cherry flavors. Drink now through 2017. 750 cases made.

name: Merlot Barossa Springhill
review: Herbal flavors and a tight structure make this a savory sip, finishing on a spicy note. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Echo Vale Classic Barossa Barossa Valley
review: An herbal style, with mint, rosemary and roasted green pepper flavors around a tight core of berry. Finishes with persistence. Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2017. 500 cases made.

name: La Mescla Sierra Foothills
review: Rustic yet pleasing, this delivers a firm mix of dried berry, cedar, tar and anise flavors, with chewy tannins. Tempranillo, Monastrell, Garnacha and Graciano. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Godello Ribeira Sacra Adrás
review: This white is quite muscular, with a firm, dense texture carrying the flavors of pear, melon, pine and chalk. Rich and harmonious, polished, fresh and clean. A whiff of sea salt shows on the finish. Drink now through 2019. 660 cases made.

name: Garnacha Campo de Borja Legado del Moncayo Montaña
review: Black cherry and currant flavors are ripe but fresh in this lively red. Chocolate, light herb and licorice notes add interest. Has balance and energy, with tangerine acidity. Drink now through 2018. 3,000 cases made.

name: Godello Ribeira Sacra Adrás
review: This generous white shows a nice balance of fruit and savory notes, with pear, fennel and mineral flavors, backed by clean acidity. Fleshy but focused, broad yet refreshing. Drink now through 2018. 600 cases made.

name: Utiel-Requena Bovale
review: Fresh and lively, this red shows a nice balance of black cherry, chocolate and bitter herb flavors, with gentle tannins and crisp acidity. The structure is modest, but this remains expressive and clean. Bobal. Drink now through 2018. 1,400 cases made.

name: Utiel-Requena Bovale
review: There's a pleasing sappiness to the flavors of black cherry coulis, plum compote, graphite and spice in this fresh and balanced red. Bobal. Drink now through 2016. 1,900 cases made.

name: Brut Cava Biutiful
review: Lightly smoky and crisp, this aperitif-style Cava offers a lively bead and notes of Asian pear, candied lemon zest and toast. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Cava Biutiful
review: A dry and smoky version, firm but balanced, offering subtle notes of black cherry, biscuit and orange peel, set on a lively, lacy bead. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 20,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Cava Biutiful
review: Loaded with strawberries and cream, candied ginger and biscuit flavors on a zesty bead, this lively rosé Cava is fresh and balanced, offering a smoke-tinged finish. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Garnacha Calatayud Acentor
review: Juicy fruit and a chewy texture combine in this lively red, filled with cherry, red berry and wild herbal flavors, revealing light notes of vanilla and spice. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Garnacha Campo de Borja Legado del Moncayo
review: A plush texture and gentle structure give this wine a relaxed feeling, with macerated cherry, dried berry, vanilla and light herb flavors mingling over light tannins. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Mencía Ribeira Sacra Adrás
review: Savory accents of garrigue and licorice frame the tart cherry and smoky flavors in this light, crisp red. Supple but lively, with a refreshing bitter note on the finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Verdejo Rueda Egeo
review: Peach, green apple and fresh herb flavors mingle in this crisp white. Fueled by racy acidity, this is fresh and clean. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Verdejo Rueda Egeo
review: Pear, herb, ginger and smoke flavors mingle in this firm white. Though light-bodied, this has focus and grip, with a crisp, smoky finish. A sleek, savory style. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Cava Biutiful
review: Dry and tangy, with a base of candied black cherry, showing hints of ripe plum, ground spice and strawberries and cream. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Rios de Tinta
review: Black cherry, black olive, smoke and gamy flavors mingle in this savory red. Grippy tannins and balsamic acidity support the round texture. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Verdejo Rueda Egeo
review: This light, firm white offers grapefruit and fennel flavors, with crisp acidity and a refreshing bitter note on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Mencía Ribeira Sacra Adrás
review: Herbal and smoky notes frame the black cherry fruit in this savory red. Light and fresh, with gentle tannins and modest acidity. Drink now. 660 cases made.

name: Tempranillo Viño de la Tierra de Castilla y León Sensible
review: Cocoa and coffee notes shadow black cherry, licorice and light herbal flavors in this red. Light tannins support a syrupy texture. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Utiel-Requena Bovale
review: Black plum, licorice and bitter chocolate notes show a rather austere, slightly gamy character in this light but rather chewy red. Bobal. Drink now through 2017. 2,100 cases made.

name: Brut Cava Biutiful
review: A modest sparkler, with juicy acidity, a smoky undertow and hints of green pear, lemon pith and candied ginger. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Cava Biutiful
review: Creamy, with a subtle palate of ripe plum, candied black cherry, ground spice and floral notes. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Garnacha Calatayud Acentor
review: Cherry and grape flavors mingle with smoke and black pepper notes in this light, crisp red. A bit sharp, but fresh and lively. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Verdejo Rueda Egeo
review: This gentle white offers light pear and lime flavors, with a light ginger note. Displays just enough acidity to remain lively. Drink now. 900 cases imported.

name: Brut Nature Cava Biutiful
review: Petrol and smoke notes underscore hints of yellow apple and citrus in this firm Cava, with a lively bead. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Cava Biutiful
review: A firm sparkler, with hints of smoke, salted almond and crunchy green pear. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Brut Rosé Cava Biutiful
review: Hints of herb and smoke lace crushed raspberry and glazed apricot flavors in this lightly juicy rosé. Modest finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Brut Nature Cava Biutiful
review: Very crisp, with light notes of crab apple, smoke and nut. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Brut Cava Biutiful
review: A simple version, balanced and fresh, with hints of citrus, white fruit and smoke. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Garnacha Campo de Borja Legado del Moncayo
review: This lean red shows tart cherry, leafy and gamy notes, in a supple texture with snappy acidity and a hint of spritz. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright, ripe and zingy, with grapefruit, pear and celery notes that linger enticingly through the vivid finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Round and spicy, framing its pear and mineral flavors with a wide swatch of oak, the fruit persisting impressively on the caramel-scented finish. Drink now through 2007. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This smooth, polished style has a wide range of citrus, mineral and pineapple aromas and flavors. A curious celery note adds extra interest as the flavors last impressively. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Bright and zingy, a lively mouthful of citrus and nectarine, with an almost cherrylike note that makes this vibrant, fruit-forward Chardonnay feel rich. Has more up front than on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 180 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Open-textured and generous with its apple, citrus and honey flavors on a racy, refreshingly tart frame, finishing ripe and focused. Drink now through 2002. 850 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Bright and lively, a juicy mouthful of crisp plum, red currant and chocolate aromas and flavors, which last and last on the effusive finish. Drink now through 2005. 2,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Ripe in flavor and open-textured, with fine-grained tannins weaving through the generous black cherry, red currant and spice notes. Drink now through 2003. 800 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough Dry
review: Light, soft and polished, with apricot-accented apple and lime flavors, lingering on the dry finish. Drink now through 2012. 100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Dry and tangy, with a tobacco note adding interest to the green olive and grapefruit flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now. 7,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Round and spicy, this tastes like it has oak influence, but not too much, with green pear and citrus flavors that linger gently on the lively finish. Drink now through 2008. 20,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Bright and herbal, with juicy lime, lemon and apple flavors shaded with distinctive green herb notes. Lively finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough
review: Bright and juicy, with a raw edge to the green apple and pear fruit. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Centered around a core of juicy and ripe yellow apple flavors, this is highlighted by citrus zest, pear and spicy details. Clean and refreshing. Drink now. 9,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Offers a robust mix of tangerine, Meyer lemon and melon flavors, with spice, citrus zest and floral details on a medium body. Refreshing finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: This bright white features a vivid acidity and tangy peach, lemon and green apple flavors, joined by a touch of grapefruit peel on the finish. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Peach, nectarine and apple flavors are fleshy and juicy, with a refreshing quality and an almond skin finish. Drink now. 2,100 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fresh and lively, with lime and apple flavors on a wide frame. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Noble Sauvage Marlborough
review: Sweet and tangy, with a green edge to the pineapple and quince flavors. Sauvignon Blanc. Drink now through 2006. 300 cases made.

name: Riesling Marlborough
review: Light and fragrant, with floral and lime flavors, finishing crisp and lively. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Fresh and lively, with racy green apple and herb flavors that last on the finish. Drink now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough
review: Lively, with very good intensity to lemon-lime, quince and green almond flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: The crisp black cherry and raspberry flavors have plenty of clove and baking spice details, with a toasty finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Trim and compact, offering crisp, clean flavors of fresh cranberry, raspberry and currant, with spicy details. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Light, tangy, with smoky cherry flavors that persist against slightly chewy tannins. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Firm and a little chewy, with some nice currant and spice flavors lurking under the layer of fine-grained tannins and lingering on the finish. Best from 2001 through 2005. 700 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and herbal, with a green edge to the citrusy flavors. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A fresh, straightforward style of Sauvignon Blanc, featuring tangerine, lime and apple flavors, with a hint of green pepper on the finish. Drink now. 2,280 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: A crisp, easy-going style, with spicy raspberry flavors. Finishes with a touch of cedar. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: Light and open-textured, with soft texture to the green pea and apple flavors. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Crisp, peppery style emphasizes the spicy, almost herbal character over modest fruit, finishing with some zing. Drink now through 2003. 140 cases imported.

name: Riesling Marlborough
review: Earthy aromas and flavors give this a profile different from the usual fruity Rieslings, nicely balanced to echo spicy notes on the dry finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Marlborough
review: Light and soft, with nice melon flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Earth, floral and lime flavors abound in this crisp, full-bodied, if atypical, Chardonnay, with a tequilalike note on the finish. Drink now through 2003. 200 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Marlborough
review: A bit unbalanced, with a hint of sweetness underscoring tart lime juice and grass flavors. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Has a bitter edge to the bright berry flavors, which persist.   4,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Marlborough
review: Gamy flavors are not the most wonderful balance to the modest fruit.   2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Marlborough
review: Tart and oxidized. 300 cases imported.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc Maestoso
review: Very lush and spicy, with gobs of kirsch, dark plum and dark cherry flavors that are accented by concentrated chocolate mousse notes. The long finish features lots of creamy notes and plenty of silky tannins. Grenache, Carignane and Syrah. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases imported.

name: Minervois La Livinière Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Prima Donna
review: An elegant style, featuring rich, ripe flavors of kirsch, dark cherry and raspberry, with plenty of cream notes. Milk chocolate and hints of mint linger on the finish, framed by silky tannins. Drink now through 2014.

name: Minervois La Livinière L'Oustal Blanc
review: Mouthfilling flavors of kirsch, chocolate and dark plum are refined and elegant. Excellent balance and bright acidity really power this luscious red along. Finishes with rich cream and spice flavors. Grenache, Syrah and Carignane. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases imported.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Maestoso
review: A suave yet powerful red, with ripe dark and red fruit flavors that are backed up by fresh acidity and plenty of spicy notes. The long, chocolaty finish is packed with silky tannins. Hard to resist. Drink now through 2015.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc
review: Ripe and rich, with alluring berry, cherry, plum and mineral flavors that are firmly supported by plenty of acidity and medium-grained tannins. The finish gushes with lively spicy notes. Grenache, Carignane and Syrah. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases imported.

name: Minervois La Livinière Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Prima Donna
review: A suave red, with deep, rich flavors of blackberry, cream, chocolate, hazelnut and spice. Very rich and ripe, with plenty of chocolaty notes that linger through the finish. Drink now through 2013. 50 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 3 White
review: Well-crafted and medium-bodied white, with a distinctive smoked hickory quality to it and a firm backbone of acidity. This is dominated by intense, mineral aromas and flavors with a touch of citrus. Quite oaky, but balanced. Drink now through 2007. 240 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 4 White
review: Powerful and concentrated, with loads of pretty ripe pear, lemon tart and baked apple flavors. Has a very Burgundian aroma and texture, with plenty of smoke and spice on the finish. Distinctive. Drink now through 2012. 10 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 6 White
review: A rich, full-bodied white, with flavors of apple, glazed apricot and plenty of spice. Quite smoky as well, with a long finish of butter and cream. Well-structured and distinctive. Grenache Gris and Macabeo. Drink now through 2013. 175 cases made.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso
review: Distinctive, with meaty aromas underscoring the dried cherry and plum fruit flavors, encased in a plush texture and supported by orange peel acidity. Accents of savory and sweet spice pair nicely with the grilled herb and smoky mineral finish. Needs air. Drink now through 2019. 350 cases imported.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso
review: This full-bodied red is filled with concentrated mocha, spice and dark plum flavors. Powerful, showing plenty of mincemeat and dark chocolate notes that linger on the ripe finish, with hints of mint. Drink now through 2013. 100 cases imported.

name: Minervois La Livinière Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Prima Donna
review: A refined red, with focused raspberry, spiced cherry and dark plum flavors that show some beefy accents. Features plum pudding, cream and dark chocolate notes on the rich, juicy finish. Drink now through 2017. 50 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 10
review: This is loaded with ripe dark fruit flavors—including plum confit, fig and blackberry—that are steeped with plenty of rich, spicy notes. An extracted style that lingers with dark chocolate and mocha accents on the finish. Drink now through 2016. 100 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 5 White
review: A complex, toasty aroma leads to a deep well of mineral, cream and spice. Dense and powerful, with a long finish of smoke and ripe apple. Decant. Drink now through 2012. 50 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français White Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 9
review: Well-spiced, displaying concentrated flavors of almond, pear tart, apple and peach that are flanked by notes of sage cream. The long, ripe finish features hints of roasted pineapple. Grenache Gris and Macabeu. Drink now through 2017. 20 cases imported.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso
review: Redolent of red raspberry, with plenty of verve to the red plum and spiced cherry. Leafy notes and pronounced mocha show on the rich, beefy finish.  Drink now through 2016. 150 cases imported.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc
review: Juicy red, with delicious cherry and raspberry flavors and notes of cream and chocolate pudding. Supple, with a pretty finish of spice and smoke.  Drink now through 2007. 940 cases made.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc Red
review: A fruit-basket red filled with blackberry, plum and raspberry with some coffee and chocolaty notes. Finishes with pepper and spice. Grenache, Carignane and Syrah. Drink now through 2005. 800 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 3 Red
review: Well-structured and fresh-tasting red, with cherry, red plum and cinnamon flavors along with notes of smoke and grilled meat. A good quaff for a barbecue.  Drink now. 1,180 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 7 Red
review: A juicy, powerful red, delivering concentrated flavors of dark plum, kirsch and mocha that are rich and well-integrated. Features chocolate and cardamom on the finish, with hints of mint. Drink now through 2014.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso
review: A lively, spicy red, with raspberry and red plum flavors that feature hot paprika and anise notes. The long finish offers pepper and smoke. Drink now through 2013.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc K11
review: A plush red, with a concentrated mix of wild plum, blackberry and boysenberry flavors, supported by soft tannins and fresh acidity. A dark chocolate accent lingers on the silky finish. Carignan. Drink now through 2016. 200 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Maestoso 3
review: Exotic red with a smoky, spicy aroma and ripe, concentrated flavors of dark plum, licorice and kirsch. Long finish of spice and mocha. Drink now through 2008. 100 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 4 Red
review: Succulent dark cherry and spice flavors fill this medium- to full-bodied red. The supple finish shows licorice and dark plum, with minerally elements. Drink now through 2011. 150 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 5 Red
review: Rich, dense and peppery, showing concentrated dark plum flavors, with lots of milk chocolate and violet notes. Has a supple finish of mocha and spice. Distinctive. Cinsault, Carignane, Syrah and Grenache. Drink now. 125 cases imported.

name: Minervois Domaine L'Oustal Blanc Giocoso
review: A supple red, with spicy melon and red currant flavors, accented by ginger and allspice. Hints of cream show on the juicy finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc Maestoso 4
review: Medium-bodied, with a rich aroma of chocolate and spice leading to flavors of dark plum, cream and kirsch. Shows notes of nutmeg on the finish. Carignane, Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 50 cases imported.

name: Minervois La Livinière L'Oustal Blanc
review: A lush red, with an interesting mix of red fruit flavors and intense cocoa powder notes. Finishes with lip-smacking cherry pie and spice. Grenache with Carignane. Drink now through 2011. 30 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc K8
review: There's good lift to the fruity red berry and plum flavors, which are accented by paprika notes and fresh ground white pepper. Shows hints of dried raspberry on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc K9
review: A juicy red, with lively red plum, raspberry and boysenberry flavors. Plush midpalate, displaying milk chocolate notes on the finish. Drink now. 175 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 2 White
review: Good intensity to this white, with ripe and fairly rich pear and butterscotch flavors, and notes of nutmeg that linger on the finish.  Drink now. 165 cases made.

name: Minervois La Livinière L'Oustal Blanc
review: There's a nice richness to this, with a smoky aroma and flavors of boysenberry and cardamom, which extend nicely into the finish with chocolaty notes. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc K7
review: Has a beefy aroma, with concentrated roast fig, dark plum and mincemeat flavors that are lively and decadent tasting. Kirschlike notes fill the spicy finish. Carignane. Drink now through 2012. 200 cases imported.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc
review: Very plummy-tasting, with good acidity and a firm mineral finish that sports smoky and meaty notes. Grenache, Syrah and Carignane. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Maestoso 2
review: Appealing raw animal note to this robust, medium-bodied red, with smoke, dark cherry and licorice flavors, which linger on the finish. Drink now. 85 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 2 Red
review: Medium-bodied, with plum, berry and effusive red cherry flavors. Clean finish, with some dark chocolate notes. Cinsault, Carignane, Syrah and Grenache. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 6 Red
review: Minty aroma, with flavors to match, joined by blackberry, boysenberry and plenty of spice. Sweet cherry and cola on the finish. Cinsault, Carignane, Syrah and Grenache. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Minervois L'Oustal Blanc White
review: Aromatic, with some earthy notes on the aroma, and flavors of green peach and ripe apple. Short finish. Bourboulenc and Grenache Blanc. Drink now. 150 cases made.

name: Vin de Table Français L'Oustal Blanc Naïck 8 White
review: This white has intense spicy notes, including jalapeño, along with dried tropical fruit flavors. There's hints of butter on the finish. An extreme style. Drink now through 2013. 40 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône Isabel de France
review: This delivers a good, direct core of plum, raspberry coulis and licorice root notes, with modest tobacco and toast highlights on the finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Ventoux Isabel de France
review: Pear, green almond and floral notes mingle, backed by a light, breezy finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Ventoux White Isabel de France
review: Fresh, with wet stone, peach pit and melon rind notes backed by a floral hint on the racy finish. A new value line from the owner of Domaine St.-Préfert. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Isabel de France
review: Light tea and blood orange notes race through, with a clean, refreshing finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Deep Rosé
review: With its dark color, this big boy rosé could pass as a Beaujolais, but the wine makes a statement with its deep, supple flavors of black cherry and toasty spice, with a hint of herb. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Rosé Deep
review: Full-bodied and focused, with an almost Beaujolais-like hue and appealing flavors of sweet cherry, spice and herb. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Carneros
review: Well-proportioned, with intense plum, black cherry and wild berry flavors, shaded by cedary oak and gravel notes that maintain a pleasant earthiness on the finish. Drink now through 2021. 880 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: A sleek, well-focused style, targeting green apple, citrus and light herb notes, ending clean and refreshing. Drink now through 2020. 7,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Carneros
review: Clean and flinty, with a mix of light citrus, green apple and spice. Drink now. 7,400 cases made.

name: Malbec Patagonia
review: There's a lovely earthy edge to the dark blackberry and kirsch notes, as layers of spice, licorice and graphite unfold on the fruit-filled finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chablis Côte de Léchet
review: An opulent, richly textured white, displaying peach, melon, pastry and spice flavors. Harmonious and well-defined, lingering on the spice and citrus aftertaste. Drink now through 2014. 75 cases imported.

name: Chablis Côte de Léchet
review: Hints of vanilla and spice accent the peach and melon flavors in this ample white. It's well-balanced and lingers, though it may not appeal to purists. Drink now through 2011. 67 cases imported.

name: Chablis Beauroy
review: Round and accessible, this white evokes grapefruit, apple and a hint of mineral flavors, all wrapped in a moderately firm structure. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Chablis Croix Aux Moines
review: A big, powerful Chablis, full of lemon and apple flavors. There's also some oak influence in the form of spice and a resinous element. Drink now through 2015. 225 cases imported.

name: Chablis
review: Pungent, with tropical fruit and hot stone aromas and flavors. Distinctive and more typical of the warm vintage than the regional style. Drink now. 124 cases imported.

name: Chablis
review: A ripe version, boasting melon and apple notes in a straightforward style. Modest length. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Beaujolais-Villages Clos de Creuse Noire
review: There's a subtle layer of spice here, along with hints of dried cherry and prune. Dry finish. 2,500 cases made.

name: Beaujolais-Villages Clos de Creuse Noire
review: Beginning to fade, this shows earthy and herbal flavors, soft on the palate but drying on the finish.

name: Vin de Pays des Côtes de Thongue Isa
review: A well-chiseled red, with dried cherry, plum, and licorice flavors. Shows notes of black olive and sea salt on the long, spice-filled finish. Grenache, Mourvèdre, Pinot Noir, Syrah, and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now through 2010. 4,000 cases made.

name: Bergerac Le Jonc-Blanc Classik
review: This firm red shows plum pudding, dried berry and tobacco flavors, with a ripe, tannic finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Montravel Red Le Jonc-Blanc Le Rubis
review: This herbal red shows some red fruit flavors, with dusty, smoky notes on the finish. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Domaine de la Fouquette Cuvée Rosé des Maures
review: Fresh and fruity, with melon, berry and red plum flavors. White pepper and mineral notes provide a lively finish. Drink now. 3,750 cases made.

name: Sancerre Les Grands Monts
review: Alluring, with touches of brioche and wax along the edges of the peach, gooseberry and lemon curd core. Show good ripeness and length. Drink now through 2018. 1,200 cases imported.

name: Sancerre Red Les Grands Monts
review: Very fresh, with pretty cherry and blood orange notes backed by a lightly dusty edge on the floral finish. Drink now. 100 cases imported.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Wild Alfalfa
review: Fine, ripe and plush, generous with its mocha-scented black cherry, raspberry and blueberry flavors that get rounder and more expansive as they linger, touched by the coffee-scented oak. Drink now through 2012. 550 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Dutchman Vineyard
review: Supple, velvety and expressive, layering the plum, currant and white pepper flavors with bay leaf and floral notes. Finishes with a lovely sense of purity and class. Drink now through 2022. 173 cases made.

name: Malbec Columbia Valley À Bloc
review: Fresh and silky, with expressive white pepper overtones to the rose petalaccented blackberry flavors, lingering easily on the polished finish. Drink now through 2020. 255 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley Dutchman Vineyard
review: Refined, if still a bit tightly wound, offering floral blackberry and smoky pepper aromas and complex blueberry, stony mineral and licorice flavors that finish with slightly grippy tannins. Best from 2019 through 2023. 202 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Wahluke Slope Road Less Traveled
review: Ripe and polished, this is dark with cherry and black pepper flavors on a generous frame, with a light slap of tannins adding a kick to the expressive finish. Best from 2013 through 2017. 246 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Batchelor's Button
review: Broad and expressive, this gains focus, unfurling flavors of black cherry, currant, licorice and cedar. Persists into an open texture on the firm finish. Best from 2018 through 2023. 242 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Wild Alfalfa
review: Lively, juicy and generous with its bright strawberry jam and blackberry flavors, shaded with white pepper and floral notes as the finish lingers. Tannins are firm and can use some cellaring time. Best from 2005 through 2010. 480 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Red Paintbrush
review: Dark and spicy, with a meaty note along with solid cherry and spice flavors, finishing firm, with just a touch of earthy character as the aftertaste lingers. Best from 2007 through 2013. 623 cases made.

name: Merlot Columbia Valley Red Paintbrush
review: On the light side, with supple texture and appealing delicacy, showing lovely raspberry, cherry and mocha flavors in fine balance. Drink now through 2007. 480 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Batchelor's Button
review: Smooth and round, with ripe currant and black cherry aromas and flavors, finishing with a pungent smoky note. Best from 2007 through 2011. 425 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Columbia Valley Batchelor's Button
review: Supple style, lithe in structure, with fine-grained texture and spicy, earthy overtones to the ripe blackberry flavors, finishing with a bit of a tart tang. Drink now through 2007. 450 cases made.

name: Red Paintbrush Columbia Valley
review: Graceful style offers modest, spicy oak-tinged cherry and black pepper flavors, which persist nicely on a refined finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2005. 498 cases made.

name: Red Paintbrush Columbia Valley
review: Polished and generous with its ripe currant and dark plum character, touched with a hint of gaminess as the flavors linger. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2004. 854 cases made.

name: Snapdragon Columbia Valley
review: Aromatic, polished and nicely focused, not a big wine but nicely fleshed out with spicy litchi, melon and toasty spice flavors, lingering well on the finish. Viognier and Roussanne. Drink now through 2006. 845 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley River Beauty
review: Firm in texture, with ripe plum and spice flavors that persist on the open-weave finish. An undertone of bitterness upsets the balance. Best from 2017 through 2021. 289 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley River Beauty
review: Ripe and fleshy, with a spicy, slightly gamy edge to the plump blackberry flavors, echoing nicely on the refined finish. Drink now through 2008. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley Wild Alfalfa
review: Firm, with a plump feel to the toasty, caramel-scented cherry and spice flavors, lingering nicely. Drink now through 2008. 820 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley River Beauty
review: Trim and focused, with floral black raspberry, crushed stone and smoky pepper notes, framed by firm tannins. Best after 2018. 251 cases made.

name: White Paintbrush Yakima Valley
review: Fresh and spicy, offering clove and nutmeg overtones to the pear flavors, lingering softly. Roussanne and Marsanne. Drink now. 326 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley Road Less Traveled
review: Crisp and taut, with firm tannins around a savory core of wet earthtinged berry and licorice flavors. Best after 2015. 296 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Red Mountain Taptiel Vineyard
review: Taut in texture, with tightly wound cedary berry and spice flavors lingering on the firmly tannic finish. Best after 2008. 50 cases made.

name: Syrah Yakima Valley River Beauty
review: A crunch of tannins clips the edges off the juicy currant and plum fruit, but this has intensity and point, finishing with flair. Drink now through 2017. 248 cases made.

name: Wild Thyme Columbia Valley
review: Trim and a bit brooding, but still appealing, with notes of currant, dried herb and earthy mineral. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Best after 2018. 266 cases made.

name: River Beauty Red Mountain
review: Big and tough, with gripping tannins that clear the way for pretty cherry and currant flavors, finishing a bit hot. Has density but not much grace. Syrah and Mourvèdre. Best after 2008. 135 cases made.

name: Viognier Snipes Mountain
review: Light and refreshing, with pear and floral flavors. A hint of bitter almond shows on the finish. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Soft texture and generous, with grapey flavors that pick up some nice spicy notes on the round finish. Drink now. 819 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Yakima Valley Pink Paintbrush
review: Light, dry and tangy, with raspberry and herb flavors. Drink now. 464 cases made.

name: Bouches du Rhône White
review: The bright, high-pitched nectarine and tangerine fruit is laced with a verbena note, giving way to a hint of bitter orange through the lively finish. A nice change of pace and a great value. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Muscat. Drink now.

name: Bouches du Rhône
review: Soft, friendly cherry and herb notes mingle, carried by lightly dusty tannins through the easy finish. Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Arinarnoa and Petit Verdot. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Pinot Nero Friuli Latisana
review: This light- to medium-bodied red is lightly aromatic and fresh, with hints of bacon fat, oak spice and violet accenting the crushed mulberry and raspberry fruit. Offers a chewy, lightly herbed finish. Drink now through 2019. 16,000 cases made.

name: Ribolla Gialla Delle Venezie
review: Bright and tangy, this light-bodied white offers a round, lightly fleshy mix of poached apple, star fruit, stone and zesty ginger flavors. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Friuli Latisana
review: An easy-drinking white, with lightly juicy acidity and hints of kiwifruit, apple, slivered almond and lemon peel. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Friuli Latisana
review: This fruity white is tangy, with smoke and oak spice notes leading to ripe peach and melon flavors. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Friuli Latisana
review: Fleshy apricot, orange peel and white raspberry fruit notes are layered with lightly tangy acidity and hints of smoke and star anise on the modest finish. Drink now. 16,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Collezione de Marchi
review: Amazing. Spellbinding aromas of tar, berry, asphalt, mint and currants. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a long flavorful finish. Still a baby. Age it or drink it. Glorious. Always a great bottle, and the last one from the winery went to this tasting!--1990 Tuscany retrospective. Drink now through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Tasted from magnum. Dark ruby. Fabulous aromas of currant, mineral and mint. Roses too. Love the Cabernet character here. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins yet chewy and powerful. This is still a baby. I am speechless. Like I tasted it yesterday.--1997 Italian blind retrospective. Best after 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Dark ruby. Beautiful aromas of crushed blackberry, plum, mineral and spices. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and lots of berry, cut wood and dark chocolate. Very long. Youthful. Still needs time.--1997 Italian blind retrospective. Best after 2008. 3,900 cases made.

name: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico
review: A fine balance between oxidation and sweet caramel and fig paste flavors gives this Vin Santo much appeal. Complex and supple in texture, with elements of honey and roasted walnut on the long, satisfying finish. Drink now through 2020. 870 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Collezione de Marchi
review: An exciting and sensual wine to taste. Has thrilling aromas of sweet red licorice, tobacco and olive and chocolate, tobacco and berry flavors. Full-bodied and very supple, with velvety tannins and a long tobacco and berry finish. Best from 1995 through 1997.

name: Cepparello
review: A blockbuster. Perhaps the greatest Cepparello ever made. It's dark colored and exuberantly fruity on the nose and palate. A violet and cherry character emanates from the glass. It also has tannins to back it up. Drink now or hold.--Super Tuscan retrospective.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Gorgeous aromas of minerals, currants, flowers and berries. Full-bodied, with big, silky tannins and a long, long finish. A smooth, refined and well-made red. Best after 2005. 1,060 cases made.

name: Vin Santo
review: An opulent dessert wine from a fine Chianti producer. Smooth, rich and subtle, sweet without being cloying. An elegant wine offering delicious almond, hazelnut and tea aromas and flavors that grow and persist on the finish. Harmonious and beautifully balanced.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Ripe and slightly decadent on the nose but soft, round and velvety. Very pretty and enjoyable already. Got to love this. Better than the 1999. Best after 2005. 1,090 cases made.

name: Cepparello
review: A wine that is all finesse and restraint. An abundance of fruit and tannins are crafted to give this wine great harmony and balance. Needs time to show you what it has.--Super Tuscan retrospective. Best after 1996.

name: Syrah Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: A fresh, bright Syrah that's reminiscent of a solid Hermitage, with dark fruits and sliced meat. Needs a little air to reveal what it has. Focused and handmade. Best after 2011. 585 cases made.

name: Syrah Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Beautiful aromas of crushed berries, raspberries and minerals follow through to a full-bodied palate, with plenty of fruit and tannins and a long, fresh and lively aftertaste. Excellent. Best after 2003. 580 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Offers rose and citrus fruit notes, with dried cherry and some earth character. Full-bodied, with soft, silky tannins and a fruity finish. Refined and racy, like a fine Brunello. Sangiovese. Best after 2010. 2,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Incredibly well-crafted red. Complex aromas of raspberries, vanilla and coffee. Medium-bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long, silky finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 4,250 cases made.

name: Vin Santo del Chianti Classico
review: Full and sweet, with orange peel, fresh herb and caramel character. This has a pleasant tangy finish, leaving a hint of salt behind. There's an intense dried apricot character. Long and beautiful. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Collezione de Marchi
review: A triumph for this vintage. Great, dark color and loads of berry, mint and eucalyptus aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, silky finish. A racy, well-built wine, for aging. Best after 1997. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Solid Cab. Aromas of barley, currants, berry and milk chocolate. Full-bodied, with thick and chewy tannins and a long and fruity aftertaste. Subtle and refined. Be patient. Best after 2005. 1,040 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: A cerebral, wonderfully textured Cabernet. Dark, with loads of currant, mint and dried herb aromas. Medium- to full-bodied, with smooth, silky tannins and a long currant, berry and raspberry aftertaste. Best after 2000. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cepparello
review: Outstanding. The essence of raspberry and berry greets the nose, wonderful fruity flavors treat the palate. Full-bodied and really silky, with a long, long finish. Best after 1998. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cepparello
review: Gorgeous berry, cherry, violet character to this medium-bodied and muscular wine, with loads of fine tannins and a long, slightly mouthpuckering finish. Give this time. Try after 1998. Sangiovese. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cepparello
review: Noteworthy finesse in this wine. It's full-bodied and very rich, but keeps a restrained and subtle character. Sweet fruit and leather flavors and aromas backed up by fine tannins. Try after 1997.--Super Tuscan retrospective.

name: Chardonnay Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Offers toasty oak, cream and tropical fruit, with citrus undertones. Full-bodied, with creamy vanilla bean and coconut flavors. Thick and rich. Very powerful. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Fresh and aromatic, with cream, ripe pineapple and lime aromas that follow through to a full body, with lively honey, ripe apple and toasty oak character. Long and rich, with intense flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Subtle yet complex aromas of vanilla, ripe apple and lemon pie. Full-bodied, with lovely fruit and a long, rich aftertaste. Very well done. One of Tuscany's best white wines. Drink now. 1,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Toscana Collezione de Marchi
review: Always one of the best whites of Tuscany. Gorgeous aromas of apple, pineapple and coconut, with hints of orange peel. Full-bodied, with very ripe fruit and a lovely infusion of vanilla and coconut character. Drink now through 2001. 1,100 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Well-marked by oak, black cherry, blackberry, tobacco and iron flavors, this is rich and firm, picking up black tea and smoke notes on the long finish. Shows latent power. Sangiovese. Best from 2016 through 2025. 2,600 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: A round, enticing style, with a touch of new oak lending toast and spice accents to the black cherry, plum and tobacco flavors. Dense and slightly beefy, finishing long. Best from 2015 through 2023. 2,600 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Plenty of balsamic and wild scrub aromas and flavors highlight this sinewy red. With air, bilberry and raspberry fruit emerges, showing plenty of character. The finish is long and savory. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2020. 2,600 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Silky and caressing, with pretty berry and floral aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins. There's a beautiful density and finesse to this. Best after 2011. 3,415 cases made.

name: Toscana Cepparello
review: Lovely sophisticated aromas of plums, berries and chestnuts follow through to a full-bodied palate, with super, well-integrated tannins and a polished, silky finish. Very fine. Sangiovese. Best after 2003. 3,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Firm and vibrant, this tightly wound red offers a pleasant earth and mineral thread woven among dark berry fruits. Full-bodied, focused and persistent, ending with a pleasant spiciness. Drink now through 2017. 470 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: A lean, elegant style, boasting cherry, strawberry, floral and earth flavors. Firms up on the finish, with light astringency. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie
review: A simple white with apple and honey character. Medium-bodied, with good acidity. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Chianti
review: Some good dried cherry and orange peel character with light body and a juicy finish. Good value. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto
review: This light-bodied white is tangy and fresh, with a juicy mix of ripe pear, star fruit and apple blossom flavors, revealing a base note of stony mineral on the clean-cut finish. A quaffer. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto
