review: Light-bodied, with creamy flavors of apricot, apple jam, lilac and bergamot. An aromatic wine, with subtle, refreshing acidity. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto
review: Modest and smoky, with notes of dried pear, ground spice and lemon preserves. Lightly tangy. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Sixteen Appellations Napa Valley
review: With complex aromas of blackberry, licorice, balsamic and dusty herb and sage, this is very deep and vibrant, focused and persistent, fading on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2028. 831 cases made.

name: White Blend Napa Valley
review: Distinctive, honey-scented melon and peach flavors have floral and spice accents, with a rich body and a refreshing finish. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Coombsville Estate
review: Very intense and concentrated yet lacking focus, as the dark berry profile veers toward earthy balsamic flavors and ends that way, with gritty tannins. Drink now through 2024. 550 cases made.

name: Cabernet Piave La Cesura Riserva
review: Crushed blackberry and toasty oak on the nose. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine, well-integrated tannins and a long finish of fresh fruit and oak. Best after 2006. 400 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Veneto
review: A tutti frutti Pinot Grigio, offering candied citrus, pineapple and passion fruit notes. Tangy and lightly spiced, with a modest finish. Drink now. 30,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Piave
review: A straightforward Chardonnay, clean and fresh, with a citrusy baseline and hints of apple, lemon zest and spring blossom. Modest finish. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Manzoni Bianco Marca Trevigiana La Cesura
review: Fresh, with lemon, peach and a light chalky mineral note. Medium body. Crisp finish. Drink now. 2,080 cases made.

name: Veneto Amaranto 72 Riserva
review: Some plum and black fruit, with a hint of dry mineral character. Medium-bodied, with a rather hollow palate and lightly firm, but slightly tart finish. Drink now. 525 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Piave La Cesura
review: Some decent lemon, honey and spice on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with a crisp, spicy finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Pinot Nero Veneto
review: Light- to medium-bodied, with a sharp edge and notes of dried herb, spice box, dried cherry and bell pepper. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Piave
review: Simple, with blackberry and a light leafy character. A bit short. Drink now. 6,000 cases imported.

name: Riesling Veneto
review: A modest white, with hints of baked apple, orange sorbet, cream, nut and a touch of lemon curd. Light finish. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Piave
review: Light and crisp, with sharp apple and pear character. Too tart. 3,750 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Piave
review: Simple, with some floral and mineral character. Tart and rather aggressive finish. 11,250 cases imported.

name: Raboso Piave La Cesura
review: Austere, with some red fruit and rather bitter spice and mineral character. 325 cases imported.

name: Veneto White Italo 06
review: A bit decadent, with overripe fruit and earthy spice character. Rustic. 500 cases made.

name: Merlot Piave
review: Some black fruit, but light, a bit herbal and diluted. Not very exciting. 5,500 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Piave La Cesura
review: Overboiled green beans. Rustic and unpalatable. 1,250 cases imported.

name: Merlot Piave La Cesura Riserva
review: A bit astringent, with sour black fruit and steely minerals. Unbalanced. 1,425 cases made.

name: Coteaux Varois en Provence Rosé iPink
review: Offers a juicy core of cherry, blood orange, mango and peach notes, offset by floral edges that let the finish linger. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Vin de Pays du Var Rosé iPink
review: Whiffs of tobacco and savory are followed by dried peach and bitter orange notes and a brisk, tangy finish. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Reserve
review: Tropical fruit, vanilla and butterscotch blend nicely in this creamy-textured wine. Finishes with toasty oak, hints of pear and pineapple, refreshing mineral notes. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Reserve
review: Pretty, subtle, light-bodied and smooth, featuring delicate nectarine, citrus and pear flavors. Clean, soft and pleasant on the finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Reserve
review: This wine has had some time to settle down and exhibits smoothness on the palate. Herbs, plums, anise, cedar and spice flavors blend nicely, finish moderately. 1,166 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Light and elegant, with refreshing pear, citrus and light toast flavors that persist on the soft finish, it's a pleasant mouthful of California's most popular white--at a price that's hard to beat these days. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Reserve
review: Firm and flavorful, showing crisp apple, pear and nutmeg aromas and flavors , good concentration and length. A bit rough around the edges, six months t o a year in the cellar should smooth it out.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Hayes Ranch
review: Light and pleasantly fruity, generous with its fresh pear and apple fruit that lingers on the finish. Ready now. 6,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Livermore Valley Figoni Ranch
review: Frankly varietal, with anise and celery flavors weaving through the bright, citrusy fruit. Drink it soon. 2,813 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley Beyer Ranch Vineyard
review: Plum jam and dried berry flavors show good depth if a bit of mustiness on the finish. Drink now through 2002. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Hayes Ranch
review: Smooth and inviting, with sappy apple and melon aromas and flavors and a crisp, lively finish. Drinkable now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Monterey County
review: In a light, airy style, with soft pear and almond flavors that linger gently on the finish. 929 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley Beyer Ranch
review: Pleasant, with fresh berry flavors, spice and lots of smoky oak. Flavors persist on the drying finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Bright and simple, with pleasant, earthy citrus notes. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Light and bright, offering a nice core of floral and apple flavors. Drinkable now. 8,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast Reserve
review: Smooth and generous with its spicy pear and honey flavors, finishing a bit soft. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Hayes Ranch
review: Lean and a bit earthy, with citrus and pear notes of modest depth. 6,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley Reserve
review: A deep color and sappy pineapple aromas and flavors mark this as a ripe wine, perhaps a little heavy, finishing with flavors reminiscent of apple cider and pear blended with oaky spice. A distinctive wine to drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Fumé Blanc Figoni Ranch Livermore Valley
review: Light and crisp, with simple green apple and lemon flavors. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Monterey County
review: Simple, broad and a little spicy, picking up an almond edge to the modest peach flavors. Drinkable now. 700 cases made.

name: Trebbiano Livermore Valley
review: Fresh, simple and appealing for its peach and almond flavors. 6,362 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley
review: Earthy and a bit rustic, with a leathery twist to the sage and wild berry flavors, but with food some of the crispness will fade. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Reserve
review: A soft style, with flavors of coffee and plum that linger on the moderate finish. Drink now through 2000. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley
review: Light in texture, vegetal, bordering on cooked, with berry and beet flavors swinging through. Drinkable now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Reserve
review: Soft, herbal and tart, with odd notes of watermelon and cherry turning dry. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Central Coast
review: Nice texture, but the flavors don't quite blossom. Remains light, spicy and modestly fruity. 10,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Livermore Valley Le Clan des Quatre Vineyards
review: Smells fruity and floral, but it turns earthy and herbal, drying out on the finish. Decent but nothing more. Drink now. 3,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Livermore Valley Beyer Ranch
review: Earthy, herbal plum flavors finish with a salty mineral edge and signs of oxidation. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Livermore Valley
review: A ripe, earthy-tasting wine that's rich in texture and almost unctuous. Good, but a bit flabby and unfocused. 9,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma Mountain
review: Appealing for its briary wild berry and licorice aromas, which follow through to zesty raspberry, underbrush and pepper flavors. Drink now through 2016. 603 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Sonoma County
review: Offers a mix of tart cherry and dried cranberry fruit, with spice and toasty herbs. Drink now through 2014. 244 cases made.

name: Roccamonfina Lucno
review: A well-spiced, light-bodied red, backed by tangy acidity, this offers crushed raspberry and blackberry fruit and lots of aromatic chopped herb and licorice snap notes to match the zesty ground spice character. Drink now through 2019. 300 cases made.

name: Roccamonfina
review: Dusty tannins frame this firm and juicy red, which offers subtle notes of crushed black cherry, blackberry, cocoa powder and salumi. Drink now through 2016. 400 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Campo Marna Cinquecento
review: Understated and elegant, with light tannins and subtle, balancing acidity. Aromatic accents of dried flowers, herbs and spice wind through a silky palate of kirsch, date, balsamic and black licorice notes. Lightly chewy finish. Drink now through 2019. 70 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Campo Ciotoli
review: Subtle, delivering layered flavors of black cherry and currant, with lots of ground spice—mace, anise and clove—tea rose, dried cranberry and gumdrop. Shows lovely balance and a tang of fresh acidity. Very approachable. Drink now through 2019. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Campo Prognare
review: This fragrant red features a fine balance of juicy acidity and ripe flavors of sun-dried black cherry, blackberry coulis and pomegranate, with accents of vanilla, dried herb and ground spice. Displays a lovely silky texture and a smoke-tinged finish. Drink now through 2020. 200 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore Campo Ciotoli
review: Fragrant with crushed pine and dried marjoram accents, this medium-bodied red offers a creamy mix of plumped cherry, smoke and spice notes. Drink now through 2019. 1,250 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore Campo Ciotoli
review: There's a stemmy edge to the subtle flavors of plump raisin, sun-dried cherry, dried thyme and anise in this lightly chewy, traditional version. Drink now through 2017. 600 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Campo Vulcano
review: This juicy white layers tangy, citrus-tinged acidity over flavors of blood orange, guava and blanched almond. Fresh, with a modest finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Campo Vulcano
review: A modest version, light-bodied and balanced, with hints of yellow apple and pear, blanched almond and orchard blossom. Tangy. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Taurasi Bosco Faiano
review: Lightly chewy, this offers a rich palate of baked cherry, wood smoke, black licorice, forest floor and graphite notes, set on a supple frame. Finely balanced and subtle. Drink now through 2025. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 2,000 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Campi Taurasini Jumara
review: An inviting and aromatic red, with notes of sandalwood, incense and spice box playing around the focused black cherry and currant fruit. Silky tannins add finesse and structure to the fine, minerally finish. Drink now through 2019. 600 cases imported.

name: Irpinia Emè
review: A finely meshed, creamy red, layering the flavors of raspberry and chocolate ganache with hints of ground anise, smoky mineral details and supple tannins. Offers a lasting, juicy finish. Aglianico, Merlot and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2024. 700 cases made.

name: Irpinia Emè
review: Subtle and creamy, with juicy boysenberry, mocha, olive tapenade and grilled herb notes layered with fine-grained tannins. Elegant overall and focused through to the spiced finish. Aglianico, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now through 2018. 1,000 cases made.

name: Taurasi Bosco Faiano
review: An elegant, lightly juicy red, with sinewy, well-knit tannins and layered flavors of ashy mineral, dried strawberry, mocha and spice box. Not a powerhouse, but shows fine length and balance. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Taurasi Bosco Faiano
review: Perfumed with aromas and flavors of wild flowers, this red offers notes of cured leather, sandalwood and spice leading to a grippy core of sun-dried cherry and wild berry fruit. Drink now through 2019. 400 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Campi Taurasini Jumara
review: A well-balanced red, round and creamy. This offers supple tannins and pleasing notes of plumped cherry, wild herb, anise and mocha. A fresh and easy-drinking crowd-pleaser. Drink now through 2020. 1,100 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Campi Taurasini Jumara
review: Tar and spice notes drive the flavors of dried cranberry, date and chocolate shavings, while well-integrated tannins and acidity keep this accessible and open-knit through to the chewy, herbal finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,500 cases made.

name: Falanghina Irpinia Clarum
review: This lively white is fresh and fragrant, loaded with candied lemon zest, fresh-chopped mint, passion fruit sorbet and crushed pink peppercorn notes. A snappy quaffer, with lots of personality. Drink now through 2020. 2,400 cases made.

name: Irpinia White Faius
review: Medicinal herb aromas show in this sleek, medium-bodied white, while a note of creamed almond underscores the flavors of peach skin, white cherry, fleur de sel, and ground cardamom and anise. Distinctive. Fiano, Greco di Tufo and Coda di Volpe. Drink now through 2020. 450 cases made.

name: Taurasi Bosco Faiano
review: Aromatic hints of lavender and spice accent plumped cherry and chocolate pudding notes in this well-balanced, medium-bodied red. An accessible version, with a lightly chewy finish. Drink now through 2019. 900 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Campi Taurasini Jumara
review: An open-knit and balanced red, with flavors of dried cherry and date, underscored by forest floor, dried herb and smoke accents. Light tannins show on the moderate finish. Drink now through 2020. 900 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Guaglione
review: Lively and aromatic, with a pronounced note of strawberries and cream, accented by hints of dark chocolate shavings, graphite and ground anise. Shows good focus in a juicy, medium-bodied package. Drink now through 2020. 2,500 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Guaglione
review: A light-bodied red, showing good focus to the creamy palate of boysenberry, black olive and mocha. This is lightly juicy, with subtle tannins emerging on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 2,900 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Guaglione
review: Open-knit and fresh, this floral red offers ripe notes of black cherry and raspberry fruit, ground spice and red licorice. Lively and well-balanced, with light grip on the finish. Drink now through 2017. 2,500 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino Gaudium
review: A rich style, with layers of smoke and spice framing the yellow melon, pear and toasted hazelnut notes. A hint of citrus peel marks the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Greco di Tufo Serum
review: An herbaceous version, with a waft of verbena leaping from the glass. This is light- to medium-bodied and racy, adding flavors of pink grapefruit granita, stone and spice to the aromatic profile. Moderate finish. Drink now through 2019. 1,800 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo Serum
review: This is light- to medium-bodied and fleshy in texture, with enough acidity for balance and an expressive mix of peaches and cream, apple blossom, grated ginger and lemon pith notes. Drink now through 2019. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,800 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo Serum
review: Fresh herb and floral notes lace this light- to medium-bodied white, with mouthwatering acidity enlivening the crunchy pear, preserved lemon, apricot and chalk flavors. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Irpinia Emè
review: Raspberry pâte de fruit and toffee pudding flavors are layered with lightly chewy tannins and citrusy acidity in this well-spiced, medium-bodied red. Drink now through 2019. 600 cases made.

name: Irpinia White Faius
review: A bright white, showing abundant oak spice and graphite accents to the flavors of poached peach and orange blossom, with a hint of smoked hazelnut. Fiano, Greco and Falanghina. Drink now through 2020. 250 cases made.

name: Irpinia White Faius
review: Hints of ground clove and anise lace this lightly waxy white, which offers racy acidity and subtle notes of yellow plum, almond skin, fleur de sel and dried apricot. Fiano, Greco and Coda di Volpe. Drink now through 2016. 350 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Campi Taurasini Jumara
review: Creamy and expressive, this easy-drinking red shows flavors of chocolate pudding, kirsch, singed orange peel and spice. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Falanghina Irpinia Clarum
review: A bright, light- to medium-bodied white, with a snappy mix of peach skin, rosemary, orange peel and cinnamon notes. Drink now through 2019. 2,500 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino Gaudium
review: A vibrant, subtly juicy white, light- to medium-bodied, showing flavors of creamed pear, almond and ground anise, with a hint of paraffin. Offers a clean-cut, saline-tinged finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,400 cases made.

name: Fiano di Avellino Gaudium
review: Aromatic and lightly spiced, this fresh white offers a modest mix of apricot, star fruit and peach pit notes. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo Serum
review: A light earthiness underscores this tangy white, which offers a subtle mix of persimmon, blanched almond and verbena flavors. Modest finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Guaglione
review: Mocha and spice notes lace the plumped cherry and fig cake notes of this light- to medium-bodied red. Round and easy-drinking, with creamy tannins and a modest, herb- and vanilla-laced finish. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Falanghina Irpinia Clarum
review: Well-spiced and fresh, with poached pear and salted almond notes backed by lemony acidity. Stony finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Falanghina Irpinia Clarum
review: This spicy white features ripe nectarine, melon and chalk notes framed by hints of vanilla and spice.  Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Aglianico Irpinia Guaglione
review: Aromas of mocha and medicinal herb follow through to a rich palate of crushed plum and wild berry notes, with rustic tannins framing the finish. Distinct. Drink now. 800 cases imported.

name: Fiano di Avellino Gaudium
review: There's a candied shell to this light-bodied, tangy white, which offers flavors of coconut cream pie and orange Creamsicle. Lightly spiced finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 1,250 cases made.

name: Greco di Tufo Serum
review: White pepper and pine mark this lean white, which features modest melon and lime fruit and a lanolin-tinged finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Etna White Ante
review: Rich, with petrol and mineral notes on the nose, this medium-bodied white is framed by sleek acidity, showing flavors of kiwifruit, fresh tarragon, ground white pepper and tangy hint of passion fruit. Zesty finish. Drink now through 2021. 460 cases made.

name: Etna Aetneus
review: Leather and salumi notes lead the way in this aging red, but there's still enough acidity to enliven hints of dried cherry and cranberry fruit and grilled herb on the balanced palate. Drink now. 1,375 cases made.

name: Lambrusco a Foglia Frastagliata Vigneti delle Dolomiti Perciso
review: Wood smoke and forest floor notes meet lip-smacking currant and cranberry flavors in this deeply hued red, with rustic tannins. Drink now. 150 cases imported.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: This is a lovely autumnal wine that has wild mushroom, tobacco and meaty aromas and flavors. Medium body, ripe fruit character, round tannins and a rich finish. Drinkable now. 600 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Rich, almost lush, with a taste of chocolate that carries through from beginning to end. Balanced and delicious now. 800 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Elegant and pretty through and through. Tobacco, cherry and berry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied and round, offering fine tannins and crisp finish. Drinkable now. 800 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Mature and soft, dominated by brown sugar flavors. Simple, with some chocolate notes, and ready to drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
review: Maturing now, this shows cherry, smoke and leather flavors on a lean, tannic frame. It turns bitter on the finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
review: Light and already mature, with tobacco and cherry aromas and flavors. Slightly diluted on the finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Fresh, fruity and simple with cherry and lemon character. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Spicy plum and berry, with earthy mineral on the nose. Medium-bodied, with a fresh palate, light tannins and a crisp finish. A bit rustic in the end. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: This medium-bodied red has a slightly hard dried cherry and citrus character. Drink now. 1,050 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Terra di Lamole
review: Smooth and medium-bodied, with some black cherry and mineral character. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Baldovino
review: Light-bodied and fruity, with bright acidity and brambly berry, plum, herb and spice notes. Drink now. 500 cases made.
winery: I Fauri di Luigi di Camillo

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Baldovino
review: A savory red, with herb, spice and black olive notes accenting crushed black currant fruit flavor. Light- to medium-bodied and modest, with subtle tannins on the finish. Drink now. 200 cases imported.
winery: I Fauri di Luigi di Camillo

name: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Ottobre
review: Forward plum and candied cherry fruit lead in this fresh red, ending with hints of wild herb and mocha. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.
winery: I Fauri di Luigi di Camillo

name: Isonzo del Friuli Sovrán
review: Simple and fruity with some lemon character. Nice wine but not very characteristic of Tocai Friulano. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Isonzo del Friuli
review: A very lemony Pinot Grigio with crisp, clean character. Medium body and a simple finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Pinot Grigio Isonzo del Friuli
review: Lychee fruit, with some citrus, follows through to a full body, with good fruit and a dense finish. A bit dull. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Franc Isonzo del Friuli
review: A straightforward Cab, with clean currant and floral aromas and flavors. A light peppery edge on the palate and finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Isonzo del Friuli
review: Some honey and green fruit character. Leafy. Medium-bodied, with slightly aggressive acidity on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Packed with sweet, ripe fruit, this red features black cherry, blackberry, tobacco and woodsy flavors. Dense, beefy tannins are present yet integrated in this long version. Should come together nicely in a year or two. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2018 through 2028. 834 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Beautiful aromas of blueberry, flowers and sandalwood follow through to a full body, with silky, refined tannins and a delicate aftertaste of sweet berry and light vanilla. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best after 2011. 750 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Plenty of currant, blackberry and cream on the nose, following through to a full-bodied palate. Layered and very pretty. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2010. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: The currant and violet character really shows. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a long finish. Big and chewy. As good as the 1997. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2005. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Shows purity to the blackberry, blueberry, iron and meaty, peppery notes in this dense red, along with a muscular base of tannins. Firms up on the finish, so pair with grilled beef or lamb. Syrah. Best from 2017 through 2024. 820 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Though firm and youthful now, this red boasts a core of blackberry, raspberry, floral and mineral flavors. The juicy texture offsets the tannins, and the aftertaste echoes sweet fruit. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best from 2013 through 2023. 2,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Fantastic aromas of crushed blackberry and flowers follow through to a full body, with roasted coffee bean and berry flavors followed by a long finish. Juicy. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Really pretty, with plum, berry and floral aromas. Full-bodied and very well-integrated, with fine tannins and a long, long finish. It's all there. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2006. 5,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Very chewy and rich, with ripe fruit and berry character. Grapey. Full-bodied, with a long finish. Big and rich. Needs time. Wild wine. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2007. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: A new wine with an outstanding future. Pretty mineral, berry and cherry character. Full- bodied, with well-integrated tannins and a long finish. Best after 2003.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Full, juicy, fruity and decadent, with velvety tannins and a long, delicious finish. Offers lots of smoke, bacon and fruit character. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: An intense red. Currant, blackberry and mineral follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a caressing finish. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2007. 900 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino
review: Aromas of lavender and sandalwood introduce this blackberry-tinged red. A tight structure keeps the flavors focused, and this stays fresh and long through the finish. A mix of modern and traditional. Syrah, Sangiovese and Merlot. Best from 2013 through 2022. 2,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Shows berry and chocolate notes, with hints of meat. Full-bodied, with raspberry and black pepper flavors, fresh acidity and a medium finish. Syrah. Best after 2009. 750 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Shows aromas of flowers, fruit and sandalwood. Full-bodied, with soft tannins and a fruity, delicious finish. Syrah. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Blueberry and vanilla aromas follow through to a full body, with velvety tannins and a rich finish. Layered and refined. A solid wine. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2010. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Refined, pretty wine. Lovely aromas of espresso and raspberries. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a fruity, succulent aftertaste. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2003. 3,330 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Currant and berries on the nose follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a clean, fresh finish. Very pretty. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino Red
review: Focused and fruity, with loads of fresh plum and assorted berry aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Syrah, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Sweet blackberry and black cherry flavors run into some hard tannins in this inky red. Ripe and concentrated, if a bit one-dimensional. Sangiovese and Merlot. 2,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Intense aromas of ripe plum and strawberry follow through to a full-bodied palate, with soft tannins and a long, flavorful finish. Juicy. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2008. 2,400 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Black cherry, licorice and herbal flavors start out supple, soon to be supplanted by firm tannins. Though a bit dry, this should round out with time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best from 2013 through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Very ripe and jammy, with aromas of currants, blackberries and vanilla. Full-bodied, thick and chewy, with a raisin, vanilla aftertaste. Overdone style, but interesting. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2004. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Aromas of mace, cloves and fruit. Full-bodied, with very well-knit tannins and lots of ripe fruit character, but falls slightly short on the finish. Still, it's a pretty wine. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best after 2003. 575 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Black cherry, violet and mineral flavors stay focused, while dusty tannins are unyielding now. This is a tad dry, yet there's ample fruit. Syrah. Best from 2013 through 2020. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Juicy black fruit, colored with fresh herbs. Full-bodied, round and fine, with loads of lingering ripe fruit on the finish. Delicious Syrah. Best after 2008. 830 cases made.

name: Toscana Perbruno
review: Very perfumed with raspberry and blackberry aromas. Full-bodied and chewy, with slightly overly extracted tannins, but turns fruity and ripe on the finish. Best after 2006. 500 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Fascinating aromas of tanned leather, spices and ripe fruit. Full-bodied and very firm, with angular tannins and a medium finish. A bit tough now, but should improve with age. Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2003. 4,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Dulcamara
review: Shows impressive richness of fruit, with ripe, chewy tannins. Medium-bodied, offering gritty tannins and a toasty oak finish. There is slightly too much new wood this year. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Best after 2011. 833 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino Red
review: An attractive wine, with berry, plum skin and floral aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fruity finish. Syrah, Sangiovese and Merlot. Best after 2009. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino White
review: Thick and fruity, with apple, melon and lemon character. Little waxy. Full-bodied, round and straightforward. Trebbiano and Sémillon. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Rosato Nemorino
review: A pleasant rosé, with clean cherry and floral character, on a medium body, with good balance and a fresh, fruity finish that lingers. From Syrah. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino Red
review: A bright, fruity red, offering plum and citrus undertones. Medium-bodied, with a fresh finish. Made from Syrah, Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 2,165 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: A fruity, bright red, with plum and berry aromas and character, minerally tannins and a fresh finish. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 2,166 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Cherry and berry character on a silky medium body, with a hint of chocolate coming through on the finish. Clean, easygoing red. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 2,170 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino White
review: Passionfruit, gooseberry and melon flavors mark this fruity white. There is a hint of earth as this finishes crisp and clean. Trebbiano and Sémillon. Drink now. 833 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Plum and light raisin aromas, with hints of flowers, following through to a medium-bodied palate and a slightly tart finish. A bit disappointing. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Belcore
review: Blackberry, tar and treacle tart. Full bodied. Short. Rustic. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Toscana Nemorino White
review: Very lemony, with green apple character. Medium-bodied, with tangy acidity and a crisp finish. A little one-dimensional. Drink now. 2,200 cases made.

name: Nero di Calabria Calabria Masino
review: Well-balanced and supple, this fresh red offers an accessible mix of dried herb, currant, black olive and smoky mineral notes. Medium- to full-bodied, with light tannins; enjoy with food or on its own. Drink now through 2021. 1,800 cases made.

name: Calabria Catà
review: Hints of crushed cherry, leather, sun-dried tomato and grilled herb mix in this fresh, balanced red. Fruit, spice and light, dusty tannins show on the finish. Try this with some salumi. Gaglioppo. Drink now through 2019. 18,000 cases made.

name: Calabria White Filù
review: This lively, expressive and light-bodied white shows flavors of juicy clementine and hints of ground cardamom, pink grapefruit zest and grated ginger. Greco Bianco. Drink now through 2019. 12,000 cases made.

name: Calabria Rosato Savù
review: A juicy rosé, with a creamy mix of plumped cherries, white raspberry, stone and orange zest notes. Spiced finish. Gaglioppo. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.

name: Calabria White Filù
review: A fresh, light-bodied white, offering melon and citrus notes backed by a hint of straw in the finish. Greco Bianco. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Nero di Calabria Calabria Masino
review: A spicy, rustic red, with enough black cherry and wild berry fruit to carry the wild herb- and iron-tinged finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Calabria Rosato Savù
review: A light and tangy rosé, with a smoky undertow and flavors of dried raspberry and cherry, spice and orange zest. Drink now. 13,000 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: Dark purple in color, with amazing aromas of blackberry, currant, mineral and flowers. Full-bodied, with supersilky tannins that are seamless and refined. Goes on and on. Coats every millimeter of the palate. So fine and complex. This is from a new estate. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2012. 400 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: This has a fabulous nose of crushed raspberry and blackberry, with coffee, vanilla bean, tar and spices. Full-bodied, with rich, velvety tannins. There's plenty of fruit, but this is refined and persistent on the palate, with pretty oak influences. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2011. 1,500 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: Dark ruby in color, with beautiful aromas of currant, mint and crushed berries. Complex and subtle. Full-bodied, with ultrapolished tannins and gorgeous fruit. This goes on and on. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2012. 1,500 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Deliver currant, toasty oak and coffee aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a lot of rich fruit. Very polished and attractive. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2012. 5,265 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: A tightly wound red, with black cherry, leather and tobacco notes intertwined with dusty tannins. Not that expressive today, but concentrated and long, presenting a fresh, mineral-tinged finish. Best from 2016 through 2025. 400 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: This delivers hints of treacle tart and raisin, with dried fruits and black licorice. Full and round, showing velvety tannins and a long aftertaste of grilled meat, smoky wood and dark fruits. This is nearly always excellent. Best after 2012. 1,250 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Shows very pretty aromas of fresh herbs, currant and raspberry. Full-bodied palate, with a very fine tannin structure and a long, caressing finish. Very solid. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2011. 2,830 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Blackberry and cassis aromas, as well as hints of toasty oak, lead to a full body, with very polished tannins and more light toasty oak. This shows lots of fruit and intensity. Best after 2013. 5,500 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: There's a good dose of new oak to this red, but also focused cherry, raspberry and mineral flavors, set off by the lively acidity as much as the firm tannins. A well-proportioned wine, with a long finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2013 through 2021. 500 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Amore
review: Offering a mix of black pepper and blackberry, this red is tight and compact, with a layer of dusty tannins. Pretty much closed on the finish. Needs time. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2014 through 2020. 500 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Aromas of currant and mint, with a hint of eucalyptus, follow through to a full-bodied palate, with round tannins and a medium finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best after 2009. 3,750 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Tightly knit, showing cherry, currant, tobacco and briar flavors. Balanced in a compact way, with solid grip on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2020. 800 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Intense and complex aromas of crushed blackberry and toasty oak. Medium- to full-bodied, with fine tannins and a balanced, refined finish. A new wine from this region and a good value. Best after 2007. 1,650 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Amore
review: Offers pretty aromas of Cabernet Sauvignon, with fresh herbs and currant that follow through to a medium body. Shows slightly austere tannins and a medium finish. A little bitter. Best after 2011. 2,210 cases made.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: This is focused, with cherry and black currant flavors accented by spice and earth. The tannins have a rustic feel on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2016 through 2021. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Greppicante
review: Black cherry and boysenberry flavors get spice accents from the wood in this juicy red, which finishes just on the dry side. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Best from 2013 through 2018. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Bolgheri Superiore Greppicaia
review: The black cherry and plum fruit is muddled, with stiff tannins and an astringent feel on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 600 cases imported.

name: Pinot Grigio Delle Venezie Tavo
review: This zesty white is framed by zippy acidity, offering melon ball, blood orange and apricot fruit, with a hint of almond on the finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Atlas Peak
review: Simple, with dried currant, herb, cedar and chicory notes, drying on the finish. A late-release 2006 that already tastes tired. Drink now. 100 cases made.

name: Verdeca Valle d'Itria Faraone
review: A minerally white, with hints of smoke and saline underscoring the green melon, crunchy pear and preserved lemon flavors. Balanced and fresh, offering a crisp finish. Drink now through 2018. 1,660 cases made.

name: Locorotondo Antico
review: A modest white, with fresh acidity and a straightforward mix of melon, star fruit and almond. Zesty. Verdeca, Bianco d'Alessano and Fiano Minutolo. Drink now. 830 cases made.

name: Aglianico Beneventano Pietra della Volpe
review: A jammy version, with dark layers of macerated blackberry and cherry, mesquite, salted licorice and spice flavors coating full, yet silky tannins. Powerful, offering a long, berry-filled finish. Drink now through 2017. 350 cases made.

name: Beneventano Pietra della Volpe
review: Dense and tarry, with grippy tannins well-knit to flavors of raspberry pâte de fruit, espresso, dried fig and ground anise. Offers a long, minerally finish, showing hints of woodsy spice and smoke. Decant or give this burly version a little time in the cellar. Best from 2018 through 2026. 250 cases made.

name: Beneventano L'Amore delle Api
review: Lightly mouthwatering, this rich, round, medium- to full-bodied white presents flavors of glazed apple, lime blossom, hazelnut and fleur de sel, set on a silky palate. Well-meshed, with a vibrant, spiced finish. Fiano. Drink now through 2024. 140 cases made.

name: Beneventano Pietra della Volpe
review: Candied black cherry and wild strawberry fruit flavors mix with hints of licorice drop, balsamic and chocolate pudding in this mouthwatering, medium-bodied, grippy red, which features spice and smoke notes on the silky finish. Aglianico. Drink now through 2020. 370 cases made.

name: Beneventano L'Amore delle Api
review: A rich, compact white, with layered flavors of chalk, wild herb and dried flowers framing the dried melon, tangerine and light pineapple notes, leading to a long, tangy finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Piedirosso Beneventano Kerres
review: A dark, toasty style, with notes of hoisin sauce and olive tapenade accenting the dark fig paste and plum confit flavors, which remain light through the creamy finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,600 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano Flora
review: A broad and creamy white, with light acidity for balance and flavors of dried apricot and chamomile. A hint of lemon preserves is underscored by tangy salinity. Drink now through 2020. 550 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano Flora
review: Hints of petrol and smoke underscore the glazed apple, toasted coconut and lemon meringue flavors of this bright, creamy white. Aromatic finish. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano Flora
review: Well-cut acidity and a stony underpinning frame this creamy white, with crisp notes of white peach, crushed hazelnut, lemon meringue and ground ginger. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano Flora
review: A rich, stylish white, with spicy layers of casaba melon, grilled pineapple, lemon drop and wild herbs. Distinct, with a long, chalky finish. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Falanghina Beneventano Flora
review: Ripe and spicy, showing a dark, honeyed hue to the dried apple, pineapple and pastry notes, with hints of lemon drop and Marcona almond filling in the waxy finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Piedirosso Beneventano Kerres
review: Sleek tannins and mouthwatering acidity frame the flavors of crushed black raspberry, black olive, herbed salume and subtle cocoa powder in this stylish, medium-bodied red. Drink now through 2020. 750 cases made.

name: Piedirosso Beneventano Kerres
review: A dark, firm red, with dense layers of blackberry puree, kirsch, pine and spice flavors on a chalky frame. Grippy, with a woodsy aftertaste. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Piedirosso Beneventano Kerres
review: Tea rose and smoke notes waft through this inky red, accenting flavors of blackberry coulis, fresh earth and tobacco. Firm, dusty tannins frame the spiced finish. Drink now through 2017. 800 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Le Vigne di Turàno
review: Elegant and harmonious, with a streak of minerality underscoring the flavors of pure black cherry coulis, dried fig and steeped plum fruit. Wrapped in fine-grained tannins and silky texture, this offers lots of aromatic accents of dried marjoram, ground pepper and anise that build on the lasting finish. Drink now through 2030. 325 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Le Vigne di Turàno
review: There's subtle power to this red, bolstered by integrated, chewy tannins and by the layers of flavor—sun-dried black cherry, date, tobacco, pekoe tea, tar and espresso. The wine shows both texture and finesse, like taffeta instead of silk, with a long finish of medicinal herbs. Drink now through 2024. 1,250 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Le Vigne di Turàno
review: A well-knit and harmonious version, with pretty hints of spice and mocha accenting the fig bread, black cherry pâte de fruit and smoke flavors. Supple tannins emerge on the lightly chewy and herbed finish. Drink now through 2023. 75 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella
review: Tightly knit flavors of steeped cherry, tobacco, loamy earth and licorice, with a hint of pencil shavings, are framed by lightly dusty tannins in this medium-bodied and balanced red. The finish is juicy, with herb and spice notes. Drink now through 2022. 75 cases imported.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Le Vigne di Turàno
review: A modest red, with a satiny texture and subtle flavors of sun-dried date, raisin, grilled nuts and ash. This is lightly tannic, offering a hint of cherry pit on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Superiore Le Vigne di Turàno
review: Baked raspberry and cranberry fruit meets savory accents of tarry smoke and grilled herb in this light- to medium-bodied red, with a modest finish. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Superiore Le Vigne di Turàno
review: Dried strawberry and cranberry fruit mix with light tannins in this modest version. Drink now. 310 cases imported.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Cardisco
review: A hefty red, full of beefy, mushroom aromas and flavors to accent the plum and tobacco notes. They align well with the burly tannins. Rustic and meaty, with a lingering, iron-tinged finish. Best from 2013 through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Vin Santo
review: Remarkably complex and intense, with rich, concentrated and delicious flavors, offering loads of lush smoke, spice, anise, nectarine, peach and cinnamon. The flavors are full and long on the finish. Drink now through 1995.

name: Chianti Colli Aretini
review: Lively Chianti with lovely berry and cherry character, medium body and a crisp finish. Drink now.

name: Cardisco
review: Sharp tannins and acidity carve up the palate. Has ripe fruit flavor and anise, chocolate, smoke and currant notes, but wow, the tannins are tough on the finish. Sangiovese. Best after 1994. 1,000 cases made.

name: Claresco
review: Dry and lean, with clean cherry flavors and a slightly tannic finish. A bit rough in style, but should be serviceable at the table. Malvasia Nera and Canaiolo. 4,000 cases made.

name: Colli della Toscana Centrale Cardisco
review: Pleasant aromas of tea and berries. Medium- to light-bodied. Watery finish. 1,000 cases made.

name: Chianti Colli Aretini Riserva
review: Sour and unpleasant. High acidity. 1,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico
review: Slightly odd sun-dried tomato aromas and flavors. Medium-to-light body; crisp finish.

name: Soave Classico Monte de Toni
review: An intense white, with cream and peach, floral and dry mineral character. Full-bodied, with clean acidity and a long finish of peach tart. This is full of flavor. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Monte di Fice
review: Lovely floral nose, with lavender, ripe citrus fruits and passion fruit. Medium- to full-bodied, with bright acidity keeping the fruit fresh. Dry minerals close in, giving a crisp finish. Compact Soave. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Soave Il Selese
review: This has an intriguing nose, offering ripe peach, with hints of talc and broom bush. Full-bodied, with slightly bitter citrus and almond flavors carried by fresh acidity. The finish is long and intense. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Monte di Fice
review: Lightly honeyed and floral, this silky and finely balanced white offers an accessible palate of stony mineral, ripe nectarine, lime blossom and almond skin. Medium-bodied, with a spicy, tangy finish. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Monte di Fice
review: Floral and spice notes are an aromatic entry for this tangy, light- to medium-bodied white, layered with glazed apple, mandarin orange peel and sliced almond. Well-balanced. Drink now through 2018. 500 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Superiore Monte di Fice
review: Blanched almond dominates the nose, with clean citrus and white peach notes. Full-bodied, with a clean bead of citrus rind and peach pit, fresh acidity and a tight, persistent finish. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Soave Il Selese
review: There's a pleasing interplay of creamy texture and crisp acidity in this stony white, which offers crunchy pear, lemon zest, floral and chopped almond notes. Drink now through 2019. 6,666 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Monte de Toni
review: Balanced by rich notes of toasted almond, nectarine, fleur de sel and grated ginger, this floral white is medium-bodied and backed by bracing acidity, with a zesty finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,000 cases made.

name: Soave Il Selese
review: Bright and snappy, with tangy tangerine, kiwifruit, lime blossom and ground ginger notes. Light-bodied and balanced, this is an easy-drinking white. Drink now through 2017. 6,665 cases made.

name: Soave Classico Monte de Toni
review: Lemon grass and dry, stony minerals on the nose. Medium-bodiedy, with a clean bead of citrus fruit driving through the palate. Good quality, but needs time to unwind. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Big and rich with tobacco, spice and dried berry aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, round, offering velvety tannins and long aftertaste. A bit rustic and rough. Drink now.

name: Rosso di Montalcino
review: Some ripe and sweet fruit here, but the cherry and plum flavors are slightly dominated by stewed tomato character. Harsh, dry finish.

name: Chianti Rufina Riserva
review: Cherry, strawberry and black pepper notes ride this linear red, whose compact finish shuts down rather quickly. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina
review: A firm, compact red, with cherry, earth and tar flavors. Dry finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: I Vigneri
review: A sanguine, mouthwatering red, with plush tannins and a pretty bouquet of tea rose, dried marjoram and mocha aromatics accenting the black cherry puree, plum sauce, anise and smoky mineral notes. Drink now through 2022. 120 cases imported.

name: Carricante Vigna di Milo
review: A lithe version, with well-cut acidity layered with flavors of almond skin, white cherry and lemon preserves. Offers a lightly smoky finish. Drink now through 2016. 80 cases imported.

name: Carmenère Peumo Valley Latina
review: A ripe, ambitious red, with ample toasty oak, baking spices and licorice overtones to the rich macerated plum and roasted fig notes. Remains fresh through the smoky finish. Drink now.

name: Syrah Cachapoal Valley Latina
review: Delivers nice aromas and flavors of alluring mocha and raspberry ganache, along with dark licorice and loam notes. The fleshy finish has nice drive and length. Drink now. 832 cases made.

name: Syrah Peumo Valley Latina
review: Toasty, displaying notes of mesquite, husky spice and cedar, with roasted plum and black cherry fruit framed by medium tannins on the rich finish. Drink now through 2017.

name: Syrah Cachapoal Valley Latina Gran Reserva
review: Toasty, showing firm tobacco and olive streaks, this has a core of mulled currant and dark plum fruit before giving way to a slightly rustic, gamy edge on the finish. Not imported into the U.S. Drink now. 158 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
review: This wine is still a baby--a giant baby. Inky-black in color, rich and fruity on the palate, with great concentration and firm, fresh tannins, it's appealing now but promises a long, rich life ahead. The coffee, plum and cigar-box flavors are reminiscent of a top Bordeaux. Best from 1999 through 2005. 3,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: This red offers ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry, with a lively streak of acidity. The moderate tannins are well integrated and the finish is fresh and fruity. Drink now through 2004. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: This balanced red shows well-knit tannins and expressive flavors of black cherry, toast and vanilla that are intense but not heavy. Not a blockbuster, but will make a consummate partner for food. Best After 1998. 6,665 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: Bright and spicy, this vivid red offers berry, cherry and cassis flavors, with accents of licorice and spice. The tannins are firm yet stay in the background. The wine seems a bit unsettled now, yet it has all the right elements. Drink now through 2003.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: Chocolate aromas and flavors follow through to the long finish. There are also ripe plum and raisin tones, but basically it's a beautiful, one-note wine. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
review: An attractive, polished wine with soft plum flavor and plenty of chocolate notes. Harmonious, though not complex, it flows over the palate into a long finish, rich and ripe with no hard edges. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
review: There's sweet coffee and chocolate oak framing in this maturing red, but the fruit, though bright and laced with cherry, doesn't quite fill out the tannic frame. A bit rustic and simple. Drink now through 2003.

name: Ribera del Duero Reserva
review: Cherry and herb flavors are thick but a bit muddied in this blunt red. Quite concentrated but lacking in definition, this is a rustic style that needs food for balance. Drink now through 2000. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: This grapey red offers simple but exuberant ripe fruit flavors, with fresh acidity and firm tannins that turn a bit astringent on the finish.  Drink now through 2002.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: Plum and light vanilla flavors are simple yet appealing in this round, rather soft red. It turns firmer on the short, jammy finish. Drink now. 25,000 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza
review: Oak aging adds vanilla and coffee flavors, which dominate the dried berry and tobacco notes. It's smooth, light and silky.

name: Ribera del Duero
review: This rustic red offers plum flavor, but it tastes muddy and stewed, and there's a strong barnyard aroma (brett?) that persists through the finish.

name: Barolo Parej
review: A racy style, featuring blueberry, black currant, violet, tar and spice flavors allied to a linear frame. Balanced and complex, building to a long, mineral-tinged and mouthwatering finish. Best from 2021 through 2036. 900 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Laced with plum, mint, tobacco and vanilla flavors, with a hint of chocolate, this generous, fruit-driven Barolo is open and inviting. The tannins circle the fruit on the finish, playing out with a long, spice-tinged aftertaste. Best from 2014 through 2025. 875 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Pure and focused, this red nonetheless remains tight, its cherry, eucalyptus, licorice and mineral flavors bound up with the firm, tensile structure. Shows nice sweetness midpalate, so give it at least two to three years to soften. Fine length. Best from 2014 through 2030. 600 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Textbook cherry, tar and licorice flavors are married to a rich texture, all underlined by a firm grip of refined tannins. This is poised for a promising future. Best from 2016 through 2028. 800 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: This is really gorgeous, with loads of ripe fruit, mineral, plum and berry aromas and flavors. Full-bodied, with lots of ripe, velvety tannins and a long to medium finish. Juicy wine. This is the best I have ever had from here. Best after 2008. 1,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Loads of ripe plum and blackberry, with hints of cedar. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and velvety tannins. Very long and well done. Better this year than in 2000. Best after 2008. 2,500 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: A kiss of oak surrounds the cherry and blueberry flavors in this supple red. The structure is there, with the tannins in balance on the finish. This should come around sooner than most '08s. Best from 2015 through 2029. 800 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Displays very pretty aromas of rose, blackberry and licorice. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a silky, caressing texture. Fine and balanced. Best after 2011. 600 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Big and grapey with spice, berry and cherry character. Full-bodied, chewy tannins and a smoky, berry aftertaste. Delicious and well-structured. Best after 2005. 1,500 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: This shows blackberry, with hints of very ripe strawberry. Full-bodied, with a solid core of fruit and ripe tannins. Turns to vanilla and cedar undertones. Give this time to come around. Best after 2011. 1,400 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Very ripe aromas of blackberry and cherry follow through to a full-bodied palate, with chewy tannins and a fruity finish. Bright and juicy. Best after 2010. 700 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Soft and silky, with lovely berry, light spice and elegant character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Best after 2004. 2,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: A lush version, packed with blackberry, black currant and spice flavors, this red is firm and vibrant. Balanced, but needs a few months to settle down. Drink now through 2019. 8,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Offers fresh blackberry and plum, with hints of porcini. Full-bodied, with chewy tannins and a long finish. Concentrated and rich. A mouthful. Best after 2010. 600 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Superattractive aromas of raspberries, flowers and light spice follow through to a full-bodied palate, with silky tannins and a caressing finish. Pretty. Best after 2008. 420 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Fabulous aromas of dried flowers, with red fruits. Full-bodied, with soft, round yet big tannins and a long, ripe fruit aftertaste. Has plenty of stuffing for aging. Best after 2005. 1,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: In a modern style, this spice-driven red also sports sweet cherry and raspberry flavors. Fruity and medium-bodied, with chewy tannins holding court on the finish. Best from 2014 through 2025. 750 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: This is well-marked by oak, giving a sweetness up front and coating the tannins. Flavors of dried cherry, sweet spice and mineral stay persistent, but the tannins on the finish need time. Best from 2012 through 2023. 650 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Nuj Suj
review: Lovely aromas of crushed blackberry and violet follow through to a full body, with soft, juicy fruit and a long, flavorful finish. Generous and pretty. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: An elegant version, offering raspberry, cherry and floral aromas and flavors allied to a bright, lively frame. Tasty now, this shows balance, intensity and grip on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 10,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Licorice, leather, sandalwood and cedar flavors combine for an enticing effect in this firm red. The tannins finish on the dusty side, but this feels balanced overall. Best from 2018 through 2030. 2,200 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Aromas of freshly sliced plum, with flowers and citrus fruit. Full, rich and chewy, with lots of fruit and ripe tannins. Barbera, Nebbiolo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Best after 2008. 450 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Really floral, with roses and lilac aromas nicely mixed with the ripe, plummy fruit. Full-bodied, with well-focused, silky tannins and a medium finish. Needs time to come together. Nebbiolo, Cabernet and Barbera. Best after 2003. 3,000 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: There's depth to the juicy cherry, currant, menthol and spice aromas and flavors in this red, backed by rough-and-tumble tannins that need time to be tamed. Features a fine, spicy finish. Best from 2015 through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: A mix of pure cherry and licorice flavors marks this elegant yet firm red, which has a solid base of tannins and moderate length. Needs a good steak or vitello. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Some good plum and berry character, with a hint of raisin. Full, chewy and round, with a fruity finish. Lots of wood. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: The boysenberry and pomegranate fruit feels a bit pinched by the tannins and crisp acidity in this red, which is nonetheless intense and lively. Drink now through 2020. 6,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: There's a meaty graphite edge to this red, whose vibrant acidity makes it livelier than many of its 2009 peers, though a touch more austere on the finish now. Best from 2013 through 2018. 12,000 cases made.

name: Brachetto Piemonte Surì Vigin
review: A bright Brachetto, with a lively bead, this offers expressive flavors of candied raspberry, strawberry, milk chocolate and blood orange granita. Drink now. 2,700 cases made.

name: Brachetto Piemonte Surì Virgin
review: Off-dry, with a pleasant effervescence buoying the strawberry, raspberry and spice flavors. Easy to drink alone or with fresh berries. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: A crisp, lemony white, with vibrant structure carrying the flavors. Balanced, leaving a mouthwatering, saline finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: A soft and creamy Moscato, with a lovely juiciness to the lychee, orange sorbet, graham cracker and lime flavors. This definitely leans toward the sweeter end of the style, but shows good balance throughout. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: Fresh, pure and focused, this red exudes cherry, raspberry, floral and licorice flavors. Firms up on the finish, but should pair well with white meat and pasta dishes. Drink now through 2018. 2,400 cases made.

name: Barbaresco Montubert
review: Fresh and clean, with blackberry and floral aromas that follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a bright finish. A little lean, but well-made. Best after 2010. 1,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Beautiful blackberry and cherry aromas and flavors. Medium- to full-bodied, with light tannins and a long, long finish. Unreal for the vintage. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Nuj Suj
review: Blackberry, tobacco and light herb aromas follow through to a medium-to-full body, with light tannins and a fruity, chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Nuj Suj
review: Shows licorice, berry and spice on the nose. Full-bodied, with fine tannins and a clean, fruity finish. Round and flavorful. Drink now.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Elegant, with a supple texture backed by lively acidity, framing sour cherry, cocoa and tobacco flavors. Finishes with tannins and a hint of leather. Best from 2016 through 2026. 3,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Raspberry and blueberry aromas follow through to a medium body, with silky tannins and a long, caressing finish. Lacks a little in the midpalate. Best after 2011. 950 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: A mix of flowers and spice aromas and flavors highlight this rich white. A tangy grapefruit vein underneath continues on the finish. Drink now. 4,600 cases made.

name: Langhe Nej
review: This displays pleasant ripe strawberry and raspberry character, with flowers and mineral that take on a chocolate character on the palate. Medium-bodied, with silky tannins and a medium finish. Pinot Nero. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Langhe Nej
review: Doesn't taste much like Pinot Noir, but I like the berry, very ripe strawberry and smoke character. Full, chewy and fruity aftertaste. Long finish. Pinot Nero. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Lots of ripe apple tart and peach on the nose, with a light honey note. Full-bodied, round and silky, with lots of ripe fruit flavor. Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Bright aromas of peach, honeydew melon and mineral follow through to a fresh and vibrant palate, with medium body and a clean finish. Delicious. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Rich flavors of brandied plum and fruit cake are layered with orange granita and vibrant, citrusy acidity in this well-balanced, creamy Moscato. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Aromas of crushed grape, melon and meringue. Full-bodied and medium sweet, with good fruit. Clean and balanced. This has lots of richness. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: This offers sweet cherry and berry fruit, fading to leather, tobacco and tea as the finish plays out. Balanced on the dry side, with fine length. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: This rich and plummy red has tobacco and bark character, medium body and a smoky finish, with intense toasted oak. Slightly too much new wood now. Needs time to come together. Best after 2002. 2,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: Very good value. Bit earthy but blows off into very grapey, cherry like aromas. Medium-bodied, with ripe fruit flavors and a fresh finish. Better than previously reviewed. Drink now. 20,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Apple and almond notes mark this white. A hint of lemon graces the moderately long finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Clean and crisp, this white evokes apple, almond and straw notes, with a hint of grapefruit peel on the finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: A rich and pretty white, with tropical fruit and melon aromas and flavors. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Pleasant floral mineral nose, with hints of fresh pear and lemon. Medium body, with a soft texture and a delicate, minerally finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: A steely and clean white, with sliced pear, apple and hints of mineral. Medium-bodied, with superclean fruit flavors and a long, refreshing aftertaste. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte LAurora
review: Lemony, with a hint of cream and apple on the nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with medium acidity and a soft-textured, fruity finish. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: A good Dolcetto, with milk chocolate and berry character. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a medium finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Langhe Nej
review: An oaky style, offering berry and earth flavors under a layer of spice. A bit plodding in the end. Drink now through 2015. 2,000 cases made.

name: Langhe Nej
review: Sweet blueberry and floral aromas follow through to a full body, with plenty of fruit and a silky finish. Balanced and easy. Pinot Nero. Best after 2010. 800 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Chewy and rich, with berry, meat and smoke character. Medium-bodied, with lots of fruit and a long, fresh finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Bright, with citrus, floral and light earth character. Medium-bodied, with a crisp, fresh palate and finish. Refreshing. Sauvignon and Chardonnay. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Deliciously fresh and fruity, with pear, peach and mineral aromas and flavors. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Bright, tangy acidity and focused flavors of apricot, pineapple, orange Creamsicle and Meyer lemon mix in this refreshing, lively Moscato, which ends with a tropical finish. Drink now. 7,500 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: A clean, focused Nebbiolo, with a good core of fruit and mineral. Medium-bodied and firm, with a spicy berry finish. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: Offers chocolate and berries, with hints of cedar. Medium- to full-bodied, with velvety tannins and a fruity finish. A fruit-forward, tasty Nebbiolo. Drink now. 850 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Very grapey, with blueberry and mahogany undertones. This is full-bodied, with good density, but a little hollow midpalate. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Shows aromas and flavors of flowers and berries, along with a caramel chocolate note. Medium-bodied, fresh and tasty. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Shows blackberry and mineral aromas, with hints of dried flowers. Medium-bodied, with fresh fruit, bright acidity and a clean finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Plum, mineral and grape character follow through to a medium body, with straightforward fruit and a medium finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Fruity with plenty of strawberry and light plum character. Medium-bodied, with a light finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Juicy and fruity with plum and light chocolate aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, simple finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: Needs air to reveal its floral and wild berry flavors, backed by bracing acidity. Finishes on the crisp side. Best from 2017 through 2020. 6,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: A good Barbera, with plum and tea character, medium body and a balance of fresh acidity. Not too tart, it's just right. A good Piedmont red with a try-me price tag. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.

name: Brachetto Piemonte Surì Vigin
review: Floral, cherry, white raspberry and caramel notes mix in this lively Brachetto, framed by sweet-tart acidity. Tangy. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte Balera
review: Nice, with apple and freshly sliced pear. Medium- to full-bodied, with a creamy texture and a fruity finish. Drink now.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Hints of grass and straw accent pear and melon flavors in this rich, almost oily, white, which hints at mango before ending on a grapefruit peel note. Drink now. 8,600 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Green apple, floral and mineral aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with a fresh finish. Drink now. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 3,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: Fresh berry and milk chocolate aromas follow through to a light body, with lemon peel and light coffee bean flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: A crisp, intense Dolcetto, with fresh plummy and grapey fruit character. Medium-bodied, with a twist of chocolate on the finish. A little short. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: A medium-bodied red, with clean, spicy fruit and well-defined mineral character. Well-balanced, with light, fine tannins and a minerally finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: A fruity white, offering strong acidity as well as lemon and apple character. Medium-bodied, with a simple finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Bright and lively, with pretty apricot and grapefruit zest notes accenting hints of candied pineapple and apple tarte Tatin. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Pretty and fruity, with apple and honey character and hints of melon. Medium-bodied, lightly sweet and delicious. Drink now. 4,200 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: Dried cherry and light vanilla aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, with a fresh finish. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: A rustic red, whose dense tannins frame cherry and earth flavors. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Aromas of sliced plums, with hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, with a stemmy raisin flavor and a slightly rough finish. Give it time. Best after 2001. 3,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: This is very grapey, with hints of citrus fruit. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fresh, lively finish. Drink now. 12,500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: Bright and fruity, with cherry, lemon rind character and bright acidity. A little light. Drink now. 14,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Piemonte Suris Sara
review: Attractive, but doesn't taste much like a Chardonnay. Loads of banana, cream and honey aromas. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a coconut and honey aftertaste. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Rich, with apple and earth flavors, balanced by a crisp finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Sliced papaya and lemon juice on the nose. Full-bodied, with plenty of fruit and a citrusy finish. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte L'Aurora
review: Aromas of lemon, vanilla and hints of tropical fruit follow through to a milky, appley, medium-bodied palate, with good acidity and a clean finish. Drink now. 3,340 cases made.

name: Langhe Nej
review: Shows ripe strawberry and plum on the nose. Medium-bodied, with good fruit, fresh acidity and a medium finish. A simple Pinot Nero. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Big and jammy red, with raisin and spices on the nose. Full-bodied, thick and overdone. Some may love it, but I find it tiring. The 1999 is better. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Minerally. Medium-bodied, with good fruit and a light finish. More like Riesling than Sauvignon and Chardonnay. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: A pleasant red, with firm tannins and a berry and mineral character. Medium body. Chewy finish. Best after 2003. 800 cases imported.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: Floral and citrusy character. Medium-bodied, clean and simple. Drink now. 8,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: A clean, fruity Dolcetto, with fresh, grapey character. Medium-bodied, fresh and easy. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Sliced pear and canned melon aromas follow through to a full body, with a very sweet palate and a simple finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: A pleasing wine with sweet plum character, hints of cedar and a light finish. Fresh still. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Very perfumed on the nose. Medium-bodied, with slightly tart acidity and a berry, fresh herb aftertaste. Drink now. 2,000 cases imported.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Floral and cherry character, with a hint of animal earthiness. Full-bodied, with ripe fruit and a slightly dry finish. Seems not completely clean. Best after 2001. 500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: Rustic, with rather jammy fruit character. A bit dumb. Drink now. 1,670 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Aromas of dates, with a hint of toasted coconut. Firm medium body, with a tight, minerally finish. Doesn't quite pull together. Barbera, Nebbiolo and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: Monferrato White Pafoj
review: Sliced green melon on the nose and palate. Full and fresh, but rather rustic. Sauvignon and Chardonnay. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cortese Piemonte Balera
review: A decent white with apple, dried pineapple and fruit cocktail character. Light finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Dolcetto d'Alba Rousori
review: Almost tart fresh plum character. Light and crisp. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Very sweet and fruity, yet simple. Drink now. 4,160 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Alba Surì di Mù
review: Slight herbal aroma to this wine, but pleasant enough on the palate. Light and fruity. 3,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: A bit tired already, but some decent plum and light chocolate character. 20,000 cases made.

name: Barolo Parej
review: Very earthy and green. Medium-bodied. Aggressive finish. Disappointing. 500 cases imported.

name: Moscato d'Asti La Rosa Selvatica
review: Cheesy and funky, with slightly old peach aromas and flavors. Very sweet. 2,000 cases made.

name: Nebbiolo Langhe Surìsjvan
review: Slight sausage and earthy character. Full-bodied, with loads of chocolate and grilled meat character. Not completely clean. 1,000 cases made.

name: Monferrato Cascina Bricco del Sole
review: Has good ripe fruit, but it's not completely clean, with sausage and tar character. 1,000 cases made.

name: Barbera d'Asti Tabaren
review: A distinctive candied cherry ntoe marks this red. It's short and bitter. 11,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Supple and tart, with leather, earth, black currant, green olive and herbal notes within dry tannin. Drink now through 2007. 500 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Alexander Valley
review: Tart, with modest intensity to watermelon candy and green bean flavors. 750 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Vitaroccia
review: Aromas of forest fruits, with hints of red licorice and fresh flowers. Medium-bodied, silky and fruity, with just a hint of firmness on the fresh finish. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Toscana Rubì delle Pietrose
review: Aromas of blackberry and plum skin follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. Delicious already. Sangiovese, Teroldego and Merlot. Best after 2007. 3,200 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano Vitaroccia
review: Floral and blackberry aromas follow through to a medium body, with fine tannins and a fruity finish. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Rosso di Montepulciano
review: Damsons, with a light orange peel character. Medium-bodied, with fine, fruit-coated tannins and a clean mineral finish, leaving a slightly chocolaty aftertaste. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano
review: Simple and fruity, with plum and chocolate character, medium body and a light finish. Drink now. 1,800 cases made.

name: Vino Nobile di Montepulciano VNM
