review: A simple, fruity red, with plummy fruit and mineral on a medium body. A bit simple, but pizza-friendly. Drink now. 4,500 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Blackberry and cherry character, with a medium body and a clean finish. Simple. Sangiovese and Merlot. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Famatina Valley
review: Hints of straw accent the lemon zest notes that fall a touch short on the finish. Drink now. 600 cases imported.

name: Bonarda Famatina Valley
review: Overtly toasty, with the firm, smoky edge holding sway over modest mulled plum and cherry notes. Drink now. 900 cases imported.

name: Malbec Famatina Valley
review: High-toned, with cherry and vanilla notes that stay trim through the lightly firm finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Famatina Valley
review: Lean, with chalk and celery notes that fade a bit on the finish. 900 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley Victoria Elke Vineyard
review: Distinctive buttery pear and creamy aromas lead to a rich, polished core of flavors built around supple, silky fig and apricot. Rich yet elegant and delicate, with a complex aftertaste. Drink now through 2008. 200 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Anderson Valley Philippine Dennison Vineyard
review: Plenty of cedar and lead pencil aromas from oak. Supple and complex, with understated pear, melon and hazelnut flavors that give it good depth and richness. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Les Révélés
review: Very light in color, but offers plenty of flavor, centering on plum, currant and dark spices on a supple frame. Finish lasts impressively. Best from 1999 through 2002. 800 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Les Révélés
review: Has a softness and a spiciness absent from many 1995s, along with pretty chocolate and herbal overtones to its supple berry flavors. Drink now. 600 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Anderson Valley Les Révélés Elke Vineyard
review: Complex, fragrant aromas of sandalwood, rose petal, ripe cherry and rhubarb, supple and smooth on the palate, with mild tannins. New label from Jim Clendenen of Au Bon Climat. Drink now. 650 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Les Révélés
review: Light in texture and a bit tight with tannin, but generous enough to balance, with leafy, slightly herbal berry flavors. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Syrah Columbia Valley
review: Fresh and juicy, with plum and spice flavors pressing against slightly crunchy tannins. Narrows on the finish. Drink now through 2014. 100 cases made.

name: Thrapsathiri Crete Ocean
review: Apple and pear flavors blend easily and rest on a firm structure in this medium-bodied white. Lemongrass and lime notes show on the fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Vidianó Crete
review: A crisp and savory white, with bracing acidity to the green apple and lime flavors. Green peach and anise notes emerge on the finish, revealing some floral touches. Try as an aperitif. Drink now. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate
review: A supple, graceful, rich and refined youngster, with spicy currant, mint, cedar and tobacco notes that are elegant and balanced. More complex, complete and approachable than the 2006. Drink now through 2018. 510 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oak Knoll District of Napa Valley Blondie Gone Wild Red Hen Vineyard
review: Intense and vibrant, with a lively core of flavors centered on green apple, pear and white peach. Lightly oaked, this will benefit from short-term cellaring. Drink now through 2020. 1,050 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Reserve Block
review: Aromas of mint, bay leaf, mineral, cedar and sage are taut and dry to taste. Full-bodied and muscular, yet the firmness doesn't give the fruit flavors much room to move. Tannic and drying. Best from 2012 through 2018. 197 cases made.

name: Syrah Oakville Money Road Vineyard
review: Compact and trim, with a chewy core of tannins and acidity masking the modest blueberry and mineral flavors. Best after 2018. 150 cases made.

name: Albariño Washington
review: Fresh and appealing, with a glow of pear, butterscotch and lime flavors dancing through the smooth finish. Drink now. 425 cases made.

name: Albariño Yakima Valley
review: Light and appealing, with apple and citrus flavors on a soft frame, lingering pleasantly. Drink now. 1,100 cases made.

name: Albariño Yakima Valley
review: Light and airy, with modest pear and spice flavors on a refreshing frame. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Grenache Gris Mendocino County Rosé Gibson Ranch
review: With a coppery-orange hue, this wine stands out immediately. Those who appreciate quirky wines may enjoy the smoky apricot aromas and dry, slightly oily and salty tannic flavors. Drink now. 122 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Oregon
review: Bright, pretty flavors of melon and citrus make this appealing from the first sip, and the citrus echoes on the lively finish. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon
review: Looks and tastes youthful, with a purple color and spicy, Beaujolais-like, grapey flavors, finishing with firm tannins and pretty currant flavors. Drink now. 210 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Willamette Valley Corral Creek Vineyard
review: Light and distinctive, with earthy, gamy notes weaving through the modest cherry flavors, finishing with some firm tannins. Drink now through 2005. 150 cases made.

name: Pinot Gris Oregon
review: Strikes a tentative balance between citrusy acidity and cidery apple flavors, finishing with a pleasant leesy note. Drink now. 160 cases made.

name: Pinot Noir Oregon Founders Reserve
review: Strong cedary, woody component overpowers anything else in this firm-textured, lightweight red. 130 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Le Bessole
review: An elegant red, with aromatic violet, citrus peel and spice notes leading to wild cherry and black raspberry fruit, layered with supple tannins and a note of fresh, loamy earth that lingers on the chewy finish. Drink now through 2026. 3,700 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Le Bessole
review: Fresh earth and leather accents are layered with a snappy note of cherry and hints of pekoe tea and dried cranberry in this tangy red. Medium-bodied, with an aromatic, herbal finish. Drink now through 2023. 3,700 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Le Bessole
review: Aromas of prune and raisin, with a charred nut note, follow through to a full-bodied palate, with fine, integrated tannins and a medium finish. Best after 2009. 1,840 cases made.

name: Lugana Golfina
review: A vivacious white, light-bodied and elegant, with a juicy mix of Asian pear, orange granita, stone and candied ginger. Offers a lightly spiced, minerally finish. Trebbiano. Drink now through 2019. 100 cases imported.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripassa
review: Dark in color, offering aromas of tar, licorice, prune and pressed flowers. Full-bodied, round and fruity, with a good dose of tannins. Finishes long and firm. The charred wood character works, but this needs a year. Best after 2008. 1,600 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripassa
review: Aromas of ripe black cherry and a tarry, charred meat note. Medium-bodied, with a firm, compact, fruity palate that pulls up rather quickly just now. Very tight. Needs time to unravel. Best after 2009. 2,100 cases made.

name: Amarone della Valpolicella Classico Gino Cordin Riserva
review: Shows ripe damson, pepper and vanilla character on the nose. Full-bodied, with lots of vanilla character and a soft, polished texture. Fruity and enjoyable. Drink now. 485 cases made.

name: Recioto della Valpolicella Classico Le Viole
review: A interesting Recioto, with a fresh herb, vanilla and ripe fruit character. Full and sweet, with a polished mouthfeel and a medium finish. Very grapey. Drink now. 610 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Le Bessole
review: Soft and silky, with black grape and light chocolate character. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fruity, medium finish. Drink now. 1,525 cases made.

name: Valpolicella Classico Superiore Le Bessole
review: A fruity red, with crushed berries, mineral and fine, firm tannins. Medium-bodied. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige Terlaner
review: Gooseberry and lemon peel aromas follow through to a full body, with lots of fruit and a finish of grapefruit and slate. This has lots of flavor. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Lagrein Alto Adige Berger Gei Gries
review: Delicate floral and spice notes accent the flavors of black raspberry, dried strawberry and mocha in this bright, balanced red. Drink now through 2017. 40 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige Terlaner
review: Bright and herbal, with chive and thyme notes accenting the green melon, grapefruit zest and stony mineral flavors. Snappy finish. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Pinot Bianco Alto Adige Terlaner
review: There's apple and melon character on the nose and palate, but this is a little light and simple. Drink now. 450 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Alto Adige Terlaner
review: Pure, tightly packed Sauvignon, with table grape and light lavender character. Medium-bodied, with a subtle, crisp finish. Falls a little short. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Cheesy, leathery flavors make this one tough to warm up to, giving it a dry, earthy character at the expense of a more vivid display of pure fruit. A style that will appeal to some more than others. Decant. Drink now through 2010. 175 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Triple Overtime
review: Distinct ripe pear, apple, guava and Mandarin orange notes are creamy, tangy and delicious, with good intensity, especially on the finish where the juicy peach flavors sail on. Drink now. 398 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Russian River Valley Triple Overtime
review: Rich and full-bodied, with creamy vanilla, honeysuckle and fig flavors that are smooth, polished, deep and complex. Drink now. 360 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley The Hattrick Reserve
review: Displays aromas of ripe currant, spice, dusty oak and fresh earth. Taut and austere on the palate, this is well-balanced and ends with drying tannins. Decant. Drink now through 2012. 394 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Triple Overtime
review: Green bean, herb and dried cherry fruit has an astringent texture.   500 cases made.

name: Hungary Sparkling Semi-Dry
review: A sweet, soft, pleasant bottle of bubbly with fruity, spicy flavors and mouthfilling bubbles. Best as dessert. Drink now.

name: Hungary Sparkling Dry
review: A simple, slightly sweet (despite the Dry designation) bubbly with fruit cocktail flavors.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Squid Ink
review: Rich, ripe and beautifully integrated, with plum and blackberry fruit picking up earthy, spicy notes as the finish rolls on against fine tannins. Drink now through 2015. 2,500 cases made.

name: Grenache-Shiraz McLaren Vale Three Score & 10
review: Polished, round and generous. A silky mouthful of blackberry, cherry and tar flavors that linger effortlessly against very fine tannins. Drink now through 2012. 600 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale Squid Ink
review: Firm in texture, juicy in flavor, with real density to the blackberry, cherry and black olive aromas and flavors, lingering on the chewy finish. Best after 2008. 1,500 cases made.

name: Shiraz McLaren Vale
review: Ripe and round, an attractive style with licorice-scented berry and cherry flavors, finishing with a touch of pepper. Drink now through 2007. 1,713 cases made.

name: Grenache McLaren Vale Three Score and 10
review: Nicely streamlined, a fine-grained red with lively blackberry and pepper flavors that linger enticingly. Drink now. 700 cases made.

name: Chardonnay McLaren Vale
review: Dark and generous, with spicy pear and orange peel aromas and flavors, echoing spicy oak on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Renaissance McLaren Vale
review: Leathery, gamy flavors get in the way of the berry fruit, with a metallic note on the finish. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot. 1,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Collina 21
review: A mix of sweet and spicy elements, this red displays cherry, raspberry, smoke, licorice and clove notes. Well-toned, with integrated tannins for support. Cedar and sweet cherry accents grace the long finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2012 through 2022. 416 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Monte de Sassi
review: Light in weight, with a silky texture, this red offers cherry, herb and tobacco notes. There's sweet fruit at its core, with burly tannins on the finish. Nicely proportioned. Sangiovese with Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Best from 2012 through 2021. 140 cases imported.

name: Chianti Classico Riserva
review: Pretty aromas of blackberry, spice and strawberry follow through to a medium- to full-bodied palate, with a light vanilla and berry aftertaste. Reminiscent of a lovely village Burgundy. This is a new producer, and this year's production is in a Burgundy bottle. Best after 2007. 160 cases made.

name: Toscana Bilaccio
review: Polished, with a touch of milk chocolate gracing the sweet plum, cherry and tobacco flavors. Firmly structured, with a long finish. Sangiovese. Best from 2012 through 2020. 416 cases made.

name: Toscana Clante
review: Well-oaked, this plum- and black cherry-flavored red unfolds with leather and tobacco nuances. Balanced toward the tannins, with a firm, dusty finish. Best from 2014 through 2020. 166 cases made.

name: Toscana Clante
review: Marked by spicy oak, this red is reminiscent of Bourbon, showing some black cherry notes underneath. Supple and medium-bodied, with a roasted vanilla finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2014. 166 cases made.

name: Toscana Rosie
review: A fresh and fruity red, with raspberry and dried fruit that follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a medium finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 120 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Bilaccio
review: Starts delicate and fruity, with plum and light vanilla character and just a hint of earth. Juicy. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chianti Classico Bilaccio
review: Vivid aromas of raspberry and dried cherry, with hints of flowers. Medium-bodied, with fresh acidity and a clean fruity finish. A little light. Drink now. 730 cases made.

name: Toscana Bilaccio
review: There's plenty of cherry fruit in this red, which veers toward the rustic side due to the burr-like tannins. A vanilla note graces the finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2014. 358 cases made.

name: Toscana Bilaccio
review: There's plenty of cherry fruit in this red, which veers toward the rustic side due to the burr-like tannins. A vanilla note graces the finish. Sangiovese. Drink now through 2014.

name: Toscana Collina 21
review: Delicate and fruity, with plum and cherry character. Medium-bodied, with a clean finish. Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Drink now. 240 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: A bright beam of cherry runs through this elegant red. Leather, licorice and tobacco notes add interest as this builds to a lingering aftertaste. Balanced, with sweet, ripe fruit, as well as a savory element. Drink now through 2027. 1,500 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: Fabulous aromas of blueberry, dried cherry and hints of vanilla. Full-bodied, with silky and refined tannins. Builds on the palate, giving a very polished finish. Balanced and attractive. Sangiovese. Best after 2011. 580 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Val d'Arno di Sopra Petruna
review: Graphite, cherry, leather and underbrush aromas and flavors come into play in this supple, expressive red. Elegant, showing a more delicate side of Sangiovese. Drink now through 2024. 170 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Dark in color, with rich currant, toasty oak and light tar. Full-bodied, with lots of ripe, velvety tannins and a long, fruity finish of vanilla. Full-throttle. A blockbuster. Needs some time to mellow some of the new wood. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Best after 2012. 3,750 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Intense aromas of dark chocolate, berry and blackberry follow through to a full-bodied palate, with chewy tannins and a long finish of coffee, berry and chocolate. Solid. The best wine ever from this producer. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Best after 2008. 4,830 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Displays currant and meat on the nose, with some smokiness and fruit-cake notes. Full-bodied, with silky tannins and a juicy fruit finish. Balanced and refined, with good acidity. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Best after 2011. 4,750 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Blackberry and violet on the nose, following through to a full body, with firm yet velvety tannins and a medium-to-long finish. Well-structured and polished. Lots of new wood. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Best after 2009. 3,750 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: New World meets Old here. Lots of strawberry jam, berry and red licorice on the nose. Medium- to full-bodied, with silky and refined tannins and a long, fruity finish. From Ferruccio Ferragamo, the fashion magnate. Best after 2006. 2,250 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: A smooth, exuberant red, boasting raspberry, cherry and black pepper flavors tinged by earth. Vibrant, fresh and balanced, with a fruity, minerally finish. Drink now through 2020. 7,000 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Dill and black olive notes accent the black cherry fruit in this muscular red. Balanced on the dry side. Best from 2015 through 2025. 5,833 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Crisp, bright flavors of raspberry and cherry are accented by dill and olive notes in this fruity red, which stays focused, bright and firm through the finish. Drink now through 2020. 5,833 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: This dense, powerful red, which starts out with plenty of oak spice and resin elements surrounding a core of plum, cherry, tobacco and iron flavors, is still oaky now, needing time to absorb the spice and resinous notes. Firm, dry finish. Better than previously reviewed. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot.  Best from 2018 through 2028. 4,000 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: A generous lashing of oak lends vanilla, clove and toast accents to the blackberry, plum and herb flavors. Though fruity and long, this is heavy-handed, with too much oak. For fans of the style. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Best from 2013 through 2020. 4,166 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Grapey and ripe with toasted oak, coffee and berry character. Full-bodied, velvety tannins and a long finish. Needs to come together still. Extremely well done for a difficult year. Big decrease in price too. Best after 2006. 3,300 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: A fruit bomb. Opulent aromas of crushed fruits, including raspberries and plums. Thick and rich, with a jammy character, yet it's round and delicious. Needs time. Best after 2004. 1,250 cases made.

name: Toscana Polissena
review: Shows very ripe strawberry and flowers, with orange. Very fresh. Full-bodied, with beautiful cherry and raspberry character, fine tannins and a long, caressing finish. A beauty. Sangiovese. Best after 2011. 580 cases made.

name: Val d'Arno di Sopra Borrigiano
review: Exuberant, pure flavors of cherry, wild herb and earth signal this juicy red. Structured, yet stays fresh, finding equilibrium on the finish. Merlot, Syrah and Sangiovese. Drink now through 2022. 1,670 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: Shows depth and power, with plum, cherry, iron and tobacco flavors and muscular tannins. The finish is a bit gruff for now. Think grilled steak. Drink now through 2022. 1,500 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Shows mushroom, fresh meat and loads of fruit. Full-bodied and very, very chewy, with lots of berry and smoke character, almost raisiny. Turns slightly bitter on the finish. A heady, big, jammy wine from a new producer from Tuscany, this needs time. Best after 2005. 580 cases made.

name: Toscana 10º Annata
review: Offers a combination of ripe black currant, blackberry, raspberry and floral aromas and flavors, but the oak is intrusive. Leaves a dry impression. Modern, but impressive. Best from 2013 through 2021. 48,000 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: Rose and blackberry on the nose. Full-bodied, with velvety tannins, bright acidity and a fresh finish. Slightly one-dimensional, but attractive already. Best after 2007. 580 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: A little earthy, but some interesting aromas and flavors of berry, meat and cedar. Medium-bodied, with firm tannins and a slightly austere finish. Best after 2007. 830 cases made.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: Attractive aromas of oak, berry and tea follow through to a full-bodied palate, with chewy tannins and a medium finish. Needs time to develop. Best after 2007. 580 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Dark and rich with blackberry and black cherry flavors, yet rigid and compact. It may stretch out with some aging, but the finish is crisp. Best from 2013 through 2022. 65,000 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Trim, showing black cherry, plum, herb and vanilla flavors. Finishes lean and slightly dry. Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah. Drink now through 2023. 4,500 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Though rich, this red is on the herbal side, backed by tough tannins. Black cherry and black currant flavors save the day, but the finish is astringent. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah. Best from 2016 through 2022. 2,000 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Bright aromas of plums and raspberry jam. Full-bodied, with round and soft tannins and a medium finish. Pretty toasted oak and berry aftertaste. Jammy. Best after 2006. 2,915 cases made.

name: Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Extremely attractive aromas of blueberry, with hints of vanilla, follow through to a medium body, with firm tannins, solid structure and lots of good fruit. A little short at the end, but very good for this wine. Best after 2011. 8,335 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: This red is fresh, with focused black cherry and plum flavors. Accents of spice and tobacco linger. Drink now through 2018. 7,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Polissena
review: Pretty aromas of spearmint, berry and cherry on the nose. Medium- to full-bodied, with soft tannins and a medium finish. Slightly hollow midpalate. New single-vineyard Sangiovese from here. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2005. 550 cases made.

name: Toscana White Lamelle
review: Apple and light lemon flavors mark this bright, mouthwatering white, which is balanced and lingers with citrus and a chalky feel. Chardonnay. Drink now. 1,250 cases made.

name: Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Offers currant and blackberry, with hints of fresh herbs. Medium-bodied, with fine tannins and a fresh finish. A little short. Best after 2009. 6,665 cases made.

name: Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Aromas of chocolate and flowers with hints of red fruits. Medium-bodied, with light tannins and a fruity finish. Delicate if short. Best after 2006. 7,500 cases made.

name: Toscana Polissena
review: Shows an abundance of licorice flavor, along with notes of cherry, tobacco and wild herbs. Finishes long, if on the coarse side. Sangiovese. Best from 2015 through 2022. 580 cases made.

name: Toscana Polissena
review: Notes of cedar and vanilla accent cherry and strawberry flavors in this medium-bodied red. Burly tannins complete the profile. Best from 2013 through 2018.

name: Sangiovese Toscana Polissena
review: Ripe and ready, exuding mushroom, cherry, plum, earth and leather flavors, this is a bit gruff with tannins, lending a rustic feel on the finish. Drink now. 750 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: A fruity wine, with meat and spice character. Medium-bodied, with a slightly tart finish. Drink now. 5,835 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: Cherry and blackberry fruit is at its core, accented by herbal and leafy notes. Pinched finish. Drink now. 7,000 cases made.

name: Toscana Pian di Nova
review: A silky, medium-bodied red, with pure blackberry and vanilla aromas and flavors. A tiny bit short. Drink now. 9,000 cases made.

name: Syrah-Sangiovese Toscana Pian di Nova
review: A simple and fruity red, with blackberry and light spice character. Medium body, fruity finish. Drink now. 6,665 cases made.

Dark-colored, with wonderful aromas of ripe fruit and spices, plus a hint of black pepper. Full-bodied, with soft and velvety tannins and a long, fruity yet subtle finish. Very fine. Not imported into the U.S. Best after 2004. 165 cases made.

name: Toscana
review: Aromas of roses, berries and cherries follow through to a medium-bodied palate, with fine tannins and a pretty finish. Very delicate and refined. Stylish. Best after 2006. 225 cases made.
Rather weedy and unripe for a Cabernet, it has some currant flavor and velvety texture but the vegetal character detracts from the overall quality. Drink now.

name: Brunello di Montalcino
review: Mature, concentrated and earthy, glowing with coffee, chocolate and cedar a romas and flavors, firm structure, thick and chewy on the finish. Drink it up.

name: Syrah Cortona
review: This has a complex, deep and fascinating nose of tar, grilled meat, blackberry and plum. Full-bodied, with gorgeous fruit and velvety tannins. Finishes with wonderful multi-layers of character, from clove and meat to coffee and berries. Best after 2010. 1,665 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona
review: Fresh and floral, with blackberry and tar aromas that follow through to a full body, with chocolate, berry and vanilla flavors. Soft-textured and beautiful. A new small producer from Cortona. Best after 2010. 1,100 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona
review: An inky, dense red, offering saturated flavors of blackberry, pomegranate and licorice, with a saline element and well-integrated tannins. This is extracted, offering a long aftertaste of fruit and savory. Drink now through 2023. 1,000 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona
review: Shows good varietal character, with a meaty, earthy tinge to its blackberry, plum, pepper and tar flavors. Well-integrated, yet structured and long. Best from 2014 through 2021. 1,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona Castagnino
review: This rich red boasts blackberry, black cherry and pepper flavors, with a serious backbone that emerges as this glides to a lingering conclusion. Best from 2013 through 2018. 850 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona Cuculaia
review: Bright, with blackberry, boysenberry and licorice notes, this is tightly wound, ending with a spicy finish. A bit stiff now, but should unwind in a few months. Drink now through 2018. 200 cases made.

name: Syrah Cortona Castagnino
review: Features blueberry and blackberry fruit, with yeasty, whole-grain cracker notes. Compact and dry on the tannic finish. Best from 2015 through 2022. 1,200 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Frascole
review: A Chianti with dried cherry, black pepper and floral character, medium body and a fresh finish. Drink now. 1,700 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Frascole
review: Straightforward and clean, with decent dried cherry and berry character. Medium- to light-bodied, with light tannins and a crisp finish. Drink now. 2,100 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina Frascole Riserva
review: Light-bodied, with mineral and berry character. Light finish. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Chianti Rufina
review: Attractive aromas of berries, mushroom and cherry. Medium-bodied. Light tannins. Finish is a bit diluted. 1,700 cases made.
